title:
IT Officer
- job post
description:
Join TUI BLUE Hotels as the on-site IT Officer who is responsible for ensuring the efficient and secure operation of the hotel's information technology systems. This includes managing the network infrastructure, implementing, and maintaining hardware and software solutions, and supporting colleagues, and helping to safeguard the hotel's digital assets. You will enjoy working in a fabulous location and secure employment (incl. insurance) with plenty of opportunities to contribute your ideas and know-how so we can keep delivering the highest standards of individuality and quality to guests and colleagues.

ABOUT THE JOB
You will provide computer and technology support, installing computer network and supporting colleagues IT questions.
Apply software updates; maintain business and office applications; data administration; help desk for support; cooperation with supplier; adding new features.
Active involvement in coordination and implementation of Information Systems projects in accordance with requirements and guidelines provided by TUI Blue's information systems department.
User maintenance, startup/shutdown, backup, restore, printer control, file maintenance, workstation moves and changes, maintain menus, directory structures and file access, server maintenance.
Talk to the end-user to find out the exact nature of a fault.
Fixing computer equipment, which could also include printers and scanners.
Installing and setting up new equipment and upgrading existing systems
Testing and servicing equipment
Recording problems and their solutions for future reference
Support & Maintenance of IT infrastructure and to maintain the department policies and procedures.
Maintain up-to-date detailed knowledge and records of all system changes.
Prepares a written monthly IT Status report, regarding the systems and issues related to smooth operation of application software and any upgrade.
Committed to teamwork and achieving team successes.
Solves technical or operational problems as reported by the users.
You will keep an accurate inventory and record of all hardware, software and manuals purchased by the hotel.
Acts as the primary contact (in the absence of the IT Manager) for all outside agents in all computer technology related matters.

ABOUT YOU
BA/BSc in Information Systems, Computer Science, or diploma in relevant field.
Previous hotel-related experience desired.
Proven experience as IT Officer or relevant role.
Physical mobility and stamina required.
Clear & effective communication.
Strong network technical background.
Detailed knowledge of operating systems
Strong knowledge in TCP/IP networking is essential.
Microsoft certifications would be an additional benefit.
Language required – Good command of English and local langauge. Other European languages would be highly advantageous.
We love to see your uniqueness shine through and inspire the future of travel. If you would like to read more about what Diversity & Inclusion means to us simply visit Our DNA.

ABOUT OUR OFFER
Competitive local salary and benefits as standard
16 days annual leave PLUS 11 days public holiday
1.5 days off per week
Accommodation and meals included
Compulsory insurance according to Vietnamese laws, Accident Insurance 24/7
Opportunity to develop career path with TUI BLUE – world’s leading leisure hotel brand
Training courses with great career development opportunities
Incentives, activities, and benefits as per corporate policy

TUI BLUE is the global flagship hotel brand of the TUI Group combining the best aspects of both individual and all-inclusive holidays with outstanding quality and modernity. Our hotel brand stands out from the crowd with first-class locations, regional architecture, an innovative technology concept with a unique blend of local and contemporary cuisine and BLUEf!t® sport and leisure facilities.

TUI is the world’s leading tourism group. The broad portfolio gathered under the Group umbrella consists of strong tour operators, 1,600 travel agencies and leading online portals, five airlines with around 150 aircraft, over 400 hotels, 15 cruise liners and many incoming agencies in all major holiday destinations around the globe. It covers the entire tourism value chain under one roof. This integrated offering enables us to provide our 27 million customers with an unmatched holiday experience in 180 regions.

#TUIBLUE #TUIBLUEHotels #TUIBLUECareers #LetsTUIit

title:

- job post
description:
TeamMarketing
Tình trạngĐang mở
Nơi làm việcRemote
Loại hình công việcFull-time

About CyStack
CyStack is a pioneering cybersecurity company based in Vietnam. We specialize in developing innovative security products for businesses and individuals, including the bug bounty platform WhiteHub, the password manager Locker, and the automated vulnerability scanner CyStack Web Security.
CyStack's award-winning solutions focus on data protection, cyber attack prevention, and security risk management for enterprises. Our exceptional researchers are renowned speakers at top cybersecurity conferences and skilled bug hunters, acknowledged in the Hall of Fame of Global Tech Giants for discovering critical vulnerabilities.
About the team and role
The Content Team is part of the Marketing department at CyStack. This specific position within the team is dedicated to the writing and editing of content related to our project: Locker Password Manager, along with other responsibilities encompassing press releases, product documents, and articles for our websites, blogs, and social networks.
You will
Remote working position - collaborate with teams for effective online coordination.
Develop a marketing plan aligned with project goals and vision.
Write and publish various types of content for the project's website, landing pages, and social media.
Create marketing copy for product advertisements, industry-related blog posts, and social media promotions.
Monitor and analyze social and website metrics to improve marketing strategies.
Generate content for websites, fan pages, newsletters, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other marketing channels.
Manage content channels (Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter, website, email, etc.) and run social media campaigns for increased audience engagement.
Collaborate with in-house or external creative agencies for designing marketing materials such as scripts for videos.
Additional duties will be discussed during the interview.
You may be a suitable candidate for this role if you
Have a minimum of 1 year of experience in a similar position in the software or tech sector.
Hold a Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Journalism, Economics, or a relevant discipline.
Possess familiarity with social media and web analytics tools (e.g., WebTrends), and having a strong knowledge of the market, competitors, and industry trends is advantageous.
Demonstrate a fundamental understanding of content marketing tactics, including digital advertising and social media marketing.
Exhibit creativity and commercial awareness.
Are proficient in Microsoft Office, PDF software, and Photoshop.
Can thrive in a fast-paced international environment and handle large-scale business challenges.
Preferably, have an overall IELTS score of 6.0 or higher.
Benefits
Competitive salary along with social insurance and a 13th-month salary.
Exciting opportunities to create meaningful contributions in a rapidly expanding company within a thriving industry, collaborating with passionate and experienced colleagues.
An inspiring and supportive work environment, fostering strong connections with other technology companies.
Additional benefits include premium health insurance and yearly travel trips.
How to apply
We recruit for all of our vacancies on a rolling basis, so we strongly suggest you apply as early as possible.
We look forward to receiving your CV/Resume, which should include the following information:
Name
Education and work experience
Achievements, awards, certificates
A photo of the IELTS certificate or equivalent (if any)
A portfolio of any relevant work (in English)
A link to your LinkedIn profile (if any)
Links to the blogs you’ve managed (if any)
Links to the writing pieces that show your editorial skills (if any)

Please send your CV/Resume to hr@cystack.net with the title [Job application] Content Executive - Your full name
For more information contact: Mr. Thanh – HR Management. Tel: +84 832 447 899

title:
Digital Trade STTA Expert
- job post
description:
USAID Vietnam Digital Trade Activity
SCOPE OF WORK
Digital Trade STTA Expert
Date:
Position: STTA Digital Trade Expert
Reports to: USAID Vietnam Digital Trade Director
Location: VDT Office in Hanoi (7F Hanoi Tower, 49 Hai Ba Trung Street)
Eligibility: Vietnamese Nationals
LOE: 70 days
Period of Performance: December 2023- April 2025
International Development Group LLC is an international development consulting firm that assists donors, governments, and the private sector to create and take advantage of opportunities for sustainable, broad-based economic development and poverty reduction. IDG provides entrepreneurs and policymakers with the practical tools needed to achieve real and measurable impact for their communities and countries. IDG assistance programs aim to build the capacity, skills, and knowledge of local individuals and institutions in the public, private, and not-for-profit sectors, fostering synergies between local knowledge and international experience.
Position Description
The VDT is a two-year project (2023-2025) addressing regulatory gaps and promoting private sector engagement in the rapidly growing digital economy. USAID VDT activity supports the Ministry of Industry and Trade’s (MOIT) implementation of frameworks that facilitate digital trade, with an emphasis on supporting MOIT in holding public-private dialogues to ensure implementation is done in consultation with the private sector. Regulations that are responsive to private sector needs remove bottlenecks in trade faced by enterprises and increase regulatory transparency, helping to shape an e-commerce sector where enterprises of all sizes can benefit. The activity encourages the participation of small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in digital trade by introducing new business models and other best practices, such as traceability of goods, as well as facilitating cross-border connections between enterprises via MOIT’s digital trade promotion platform.
The Digital Trade Expert will play a pivotal role in providing substantial inputs and up-to-date advice to the VDT management team in the implementation of the VDT activity, and spearheading the development of public-private partnership initiatives and activities within the framework of a digital trade project. The Digital Trade Expert must have a strong understanding of international trade policies, regulations, and agreements, especially in the context of Vietnam's trade landscape. The incumbent has knowledge of digital trade policies, e-commerce regulations, and emerging trends in global trade. The incumbent should have a general understanding on data protection, privacy laws, and cybersecurity measures in the context of digital trade; has the ability to ensure compliance with international standards and local regulations.
This role involves exploring, implementing, and advocating for opportunities to engage the private sector, public sector, and relevant business community stakeholders in the context of digital trade policy and procedures. The expert will analyze the impact of trade policies on the digital economy and propose effective strategies. The expert will focus on areas such as digital trade policy development and reforms, supply chain digitization and traceability, digital trade promotion. The expert will promote ideas to the private sector on how to improve their capacity to interact with the public sector to promote digital trade reforms enabling businesses to fully benefit from the Information Technology tools.
Key Tasks/Responsibilities:
Responsibilities:
Collaborate in implementing the VDT Work Plan, with a particular focus on contributing technical inputs on digital trade in every single activity in the work plan.
Actively participate in and contribute to various aspects of the project on digital trade as directed by the VDT Director
Support the capacity building on related digital trade activities in the work plan.
Provide technical advice and inputs for 2 components of (i) supporting implementation of regulations with private sector inputs; and (ii) increasing private sector engagement in digital trade.
Inform potential opportunities and challenges that are related to activities to provide timely recommendations for actions to achieve project’s goals.
Support the team in engaging the relevant representatives of the private sector (associations, chambers of commerce, enterprises) related to the topics covered by VDT activities.
Identify low-hanging fruit and long-term achievements for VDT in implementation of the Work Plan. .
Provide expertise and leadership in designing, formalizing, and managing innovative public-private partnerships on digital trade.
NB:
The Digital Trade STTA will present a monthly plan to the VDT director, outlining the tasks to be implemented and the corresponding schedule for their execution, including the number of necessary man-days.
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree or higher in economics, business administration, trade policy, international trade, IT-related studies, or similar fields.
Knowledge in digital economy, e-commerce and international trade.
Significant and proven experience of working or collaborating with the private sector in Vietnam is essential.
Demonstrated and substantial experience in actively engaging or collaborating with the private sector in the realm of digital trade-related matters is preferred.
Able to solve problems as well as exercise considerable analysis and judgment to identify solutions.
Strong communication, interpersonal, and leadership skills. Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Proficient in word processing, spreadsheets and office software such as Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Google Applications; and
Fluency in English and Vietnamese.
Interested candidates should send applications to ipop_vietnam_recruitment@internationaldevelopmentgroup.com before December 8, 2023.

IDG

Hanoi
Application Deadline:
Fri, 2023-12-08

description:
Our Purpose
We work to connect and power an inclusive, digital economy that benefits everyone, everywhere by making transactions safe, simple, smart and accessible. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. Our decency quotient, or DQ, drives our culture and everything we do inside and outside of our company. We cultivate a
culture of inclusion
for all employees that respects their individual strengths, views, and experiences. We believe that our differences enable us to be a better team – one that makes better decisions, drives innovation and delivers better business results.
Title and Summary
Managing Consultant, Advisors Business Development
Mastercard Advisors, the professional services arm of Mastercard 's Data & Services organization, provides payments-focused consulting services to financial institutions and merchants worldwide. With its unique category expertise, deep understanding of customer needs and successful track record in addressing complex challenges throughout the payments lifecycle, Mastercard Advisors addresses the challenges and opportunities of its clients, enhances Mastercard's strategic and tactical performance and establishes Mastercard's global thought-leadership pre-eminence.

Are you motivated by developing new insights into issues and developing recommendations that add real value to clients?

Can you develop strategies and programs for regional and global clients ?

Do you want to play a key role in driving a world beyond cash?

The Manager, Business Development is an active team member who contributes to sales targets and opportunity generation and closing with Mastercard Advisors clients. Whilst this individual is not expected to be a subject matter expert in the payment cards industry, they will demonstrate expertise in consulting sales management experience and professional problem-solving skills.

Responsibilities

Develop relevant and value-creating analysis and insight for our clients

Build strategies, propositions & operating models independently or as part of a consulting team

Apply a range of quantitative and qualitative analytical techniques to rigorously identify client issues

Synthesize analysis into clear, sound proposals and recommendations, taking responsibility for structuring and writing reports and steering committee presentations to high accuracy and quality standards

For small to medium engagements, assumes overall project management responsibilities for projects; identifies project staffing resources. Develops, defines and reviews required analyses

Develop effective working relationships with mid to senior level client management

Implements/communicates strategies to achieve goals, acts as advisor to and maintains ongoing relationships with client executives.

Proactively seek new knowledge and skills and facilitate the development of intellectual capital

Support MasterCard Advisors and local market account teams in client relationship management and business development effort

Experience

Proven consulting experience at a top-rated firm or equivalent business management experience and internal consulting experience in a major financial institution

Bachelors degree or equivalent qualification. Advanced degree or MBA preferred

Professional level English language capability is required

Strong analytical, interpretive and problem solving skills, including the proven ability to interpret large amounts of data, some of it ambiguous, and translate it into concise rational output that includes recommendations based upon core findings.

Strong presence & communication skills – both interpersonal & written

Excellent client management & engagement management skills

Proven team player with proven ability to work with all levels in a highly intellectual, collaborative, and fast paced
Corporate Security Responsibility

All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title:
Senior Data Analytics
- job post
description:
Senior Data Analytics
Date: 1 Nov 2023
Type of Employment: Permanent Full Time
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, VN
Title: Senior Data Analytics

Are you ready to unleash your potential?

At Deloitte, our purpose is to make an impact that matters for our clients, our people, and the communities we serve.

We believe we have a responsibility to be a force for good, and WorldImpact is our portfolio of initiatives focused on making a tangible impact on society’s biggest challenges and creating a better future. We strive to advise clients on how to deliver purpose-led growth and embed more equitable, inclusive as well as sustainable business practices.

Hence, we seek talented individuals driven to excel and innovate, working together to achieve our shared goals.

We are committed to creating positive work experiences that foster a culture of respect and inclusion, where diverse perspectives are celebrated, and everyone is recognised for their contributions.

Ready to unleash your potential with us? Join the winning team now!

Work you’ll do

Analyze and formulate business problems into practical analytics solutions
Provide analytics services to help clients develop or improve analytics services
Design and build data analytics tools in response to changes in client or firm requirements
Use descriptive analytics to analyze accounting and financial data extracted from client’s systems to find out risk findings for audit engagements
Develop analytical models and solutions by using predictive analytics, statistics, machine learning, optimal sampling, experimental design and other techniques
Deliver clear and actionable recommendations to all stakeholders
Work on external and internal training, including prepare dataset and dashboard creation to client industry, investigate key metrics and design business analytics case studies in the client’s industry for on-site presentation.

Your role as a leader

At Deloitte, we believe in the importance of empowering our people to be leaders at all levels. We connect our purpose and shared values to identify issues as well as to make an impact that matters to our clients, people and the communities. Additionally, Senior Associates / Senior Consultants / Assistant Managers across our Firm are expected to:

Actively seek out developmental opportunities for growth, act as strong brand ambassadors for the firm as well as share their knowledge and experience with others.
Respect the needs of their colleagues and build up cooperative relationships.
Understand the goals of our internal and external stakeholder to set personal priorities as well as align their teams’ work to achieve the objectives.
Constantly challenge themselves, collaborate with others to deliver on tasks and take accountability for the results.
Build productive relationships and communicate effectively in order to positively influence teams and other stakeholders.
Offer insights based on a solid understanding of what makes Deloitte successful.
Project integrity and confidence while motivating others through team collaboration as well as recognising individual strengths, differences, and contributions.
Understand disruptive trends and promote potential opportunities for improvement.


Requirements

Bachelor's Degree or Above in quantitative fields such as Data Science/Analytics, AI, Computer Science/Engineering, Information System, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Operations Research, Finance, Accounting, Economics, or related fields
At least 2 years of experience in data analytics or data science
Strong experienced in SQL/BI tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI, Excel charts), data management skill is a plus
Experienced in Python/R (with data analytics frameworks: Pandas, Numpy, Glob, Stats, etc.)
Ability to analyze and break down complex concepts and interpret technical findings into clear language that can be communicated to team members and clients
Team player mentality, fun professional
Professional "get it done" attitude and work ethic; moves fast

Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified. Candidates will only be contacted by authorised Deloitte Recruiters via firm’s business contact number or business email address.
Requisition ID: 100048
In Vietnam, the services are provided by Deloitte Vietnam Company Limited and other related entities in Vietnam ("Deloitte in Vietnam"), which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Vietnam, which is within the Deloitte Network, is the entity that is providing this Website.

Job Description & Summary
A career in our Oracle Risk Assurance practice, within Information Technology Risk Assurance will allow you to develop and apply strategies that help clients leverage enterprise technologies so they can get a higher return on their investment, mitigate risks, streamline processes, and find operational inefficiencies. The work revolves around creative problem solving and applying innovative technologies to enable strategies that increase the value of the applications that run our client’s business, mitigate risk and find operational inefficiencies.

Our focus is on creating effective and efficient design for the most important business, security and compliance processes for our clients. We touch on aspects of application security, areas prone to fraud and financial misstatement, and streamline processes that are part of our client’s core business so they can get a higher return on this key investment. Using innovative, and proprietary technologies, we help to bridge the gap between business stakeholders, compliance functions and Information Technology teams to assist in understanding how to embrace new ways of working, while limiting their financial and operational risk profile. We use knowledge of financial system design, risk mitigation, business process design, data integrity, security and use of data analytics.
To really stand out and make us fit for the future in a constantly changing world, each and every one of us at PwC needs to be a purpose-led and values-driven leader at every level. To help us achieve this we have the PwC Professional; our global leadership development framework. It gives us a single set of expectations across our lines, geographies and career paths, and provides transparency on the skills we need as individuals to be successful and progress in our careers, now and in the future.

title:

- job post
description:
In short
The world’s fastest growing sports company is seeking a Product Planner to join the supply chain team. With your business partnering experience and your analytical skills, your mission will be focusing on managing purchase orders, planning & logistics in production with our manufacturing partners for the next-level of On’s products, and contributing to a lead-time reduction program. Based in Ho Chi Minh City with frequent travel within Asia (if allowed), this is a highly cross-functional role that will need to partner with, coordinate and influence multiple departments and teams across the region.
Your Mission
Manage purchase orders with our manufacturing partners to ensure on time order confirmation and on time deliveries.
Manage order confirmation on-time
Manage orders completed & inspected before/on First Confirmed Ready Date
Manage on-time launch
Collaborate with all functional teams to solve all issues to avoid pending order confirmation or delaying orders
Ensure the data updated on system is accurate & up to date
Manage capacity booking and planning, key processes (sole and other key processes planning) anticipate potential production bottle-necks.
Approve the facilities preparation for at least 6 months period of capacity
Approve the line plan & target output based on on-hand orders
Update the available capacity twice per month for PO placement
Tracking the actual production & alert the risk for immediate actions
Tracking the buy-ready & ramp-up plan of new projects to manage the capacity fulfillment
Anticipate all (potential) risks & work on solutions, such as production delay or pull forwards
Manage container loading and booking with our manufacturing partners.
Manage our manufacturing partners to co-ordinate the market’s packaging and labelling instructions.
Manage price referencing to ensure correct pricing in the system.
Manage component stocks with accuracy for CPP (material buy in advance) program.
Work with our project team to implement our future short lead time program
Focus on driving GTM tasks, including but not limited to working cross functionally with other teams to monitor on-time buy-ready and schedule the launch on-time.

Your story
At least 5 years of experience in footwear production planning.
Fluent in English and Vietnamese. Communicative Mandarin is a plus.
Highly attentive to detail, function and quality. Good Excel and analytical skills
Able to travel on a regular basis between On’s manufacturing partners in the South of Vietnam
An entrepreneurial and open mindset, an eagerness for differentiation and a natural push for excellence
Able to balance creativity with organization and discipline in a fast-paced environment

title:
Intern
- job post
description:
Research Center for Inclusion
INTRODUCTION
The Research Center for Inclusion (RCI) is legally registered in 2018 with Ministry of Science and Technology in Vietnam and under coordination and management of the government focal point of Southeast Asian Research Association of Vietnam (SEARAV).
RCI is constituted as a result of the localization of the Netherlands Leprosy Relief (NLR) Mekong that operated in Vietnam in 1981 and managed programs on leprosy disease control, disability and inclusion of persons with disability in Cambodia, Myanmar, Vietnam, China, Laos and Thailand. RCI continues NLR’s expertise, experience and network established throughout 35 years in Vietnam.
RCI envisions a world in which people with disability, including children and persons affected by leprosy enjoy equal rights and full inclusion in society. The organization works on five priority areas: 1) Inclusive education, 2) Social inclusion, 3) Inclusive Health and Community-Based Rehabilitation (CBR), 4) Sexual and Reproductive Health and Rights and 5) Research. For further information please visit our website: https://rci-nlr.org/
RCI office is seeking a motivated Vietnamese national for the position of:
Intern
with a keen interest in people with disabilities and disability issues;
who can work as an active, supportive and responsible team member in our office and in the field within the context of the framework of RCI’s support in Vietnam.
For further details please see the Job Profile below.
Job Profile
JOB TITLE: INTERN
KEY OBJECTIVES: The Intern will work closely with Project Team members and the Office Manager to assist them with activities related to project implementation, office running and communication.
REPORT TO: Office Manager
START DATE: As soon as possible
MAIN TASKS
PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION
Work closely with project team to assist in planning, implementing and monitoring project activities
Prepare project/activity related-news, press release, articles for public media and internal launch
Advise project team on formats and methods of organizing events to best attract target audiences, to promote project messages and to brand RCI
Input and track data and information in M&E project templates and files
Provide translation and interpretation services from English to Vietnamese language and vice versa
Contribute to project documentation e.g development of manuals, books, videos, stories, the most significant of change etc.
Communicate with relevant stakeholders as required
Contribute to the organisation of RCI’s international, regional and national events, global movement or campaigns
Participate in M&E trips to partner organizations in Vietnam
Other tasks as required by project team member
OFFICE OPERATION
The Intern will assist the Office Manager in maintaining office services and assist the project team to conduct activities. S/he can work independently or as assigned by their line-manager. The key tasks include:
Control correspondences
Liaise with suppliers, other agencies, organizations and groups
Maintain office equipment
Coordinate shipping and mailing packages, faxing, copying, and filing
Arrange all logistic procedures such as hotel, visas for foreign visitors, flight booking, car rental, workshops and meeting
Provide inputs or review articles, stories, video etc prior to uploading on RCI website and Facebook
Other assignments as required by the line-manager
The intern will not have an employment contract. She or he will receive an allowance of 3,000,000 VND per month for lunch and travel cost.
Application
Interested applicants are invited to submit their application to lan.ntp@nlrmekong.org as soon as possible. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
In the subject line, please insert: Application for Intern.

title:
National Technical Consultant(s): Data collection for establishing carbon inventory and developing emissions mitigation strategy for black pepper suppliers in Vietnam
- job post
description:
National Technical Consultant(s): Data collection for establishing carbon inventory and developing emissions mitigation strategy for black pepper suppliers in Vietnam
May 30th, 2023
Duration:

Up to 180 hours (22.5 days) between June 2023 and January, 2024 for one or two national individual consultants

Duty Station:
Home-based in Vietnam, with travel to the field in Dak Lak, Dak Nong, Ba Ria Vung Tau


1. JOB SUMMARY
Winrock International works with people around the world to increase economic opportunity, sustain natural resources, and protect the environment.
Winrock is seeking one or more Technical Consultants to lead the data collection process of establishing carbon inventories for black pepper suppliers and advise on emissions mitigation strategy and implementation in the Dak Lak, Dak Nong, Ba Ria Vung Tau provinces in Viet Nam.
The Technical Consultant(s) will develop and apply expertise and advanced technical knowledge in one or more of the following areas: greenhouse gas (GHG) inventories, carbon management, energy emissions, and/or transportation emissions to support technical feasibility studies and assessments.
2. ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES

The technical consultant(s) are responsible for the following tasks:
Serve as a liaison with organizations in the black pepper supply chain in provinces of Vietnam (e.g., farmers, suppliers and processers of black pepper), facilitating communications, providing translations, and representing Winrock International.
Coordinate and collaborate with black pepper suppliers and farms to understand their business operations, set expectations of the process, and ensure smooth communications between the suppliers and Winrock International throughout the project.
Collect supplier-specific and activity-based data required to quantify the suppliers' GHG emissions in adherence to the Greenhouse Gas Protocol.
Advise on emissions mitigation strategies related to electricity, industry, and transport to help the black pepper suppliers reduce their emissions and achieve decarbonization goals.


3. QUALIFICATIONS
Understanding of organizational GHG accounting standards and methods.
Experience with GHG calculation methodologies and emission factors.
Knowledge of black pepper and/or coffee cultivation practices and carbon management related to their production.
Knowledge of Viet Nam's energy and/or transportation sectors.
Knowledge of agronomy and fertilizer application.
Excellent management, communication, and organizational skills are required.
Excellent stakeholder engagement skills are required.
Fluency in English and Vietnamese are required.
Knowledge of decarbonization potential in black pepper production preferred.
Experience with conducting training in carbon management, emissions mitigation, or target-setting preferred.
Given the diversity of skills needed, Winrock anticipates hiring more than one consultant to conduct different components of this work. For that reason, interested individuals are encouraged to apply even if they do not meet all the qualifications.


We would like to thank all applicants for their interest but only candidates who meet requisite criteria and are shortlisted will be contacted. Applications will be accepted until June 16th, 2023.

Winrock is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and value diversity and inclusiveness. Winrock recruits, employs, trains, promotes and compensates regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law.

At Winrock we have a clear mission: Empower the disadvantaged, increase economic opportunity and sustain natural resources through unwavering dedication to accountability, equity, innovation, integrity and transformation.

Winrock knows that its success comes from the hard work and steadfast dedication of its diverse workforce. Winrock remains committed to maintaining diversity, inclusion and equity across the entire organization

Our honors include the Cannes Lions Grand Prix for PR; Advertising Age’s 2019 A-List; the Holmes Report’s 2018 Global Digital Agency of the Year; and, five times, Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work. Since our founding in 1952, we have remained an independent, family-run business. Edelman owns specialty companies Edelman Data & Intelligence (DxI) and United Entertainment Group (entertainment, sports, lifestyle).

For more information please visit: www.edelman.com

title:

- job post
description:
What You Will Do
Our consulting team Financial Services has plan to expand and growth rapidly this year. Therefore, we are welcome qualified candidates to join our dynamic team.

About the opportunity
You are looking for start your career path as financial advisor in a global advisory firm? Then join EY and gain experiences that will last a lifetime.

As a member in our team, you will execute advisory projects, assist Engagement Manager to timely complete the projects as planned in a cost-effective manner.
Internal trainings will be continuously held to get you updated to the latest risk management practices and statutory regulations.
Opportunities to become Consultant in FSO advisory - Financial Services Management

Detailed responsibilities:
Participate as a member in advisory projects nature to provides IT support service to the clients
Play project admin to input and manage project plan, budget and RAID log
Identify project potential risk and recommend solution
Prepare project status with highlight events
Deliver advisory services to our clients
Assist in preparation of regular status reports / MIS and analysis for effective planning and decision making
Understand our service offerings and actively identify opportunities to better serve clients;
Manage the engagements in compliance with EY methodologies

What You Are Good At
** Educational background & certifications:
Education background in Business/Economics/ MIS, or equivalent programmes.
Education background in Technology and Management
Other qualifications and memberships would be a plus.

** Mandatory requirements for Business Consultant position:
Knowledge in one or more of the following areas: accounting, banking and system implementation.
Understanding of the business organizations and processes
At least 4 years experience in projects related to system implementation/system support serrvice/IT help desk in banking industry
Experience with system in banking industry is a plus
Willing to be on-side and work on-field in long term period (6-12 months)

** Other skills and requirements:
Excellent oral and written English communication skills, with the ability to interact effectively with all levels of management;
Good skills in presentation, interpretation, facilitation, team management and other soft skills;
Take responsibility for your team, your work and your client.
Ability to travel both domestically and internationally.

What working at EY offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package where you’ll be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.

EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

title:
Data Management Officer
- job post
description:
Job description - Data Management Officer
Job code: 20102301
Job category: Research Operations
Job level: Officer
Type of work: Full-time
Duration: 12 months with possibility of subsequent extension
Location: either Hanoi or HCMC
Regional office: either Hanoi or HCMC
Direct report: Data Manager
Dotted-line reporting: Clinical Trial Manager
Tentative start date: As soon as in November 2023
Organisation: Woolcock Institute of Medical Research
The Woolcock Institute of Medical Research is affiliated with the University of Sydney in Australia and is recognized as one of the leading research institutions for respiratory diseases and sleep disorders. Operating in Vietnam since 2009, we have undertaken large operational, epidemiological, and clinical research projects and run training in epidemiological and operational research methods for Vietnamese doctors and public health workers. The Woolcock Institute has four research centres and offices in Ha Noi, Ho Chi Minh City, Ca Mau, and Can Tho. Currently, we directly employ about 80 full-time staff and coordinate multiple study projects within lung health management and treatment, antimicrobial resistance across eleven provinces. We are rapidly expanding our activities in the southern region, particularly Ho Chi Minh City, and looking for research enthusiasts to join our young and professional team.
For more information about us, please visit:
Woolcock Institute of Medical Research in Sydney, Australia: www.woolcock.org.au
Woolcock Institute of Medical Research in Vietnam: www.woolcockvietnam.org
Roles:
The Data Management Officer is responsible for overviewing and carrying out data management tasks of assigned research projects.
Reports to:
Data Manager
Study Manager/Coordinator
Key staff working with the project:
Study Officers
Study Manager/Coordinator
Laboratory staff
The data management team
Duties and Responsibilities:
Data collection:
Formulate, implement, and enforce proper data collection policies and procedures.
Train reporting agencies on data collection tools and equipment.
Implement data quality control activities.
Data management:
Develop and implement data management plans.
Develop and implement an online management system.
Oversee data management work performed by project staff and partners as delegated.
Ensure the data system (Research Tool) is operational.
Manage data entry works/teams.
Troubleshoot data submission errors and data error issues.
Provide support to the project team for Case Report Form/Query processing according to SOPs and policies as appropriate.
Perform and document procedures for data preparation including data cleaning.
Be responsible for quality control procedures (including, but not limited to, random phone calls to check visits, and also checking data entry quality).
Regularly back up data.
Ensure data management procedures and projects have set timelines and meet established deadlines.
Data reporting and analysis.
Develop and update data analysis Dashboard.
Working with Sydney Data management team on data issues.
Understand and ensure privacy law and standards.
Produce weekly, monthly, and annual data reports.
Develop ad-hoc reports as necessary.
Assist in defining and/or creating data listings, summary table validation, data specifications, and/or process data transfers in preparation for statistical review and/or data management audit.
Participate in the preparation and presentation of data, when applicable.
Assist in developing means to correct the problems.
Perform other duties reasonably related to the position as directed by manager.
Required education, skills and qualities:
University degree in Science, Public Health or related field and IT
Preferably at least 3 years of experience in data management for research projects.
Working experience with online data collection and management will be an advantage (ODK, REDCap, etc.)
Highly motivated, willing to learn, good teamwork, service-oriented, and able to work under high pressure and within a limited time frame
Professional use of personal computer utilizing word processing, spreadsheet software programs
Excellent Excel, Google Spread Sheet
Applicable knowledge working with statistic databases such as SAS, STATA, SPSS, etc
Applicable knowledge working with statistic Dashboard such as Power BI, Google Data studio, etc (will be an advantage)
Excellent communication skills
Excellent English (written and spoken) as preference.
Applications:
For interested applicants, please send a cover letter together with a CV (with the name and contact details of at least three senior referees) in English or Vietnamese and scanned copies of your related degrees, no later than 11/30/2023 by submitting the application form in the link as follows: http://bit.ly/woolcockhiring
We regret that only short-listed candidates will be contacted for interviews. Review of applications will start as soon as possible and continue until 11/30/2023, or until the post is filled, whichever is earlier.
Job Details
Organisation Name:
Woolcock
Location:
Hanoi or Ho Chi Minh
Application Deadline:
Thu, 2023-11-30

title:
VN EHS Intern
- job post
description:
Job Description

Join Intel and build a better tomorrow. Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So join us and help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come.
Corporate Services (CS) provides Intel employees the infrastructure and environment to create breakthrough technology that makes amazing experiences possible. Our scope is vast, whether we are providing services that help employees stay productive and satisfied, or transforming how we work by providing ultra-pure water/chemicals to factory process tools, shuttling employees between sites, protecting the environment, keeping employees safe, or building and maintaining offices, labs, and factories. Our employees create a better tomorrow for all Intel employees around the world.
Position description.
Safety Training program: Assist the review, consolidation, and tracking of safety training completion for the site.
Safety-Walk: Follow up on the safety walk schedule, capturing feedback from safety dialogues, finding consolidation and closure tracking and report. Safety Communications: Support all assigned safety communications e.g. safety newsletter scheduling, materials consolidation, and publication on a monthly basis; safety metrics updates and safety corner materials updated.
Assist the organization and execution of scheduled EHS events e.g. Health Campaign, Health Talk sessions, etc.
Support local regulatory compliance tracking and validation of compliance activities.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualification Skills (Must Have Skills):
Pursuing a Bachelor of Science degree related to Safety, Chemistry, or Environment Engineering.
Good command of English and communications.
Familiar with Microsoft Office.

Preferred Qualifications:
Passionate about EHS management
Experience in organizing or coordinating events, and internal communications.

What we offer you:
We give you opportunities to transform technology and create a better future, by delivering products that touch the lives of every person on earth.
As a global leader in innovation and new technology, we foster a collaborative, supportive, and boredom-free environment where the brightest minds in the world come together to achieve exceptional results.
We're constantly working on making a more connected and intelligent future, and we need your help. Change tomorrow. Start today.

Inside this Business Group

Corporate Strategy Office is chartered to support the executive office in driving corporate initiatives, including near and long-term strategy, major cross-group decision making and ensuring cross-company alignment. To deliver to that mission, the team owns shaping, driving and synthesizing insights to directionally orient trends as well as long range strategic planning/visioning , cross company alignment and greenfield innovation. Communications are essential to drive alignment so there is a focus on communications, community and acumen development. The team is ccommitted to ensuring that Intel efforts are aligned to, and actively driving success toward the most impactful business strategies.
Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.

Your privacy matters to Intel and we comply with applicable data protection laws. We collect and maintain personal information for recruitment related activities and your data will not be used for any other purpose. We retain personal information for the periods and purposes set forth in Intel Privacy Notice. Retention periods can vary significantly based on the type of information and how it is used. We do not share your personal information with third parties. In order for Intel to communicate with you on your application results, by submitting your information and proceeding with this application, you agree and consent that we can collect your personal information. You will have the ability to opt-out by informing vietnamjobs@intel.com or at any time selecting unsubscribe found at the bottom of our future marketing communications. You have rights to correct, update, request access to or deletion of your personal information as described in Intel Privacy Notice. In addition, if you wish to update or otherwise make changes to your resume, use Intel online application tool to resubmit a new resume.
Working Model

This role will require an on-site presence.

JobType
On-site Required

Priority is given to those who have practical knowledge in project coordination, account or students from the third year or graduates of relevant majors. Other cases are still considered

Good communication, listening, presentation and negotiation skills

Good organization and time management skills
Good critical thinking skills

Work directly with the CEO, one of the top profiles in the Vietnam market in Technology / Digital / Product Management / Digital Transformation fields; chances to work with top experts and consults: Ms. Phi Van Nguyen, Mr. Nguyen Tuan Quynh
Training and Development Path and Program in Franchise Industry and Franchise Development
Extremely flexible working hours to ensure learning / working

Learn and practice core skills: Project Management, Business Analysis, Communication, Listening, Synthesis & analysis of information; Negotiation; Time management; Situations handling…

Opportunity to participate in workshops sponsored by the company
Work closely with teammates who are always ready to support and have experience in a fast-paced environment
Quarterly parties, company outings, snacks and other benefits…

title:

- job post
description:
Anywhere!
Freelance
Location: You can work in our Vietnam office or remotely depending on our projects' requirements. Vietnam office: 3A Floor, VINA Building, 131 Xo Viet Nghe Tinh, Ward 17, District Binh Thanh, Ho Chi Minh City, Viet Nam.
Level of management: Experience
Job Information
We are always looking for talents to support our team and on-going projects.
Are you skilled as
Front-End Developer
Design Specialist
Medical Copywriter
QC (Quality Control)
and would like to freelance? Here are attractive opportunities
Front-End Developer
Position: Front-End Developer
About Us:
At Drcom, we’re on the lookout for a talented and experienced Front-End Developer to join our team. With over 2 years of experience in web development, you’ll have the opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects in a dynamic environment. Develop and maintain websites with a primary focus on theme and user interface.

Integrate front-end elements provided by our clients into applications.
Adhere to coding conventions and quality standards.

Proficiency in HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Experience with the Vue.js framework. Experience with other frontend frameworks is highly desirable.
Strong understanding of front-end technologies & concepts.
Commitment to long-term cooperation.
If you’re a creative developer looking to make an impact, we invite you to apply and be part of our team.
Design Specialist
Position: Studio and Design Specialist
About Us:
At Drcom, we’re in search of a talented Design Specialist to join our team. As a Design Specialist, your role is crucial in ensuring high-quality design and print materials that meet our clients’ exacting standards. You’ll be responsible for crafting designs, layouts, and derivatives while maintaining the highest standards in printing processes.
Key Responsibilities:
Design and layout documents in a user-friendly and visually appealing manner.
Originate designs, create derivatives, and cascade designs as needed.
Edit and adjust existing documents to meet printing standards and parameters.
Supervise print production processes to ensure quality and precision.
Collaborate with the team to meet project objectives and deadlines.
Requirements:
Proficiency in graphic design software and tools.
Strong creative and visual design skills.
Ability to create and edit designs for print materials.
Knowledge of printing standards and quality control.
Familiarity with offset press processes is a plus.
Copywriting (Medical)
Position: Medical Copywriter
About Us:
Drcom is in search of a talented and experienced Medical Copywriter to contribute to our medical communication projects. If you have a background in healthcare and a passion for crafting precise and engaging medical content, we want to hear from you.
Key Responsibilities:
Create clear and compelling medical content for various audiences including health care professionals and patients/caregivers in various formats (e.g. e-detailing aids, Infographics, leave-behinds, video scripts and marketing communication materials)
Ensure accuracy and adherence to medical guidelines,industry regulations, and ethical standards.
Collaborate with medical professionals, subject matter experts, and the marketing team to develop content that meets the needs and goals of the job scope
Translate technical medical data into accessible, engaging content.
Requirements:
Strong background in medical or healthcare-related fields.
Excellent written communication skills.
Ability to conduct literature search and extract key communication messages, ensuring the accuracy and credibility of the content.
Flexibility in differentiating tonality, especially between medical experts and consumers.
Ability to explain complex medical concepts in a reader-friendly manner.
Familiarity with medical guidelines and terminology.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, meet deadlines and maintain the quality of content.
Sample job: Deconstruct a core message in a print leave behind for XX brand, apply provided taxonomy and create a rep triggered email (marketing material sent to healthcare professional from a pharmaceutical sales representative)
If you think you are the right person for such a job task and can demonstrate your expertise in the area, we want to hear from you.
If you’re ready to make a meaningful impact through medical communication, and be a bridge between doctors and patients, we welcome your application.
QC (Quality Control)
Position: Quality Check Specialist
About Us:
Drcom is seeking a Quality Control Specialist to ensure the reliability and functionality of our software products. If you have a keen eye for detail, a passion for quality control and technology, and an understanding of digital asset development, we’d like you to join our team.
Key Responsibilities:
Execute meticulous quality control tasks to align with business specifications, including Word-for-Word checking, function testing, deploy test sample/packages to platforms for test, and bug reporting.
Efficiently manage your time to meet project deadlines while maintaining quality standards.
Demonstrate strong problem-solving skills to overcome challenges and ensure the desired quality standards.
Collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless project execution.
Apply a comprehensive understanding of quality control standards to maintain the highest quality in the projects.
Utilize a strong knowledge of content and website development processes, including models and teams involved in these projects
Requirements:
Previous quality control experience is an advantage, showcasing a deep understanding of industry-specific requirements.
Possess good knowledge of tools used in quality control, including MS Office and various QC or AI tools.
Proven experience in quality control, preferably in content. Experience with technical projects is an advantage, but not necessary.
Strong portfolio demonstrating work in digital asset development.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Proficiency in MS Office and relevant QC tools.
Knowledge of quality control standards.
Understanding of content and website development processes.
Experience in the medical media advertising field is a plus.
Effective communication and teamwork skills
If you’re dedicated to maintaining software quality and improving user experiences, we encourage you to apply for this role.
Send us a message together with your portfolio, we will come back to you soonest than you think.

- job post
description:
Apply Now
DepartmentOperations

LocationVietnam - Ho Chi Minh City
The Operation teams at Shopee covers the operational end-to-end process, from when the buyer searches for a product listed on the Shopee platform, to the moment the buyer receives the products. Job Description:

Primary Purpose/Objectives:

The Finance Operation Lead ensures all financial operations activities are in compliance with company policies. This role will manage the daily financial activities of SPX Express including collection, payments, asset management (fixed and inventory), etc.
The main role of is to:
Ensure all transactions (related to cash flow and expense/revenue) are reconciled & processed precisely and on time;
Manage all assets of the company (cash, fixed assets, consumables, etc), to ensure they are accounted for, recorded timely, accurately, available, and within budget.
Manage the logistics to deliver all equipment/consumables to site facilities on time, planning equipment purchasing to support the operations run smoothly.

As a Finance Operations Lead, the main responsibility is not limited to these tasks, but also provides solutions for SOP and system enhancement.

Key Responsibilities:

Process - Lead all Finance Operation team by providing strategic direction and manage all of finance operation cycle work processes.
Process and analyze all financial transactions related to Operations
Manage all finance operation processes of SPX, implement continuous finance operation process improvement to improve daily operation processes, mitigate potential operational/financial risks as well as enhance efficiency, effectiveness of finance operations.
Stakeholder Management - Work with Partners to ensure smooth reconciliation and payment process.
Manage finance operation and assets related processes with our internal & external partners, such as Shopee, riders, staff and other vendors to ensure accuracy of invoicing data from partners.
Risk Management - minimize any potential risks to company assets
Identify, provide solutions for areas of high risk in the financial cycle, documentation, billing practices,
Manage all fraud cases of the company relating to Riders.
Reporting - Ensure all report are qualified to meet organization standards
Supervise budget development, financial reporting, and system management, as well as finance staff, while driving business processes to improve efficiency and meet organizational goals
Ensure accuracy of all reports for monthly/quarterly/annually closing.
Ensure management report is prepared and submitted in a timely and accurate manner
Team Management - Drive team members to meet KPI
Ensure each person in the team are right people, right job
Be in charge of career development for all members
Drive team to meet organizational goals and ensure they can delivery their scope of work
Requirements:
Bachelor’s Degree/ Master Degree of Finance, Accounting or Economics
10+ years of related experience required in working in finance management roles at high levels.
Proven experience at high level in financial management area at big corporation

Professional qualification such as CFA/CPA or similar will be a plus

title:
Staff | Financial Risk Management (Credit Risk) | HCMC Office
- job post
description:
Consultant; FSO Advisory – Financial Services Risk Management; HCMC Office
Gain experiences that will shape your whole career
We are committed to building a better working world
Build your personal brand with business leaders

About the opportunity
If your decide to continue your career path as risk manager/ risk management advisor and wish to work in a global advisory firm, join EY and gain experiences that will last a lifetime.
As a Consultant in our risk team, you will act as a key member in advisory projects, assisting Engagement Managers to deliver the quality services, timely complete the projects as planned in a cost effective manner.
Internal trainings will be continuously held to get you updated to the latest risk management practices and statutory regulations.

About you
In your role as a Consultant, you will:
Act as a member in risk advisory projects and support the Engagement Manager in controlling the project
Conduct relevant client meetings during the project individually/ jointly with the Managers
Prepare project deliverables as specified in scope of work covering all types of credit and credit risk management services (ie. modelling, governance, policy and process assesment and enhancements, RWA estimation, credit risk data, credit related IT system implementation, etc.)
Prepare data packs for presentations/ workshop documents
Act as key member in making proposals and approach notes
Prepare regular status reports/ MIS and analysis for effective planning and decision making
Gain knowledge/ insights of industry fundamentals while working on different projects
Identify opportunities to improve efficiency of project delivery

We’re looking for people with the following experience/ qualifications:
Fresh graduate or have 1 year in banking / finance with experience experience in credit related activities, possessing one or more of the following skills/ experience: credit underwriting, credit model development, credit risk management, Basel II/ III compiance, etc.
Bachelor or above
Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, etc.
Has the ability to think analytically and logically and to analyze problems with the aim of implementing practical solutions
Is pro-active, takes initiative and radiates confidence
Is a team player who has the necessary feeling and spirit to be able to approach and work together with people
Demonstrates significant commitment to own development; proactively seeks out knowledge
Has sound business mind and shows tangible customer orientation
Database and programming knowledge and exposures in the use of various tools such as SQL, R, Python, SAS, SPSS, etc., should be a privilege
Is able to travel

About us
EY is a global professional services organization providing advisory, assurance, tax and transaction services. We are committed to doing our part in building a better working world for our people, our clients and our communities. And we are united by our shared values and a dedication to delivering exceptional client service.
In Vietnam, we are one of the leading advisors, providing services covering risk management, performance improvement and IT advisory to clients in banking and finance industry. We are also expanding our advisory customer base in Laos with Basel II related risk management projects.

What Working At EY Offers
EY offers a competitive remuneration package commensurate with your work experience, where you will be rewarded for your individual and team performance. Plus, we offer:
Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next.
Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility, so you can make a meaningful impact, your way.
Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights, coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs.
Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.

If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.
The exceptional EY experience. It’s yours to build.
EY | Building a better working world
EY exists to build a better working world, helping to create long-term value for clients, people and society and build trust in the capital markets.
Enabled by data and technology, diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow, transform and operate.
Working across assurance, consulting, law, strategy, tax and transactions, EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

About the Team:
The Seller Operation Solution (SOS) team focuses on various topics, with one goal in mind: To make the selling experience of sellers on Shopee to be as smooth and as positive as possible. To achieve this, SOS engages in studying and striving to understand what, why and how sellers are doing what they are doing and what they are not doing. Through this understanding, SOS monitors seller performance and develops solutions that enhance sellers’ performance. We provide guidance for improvement on seller operation processes (to fit with Shopee’s operation policies), coordinate with internal Shopee team to make feature development for sellers (to fit with demand of most sellers during their operation process), or even adjust policies which many sellers are struggling to meet.
Our ultimate goal is to bring the best selling and shopping experience to our customers.
Job Description:
Manage seller policies and seller management initiatives related to operations
Drive initiatives to improve user experience with focus on seller control and treatment, content management and listing processes
Take ownership to ensure platform contents’ compliance to brand standards, government regulations and community standards
Responsible for supervising and leading a large team consisting of both internal and external agents
Drive performance and ensure agent performance in terms of productivity and quality
Work closely with commercial teams to understand business focus and drive seller operations initiatives to support business objectives
Requirements:
7+ years of experience in a fast pace environment (consulting, tech, e-commerce) with at least 3 years of team management experience
Knowledge/ experience in e-commerce and operations is preferred
Strong interpersonal and problem solving skills, customer-oriented mindset
Able to drive insights and solutions from complex data and information, experienced working with numbers and presentation
Able to build strong professional relationships with both internal and external partners. Provide consistent, effective, and open communication, both verbal and written in English and Vietnamese

title:
Customer Delivery Architect
- job post
company: Amazon Web Services Vietnam Company Limited - E42
description:
BS level technical degree required; Computer Science background preferred.
10+ years track record of consulting, managing and delivering large-scale enterprise implementations.
7+ years of experience in technology/software sales, pre-sales, or technical consulting in customer-facing roles.
Experience in industry domain of FSI with ability to understand and articulate business impact of technical decisions.
Demonstrated FSI industry leadership and track record of implementing AWS services with deep expertise in migration, modernization or data analytics implementation.
Deep hands-on experience leading the design, development and deployment of business software at scale or current hands on technology infrastructure, network, compute, storage, and virtualization experience.
Working knowledge of at least two technology domains, such as distributed internet-scale web or mobile applications, Serverless, Big Data, analytics, Machine Learning, enterprise workloads (SAP, VMware, Windows etc.), high-performance databases (SQL and/or NoSQL), complex networking implementations, highly secured workloads, etc. and a solid understanding Security and Compliance.
A minimum of 3 years working experience in ASEAN region, and ability to travel to customer locations as needed.
The Amazon Web Services Professional Services (AWS ProServe) ASEAN organization is looking for experienced Customer Delivery Architects (CDAs). A CDA is responsible for partnering with ProServe leaders and client partners to dive deep into a customer’s business challenge in order to collaboratively propose and pre-qualify a particular set of business outcomes that would result from a formal ProServe engagement. Thereafter, the CDA remains meaningfully engaged with that customer, Amazon team and project/program to ensure high-value, predictable, and successful delivery.

AWS ProServe engage in a wide variety of projects for customers and partners, providing collective AWS customer experience, best practices, and obsessing about strong success for the Customer. Our team collaborates across the entire AWS organization to bring access to product, service, and training teams, to deliver the right solutions and drive feature innovations for our customers across all industries.

The CDA is not a pure consultant role, nor is it a pure selling role: it is an individual with a unique hybrid of AWS platform expertise and hands-on building, coupled with deep Enterprise Architecture knowledge with industry/business acumen, including a heavy dose of passion for continued knowledge acquisition and growth, obsession for customers, and their success using AWS that will align well with the desired outcomes to be produced.

Key job responsibilities
As a key member of the Account and Professional Services Go-To-Market teams, ensure success in designing, building, optimizing, transforming or otherwise migrating applications, software, and services at scale on the AWS platform.
Educate customers on the value proposition of AWS in answering their Migration, Modernization and/or Data and Analytics needs to achieve organizational goals.
Participate in deep architectural discussions and design exercises to create world-class solutions built on AWS.
Author or otherwise contribute to AWS customer-facing publications such as whitepapers and proof of concepts.
In partnership with the ProServe leadership and Account team, formulate and execute a strategy to accelerate customer outcomes through the adoption of AWS technologies.
Build deep relationships and act as trusted technology advisor with senior technical individuals within customers to enable them to be cloud advocates.
Capture and share best-practice knowledge, sales and delivery content amongst the AWS Professional Services community.
This is a customer facing role. You be required to travel to client locations to deliver professional services when needed.
About the team
Inclusive Team Culture
Here at AWS, we embrace our differences. We are committed to furthering our culture of inclusion. We have ten employee-led affinity groups, reaching 40,000 employees in over 190 chapters globally. We have innovative benefit offerings, and host annual and ongoing learning experiences, including our Conversations on Race and Ethnicity (CORE) and AmazeCon (gender diversity) conferences. Amazon’s culture of inclusion is reinforced within our 16 Leadership Principles, which remind team members to seek diverse perspectives, learn and be curious, and earn trust.

Work/Life Balance
Our team puts a high value on work-life balance. It isn’t about how many hours you spend at home or at work; it’s about the flow you establish that brings energy to both parts of your life. We believe striking the right balance between your personal and professional life is critical to life-long happiness and fulfillment. We offer flexibility in working hours and encourage you to find your own balance between your work and personal lives.

Mentorship & Career Growth
Our team is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels and tenures, and we’re building an environment that celebrates knowledge sharing and mentorship. We care about your career growth and strive to assign projects based on what will help each team member develop into a better-rounded professional and enable them to take on more complex tasks in the future.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Hanoi, HN, VNM | Ho Chi Minh City, VNM

MBA or Master’s in Computer Science.
Customer facing skills to represent AWS well within the customer’s environment and drive discussions with senior personnel regarding trade-offs, best practices, project management and risk mitigation.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Proven experience with software development life cycle (SDLC) and agile/iterative methodologies required, commensurate modern certifications AWS, Agile, Scrum, SAFe, etc.
Delivering IT Strategy & Consulting services.
Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies and learn quickly.
