title:
Americas Regional Training Coordinator
- job post
description:
Partners Worldwide
Partners Worldwide (PW) is a global network of businesspeople working together to end poverty through entrepreneurship and job creation. We believe that all people are image-bearers of God and have the right to live an abundant life. Through locally-rooted, globally-connected partnerships we work to grow and sustain redemptive businesses and flourishing economic ecosystems for maximum impact. Every team member plays a significant role in making this vision a reality.
As an employee of Partners Worldwide, you will be part of a global team that values the unique contributions and service of each person as a true partner. You will join us in celebrating each entrepreneur who is able to fully live out their calling to business, provide for their family, create life-giving employment opportunities, and invest in the community around them.
The PW goal for 2030 is for our partners in 30+ countries, to serve over one million businesses who are creating and sustaining 3 million jobs in communities of high poverty and unemployment.
The Role
As Part-Time Regional Training Coordinator, on the Global Operations team, you will support the training and partnership teams in each region, ensuring they are equipped and empowered to deliver business training, mentoring, and coaching with excellence. You will serve our network by providing support, assistance, and guidelines for excellent implementation of our business training, business toolkits, metrics, and certification programs in each region. You will also support the development of new training initiatives and tools to equip our network with business training resources.
The Work
Organize and schedule training, TTT, and Master training sessions, workshops, seminars, and other learning activities across the region, languages, and locations.
Coordinate logistics, such as venue selection, travel arrangements, materials preparation, and technical requirements.
Oversee the administration of the region's learning in SAP Litmos or other training platforms. Ensure accurate user creation and data entry, user management, and provide updates to content updates.
Implement other business training/support curricula and pilots (i.e., grit pilots) training initiatives. Create quarterly schedules for training, and updates to employees, managers, and regional team on training initiatives.
Conduct Yearly assessments to identify skill gaps and training requirements within the regions. Analyze training needs data to determine priorities and develop targeted training plans.
Coordinate and facilitate a portion of Training Taskforce quarterly team meetings for maximum impact.
Support and assist Regional Training Partners in coordinating training logistics and collecting metrics.
Collect regional training metrics, feedback, learnings, and statistics to inform our business training future initiatives.
Work alongside trainers to guide them through our business training toolkit, certification programs, and on-going education opportunities.
Follow-up on administrative tasks after TTT (payments, feedback, and continued support).
Participate in business training to provide support, feedback, and input to improve the quality and methodology of our training programs.
Other duties as assigned.
Your Qualifications
A degree in business, finance, economic development, agribusiness/agriculture development
or a related field from a reputable, accredited university.
5 years professional experience with at least 3 years working in business in the private or non-profit sector.
Permanent residency in Honduras, Ecuador, Guatemala, El Salvador, and Nicaragua
Strong verbal and written communication skills in English and Spanish.
Project management skills and experience.
Experience building and maintaining cross-cultural relationships.
Not required but helpful:
Proficiency in Office365, Salesforce, Power BI
Experience in concise and compelling business writing and project reporting
Prior exposure or experience with agrobusiness and production initiatives that would facilitate interaction and communication with agriculture-based partnerships.
Your Character
Mature Christian faith that is lived out in your life, work, and interactions.
Strong ability to build relationships, create traction and mobilize resources.
Curiosity to learn new skills, solve new problems and seek expertise from others.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively.
Organized with the ability to plan to reach goals.
An entrepreneurial spirit that leads to creative thinking, new ideas to put into action, and innovative solutions to diverse challenges.
What we provide
Meaningful, redemptive, and purpose-filled work
Connection to a talented, dedicated, and joyful team of global staff and partners
A comprehensive compensation and benefits package (insurance, retirement, paid parental leave and more)
Flexible paid time off (vacation, sick, holiday) and a culture that prioritizes healthy work-life balance
Annual allowance for professional development/continuing education
Additional information
Partners Worldwide is an equal opportunity employer.
Reasonable accommodations will be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions.
This position requires the ability to travel locally and internationally.
This position is based in Honduras, Ecuador, Guatemala, El Salvador, Nicaragua the United States.

title:
Specialist- Training II Ops VNM
- job post
description:
First Solar reserves the right to offer you a role most applicable to your experience and skillset.
Basic Job Functions:
Participate in design, develop, execute and monitor training program. Conduct operator certification, perform new hire training, deliver process changes training (i.e. WI/OPL) to the technician and operators, ensure internal cross training are carried out effectively by Peer Trainer. Measure, analyze and report on training program effectiveness. Revise program if necessary to ensure all plants training activities comply with EHS, Quality & ISO 9000 certification requirement.
Experience:
Minimum 3 years of working experience in training and development
Experience with Multi National Company (MNC) is a plus.
Education:
Preferably with 4-year Bachelor Degree in Technical Discipline or related field
Required Skills/Competencies:
Behavioral:
Demonstrate First Solar Values and Behaviors
Excellent verbal and written communication skills and Strong presentation skills
Possess skills to lead and manage projects, which require candidates to work independently with minimum supervision
Ability to analyze and exercise judgment in problem solving to deliver to commitment.
Technical:
Experience and proficiency with software applications: Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, Power Point, MS project)
Knowledge in TNA
Acquire trainer certification
Essential Responsibilities:
Working with other stakeholders in designing suitable training interventions for all level of manufacturing associates.
Managing the delivery of training and development programs and, in a practical role, devising a training strategy for the entire organization.
Responsible for certification/decertification/recertification processes for operations and ensure that all documentations are updated timely as according to ISO requirement.
Co-own with shift managers / relevant department or functional supervisors in all plants and to ensure new associate are adequately trained, certified and competence before release to perform operation task.
Deliver required operation changes training to associates i.e.; Work Instruction (WI) changes, One Point Lessons (OPL), Best Known Method (BKM)
Assess operation associates skills based on the qualified certification criteria i.e.; FS Training Guide.
Provide coaching and training to Peer Trainers to ensure effective training delivered to the operation associates.
Execute training as per plan and feedback / report to respective Supervisor / SMs and Training Lead for continuous improvements.
Revise programs as necessary, in order to adapt to changes in the FS work environment.
Helping line managers and trainers solve specific training problems, either on a one-to-one basis or in groups.
Recommends potential candidates for cross training to enable an agile and skilled workforce.
Analyze training data and prepare reports to reflect training program effectiveness.
Provide feedback for continuous improvements of associates skillsets
Support in delivering key Operations Training Program (eg. PACE and other related development programs) to the operation associates.
Understanding of e-learning techniques, creation and/or delivery or e-learning package.
Other duties may be assigned.
Reporting Relationships:
No direct reports
Travel:
No regular travel is required outside First Solar global work site.
Physical Requirements:
Able to perform normal physical movements (e.g. standing & sitting for a long period, lifting, carrying and climbing) according to EHS ergonomic guidelines.
Will sit, stand or walk short distances for up to 12 hours per day. Will climb stairs on an occasional basis.
Will lift up to 23 kg on an occasional basis, according to Minister of Health guidelines
Will lift up to 17 kg on a frequent basis, according to Minister of Health guidelines
Will push or pull up to 13 kg of force on an occasional basis.
Will push or pull up to 5 kg of force on a frequent basis.
Required to use hands to grasp, lift, handle, carry or feel objects on a frequent basis.
May reach above shoulder heights and below the waist on a frequent basis.
May stoop, kneel, or bend, on an occasional basis.
20/40 vision in each eye (with or without correction) and the ability to distinguish between red, yellow and green is required.
Must be able to comply with all safety standards and procedures.
Ability to wear personal protective equipment is required (including but not limited to; steel toed shoes, gloves, safety glasses, hearing protection, protective jacket or apron and arm guards).
All associates working on the production floor may be required to wear a respirator at any given time and thus, the ability to wear a respirator is a condition of employment and continued employment (requires little or no facial hair).
Office Physical Requirements:
All positions in our office require interaction with people and technology while either standing or sitting. In order to best service our customers, internal and external, all associates must be able to communicate face-to-face and on the phone with or without reasonable accommodation. First Solar is committed to compliance with its obligations under all applicable jurisdictional laws prohibiting employment discrimination. In keeping with this commitment, it attempts to reasonably accommodate applicants and employees in accordance with the requirements of applicable disability discrimination laws. It also invites individuals with disabilities to participate in a good faith, interactive process to identify reasonable accommodations that can be made without imposing an undue hardship.
Potential candidates will meet the education and experience requirements provided on the above job description and excel in completing the listed responsibilities for this role. All candidates receiving an offer of employment must successfully complete a background check and any other tests that may be required.
Equal Opportunity Employer Statement: First Solar is an Equal Opportunity Employer that values and respects the importance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of the company to recruit, hire, train and promote persons in all job titles without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, or gender identity. We recognize that diversity and inclusion is a driving force in the success of our company.

- job post
description:
Responsibilities
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative. We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform. We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes. Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility. Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.

Description
E-commerce's Governance and Experience (GNE) is a global team responsible for ensuring our marketplace is safe and trustworthy for not only our users, but also sellers and creators. We value user satisfaction and work on policies, rules and systems to ensure quality. Service and Experience Team (SET) is part of the GNE organization. Our mission is to provide world-class service and experience for customers, sellers and creators. SET is looking for a Quality Assurance Specialist to be responsible for maintaing an effective QA processes within the service delivery team. For new country launch, the role is also responsible for the SOP setup, local language translation, system and process test to meet the launch readiness requirements.

Roles & Responsibilities
Ensure quality framework is in place based on the business types/facts by coordinating across regions and stakeholders.
Implement clear overall quality strategy with scalable process, tools and systems that allow efficient monitoring of performance versus target.
Access quality issues, conduct root cause analysis, recommend insights, develop improvement plans, and collaborate with operations team to improve quality performance.
Research and understand customer expectations and needs to drive their satisfaction.
Identify and develop individualized and group training plans to address varying needs.
Effectively communicate updates and developments with team members, trainers and management.
Produce statistical reports and insights on quality performance.
Proactively identify and resolve issues impacting the service delivery team by working with team, peers, and management.
Implement policies and processes to ensure a positive, productive work environment, build team morale, and recognize employee achievements.
Contribute to special projects, that enhance the business, including projects involving root-cause analysis of weak performance metrics, service readiness projects, and tools projects as assigned or requested by management.
Conduct trend analyses on customer satisfaction and other core measurements. Implement strategies to improve future operation results.
Work with the Readiness, SOP, Training and System teams to optimize new and existing processes impacting customers/sellers/creators.
Maintain the weekly/monthly/bi-monthly reviews with teams and internal stakeholders.
Qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Experience building, managing and influencing relationships with internal stakeholders, using data to generate insights and solving complex problems.
People-oriented, self-motivated and able to thrive in ambiguity and in a matrix environment.
Ability to function independently and within team environment
Experience in eCommerce or marketplace platform is a plus.
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Speed, flexibility and agility

title:
Chuyên viên Quản lý đối tác (Account Management)
- job post
description:
Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.
Công việc
Hỗ trợ tất cả các tài khoản khách hàng của doanh nghiệp Ninja Van Việt Nam.
Phối hợp chặt chẽ với các bộ phận liên quan để đảm bảo hiệu suất dịch vụ theo SLA.
Trao đổi với khách hàng để xác định các vấn đề phát sinh hoặc giải quyết các thắc mắc của khách hàng như báo cáo nhận hàng, tỷ lệ giao hàng, SLA, ngày thanh toán COD, tương tác hệ thống giữa hai bên... .
Thực hiện các báo cáo đột xuất cho khách hàng VIP.
Duy trì, tăng sản lượng và tỷ lệ giữ chân thông qua việc hỗ trợ các yêu cầu của khách hàng.
Thu thập thông tin từ khách hàng và làm việc với các bên liên quan để nâng cao chất lượng dịch vụ và đóng góp vào thành công chung của các dự án quan trọng.
Xác định những hiểu biết sâu sắc về khách hàng để thực hiện các kế hoạch thành công của khách hàng nhằm tạo ra các phương pháp tiếp cận hiệu quả nhằm xây dựng và duy trì mối quan hệ bền chặt với khách hàng, đặc biệt là nhóm VIP/SVIP.
Kiểm soát và phân tích thống kê tình hình của cả khách hàng và đội ngũ nội bộ, đưa ra giải pháp cải thiện sản phẩm và sự hài lòng của khách hàng và báo cáo hàng ngày/tuần/tháng cho Manager.
Yêu cầu
Tốt nghiệp Cao đăng/ Đại học
Ưu tiên NAM, chịu đi gặp gỡ đối tác
Có ít nhất 6 tháng kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực Chăm sóc khách hàng/Đối tác
Thái độ chuyên nghiệp và kỹ năng giao tiếp tốt
Có kỹ năng và giỏi trong việc thu thập thông tin để thuyết phục đội ngũ nội bộ và khách hàng bên ngoài
Ưu tiên ứng viên làm trong lĩnh vực chuyển phát nhanh, thương mại điện tử hoặc logistics
Có tư duy rõ ràng và quản lý công việc

Lương cứng + Incentive:
Thu nhập hấp dẫn, cạnh tranh so với thị trường
Tết bonus, review lương hàng năm
Đóng BHXH BHYT BHTN đầy đủ
12 ngày phép năm, 5 ngày phép bệnh được trả full lương
Year End Party, Townhall toàn quốc mỗi năm
Du lich, nghỉ mát cùng công ty hằng năm
Các hoạt động team building hấp dẫn, hoạt động gắn kết nội bộ thường xuyên
Được công ty trang bị laptop

Đào tạo và phát triển:

Cơ hội phát triển lên những vị trí cao hơn: Senior, Trưởng nhóm, Quản lý ...

Môi trường làm việc & Đồng nghiệp:
Lãnh đạo cấp cao cởi mở, tôn trọng, lắng nghe và tạo điều kiện phát triển

Phạm vi công việc lớn, công ty scale hơn 6000 nhân sự, công ty có hoạt động trải dài trên 63 tỉnh thành/phố

title:
Manager, Consumer & Market Insights (Quantitative)
- job post
description:
Job Description

Companies have increasingly been relying on market insights to make informed decisions and our role at NIQ has evolved into us being information scientists -predicting the ‘What's Next’ for our clients, in order for them to grow, stay relevant in the present and for the future. Our behavioral researchers in NIQ tackle our clients’ issues by unlocking the why and the how, while our data researchers identify key clients' priorities quantitatively by applying data science techniques on the survey and other big data sources.
Responsible for an annual revenue target to be executed / developed through new business in the year.
Work together with Business Development colleagues and independently identifying and addressing client’s business issue or project brief, proposing the right & relevant solution (i.e. type of consumer study, data collection approach, timeline and investment). This includes developing & presenting the proposed solution to clients.
Take lead on client engagement and maintain a relationship with the client with the aim to become a trusted advisor, thus gaining more business opportunities.
Maintain an accurate and up to date knowledge on research techniques and applications; eager to learn about value added analysis to properly answer client’s key objectives.
Demonstrate willingness and ability to think about the client's business and take concrete steps towards building knowledge about a key industry vertical OR Solution.
Manage a small team of researchers to coach and mentor both direct and indirect reports; developing & strengthening their competency skills.
Execute and deliver the project (end-to-end, from questionnaire development to reporting/analysis & verbal presentation) at the most efficient way without impact on the quality of your delivery

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent, Master’s Degree desirable with 5+ years’ experience in a consumer research environment
Well versed with Quantitative research, analytical, interpersonal and problem solving skills
Excellent client management and relationship building skills and ability to converse with mid-level stakeholders in client organization.
Proficient in Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint and/ or Google Spreadsheet & Slides.
Ability to draw insights and good story telling skills
Excellent written & verbal communication skills
Fluent in English and Vietnamese

Additional Information

About NIQ
NIQ is the world’s leading consumer intelligence company, delivering the most complete understanding of consumer buying behavior and revealing new pathways to growth. In 2023, NIQ combined with GfK, bringing together the two industry leaders with unparalleled global reach. With a holistic retail read and the most comprehensive consumer insights—delivered with advanced analytics through state-of-the-art platforms—NIQ delivers the Full View™.
NIQ, is an Advent International portfolio company with operations in 100+ markets, covering more than 90% of the world’s population. For more information, visit NIQ.com.
Want to keep up with our latest updates?
Follow us on: LinkedIn | Instagram | Twitter | Facebook

Our commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
NIQ is committed to reflecting the diversity of the clients, communities, and markets we measure within our own workforce. We exist to count everyone and are on a mission to systematically embed inclusion and diversity into all aspects of our workforce, measurement, and products. We enthusiastically invite candidates who share that mission to join us.
We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action-Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, marital status, protected veteran status or any other protected class. Our global non-discrimination policy covers these protected classes in every market in which we do business worldwide.
Learn more about how we are driving diversity and inclusion in everything we do by visiting the NielsenIQ News Center: https://nielseniq.com/global/en/news-center/diversity-inclusion/
NIQ or any of our subsidiaries will never ask you for money at any point of the recruitment or onboarding process.

title:
Head of Digital Transformation
- job post
description:
The Why
Mekong Capital is committed to unlocking the full potential of digital transformation. We are on a mission to align technology, people, and processes to optimize operational efficiency and effectiveness. If you’re a master of digital transformation, we invite you to be part of our dynamic team.
Objectives
1. Digital Visionary: As the Head of Digital Transformation, your primary objective is to be the digital visionary who strategically aligns technology, people, and processes. You’ll optimize operational efficiency, all in service of fulfilling Mekong Capital’s highest priorities.
2. Forward-Thinking Solutions: Your second objective is to lead the development and implementation of forward-thinking digital solutions. These solutions will strategically align our business and technology strategies, ensuring exceptional customer satisfaction and driving our organization’s success.
Key Responsibilities:
1. Comprehensive Digital Transformation:
Develop, implement, and continuously optimize a holistic digital transformation strategy and roadmaps.
Enhance customer experiences and maintain a robust enterprise architecture.
2. High-Impact Initiatives:
Lead digital transformation initiatives with high impact, contributing to Mekong Capital’s Goals & KPIs.
Provide leadership in leading and collaborating on cross-department Agile projects.
3. Management Role:
Provide leadership for the vision of the Digital Transformation Team and Mekong Capital.
Key Accountabilities:
1. Digital Transformation:
Responsible for Mekongs DT Landscape and DT Roadmap. Prioritize digital initiatives based on impact, cost-effectiveness, and feasibility, fostering a digital culture for customers, employees, and stakeholders.
Proactively generate and cause new cross-functional projects successfully which are consistently used by everyone and fulfill the company’s vision.
Identify opportunities for process automation and lead the implementation.
Continuously improve and organize around results that elevate the performance of the company’s Top KPIs.
Provides the leadership for high-impact initiatives, which improves efficiency and productivity across the organization.
2. Customer Experience:
Evaluate and enhance the customer journey to ensure an optimal and seamless customer experience.
Oversee the Digital Workplace, ensuring an optimal digital experience for key users (Partners, Investors, Directors).
Utilize data analytics and customer feedback to identify opportunities for improvement in customer service and satisfaction.
Implement technologies and processes that enhance customer engagement and satisfaction.
Develop enrollment and support programs for employees impacted by digital initiatives.
3. Strategic Planning:
Align digital transformation projects with organizational goals and strategies.
Lead and oversee the digital transformation initiatives across the organization, ensuring smooth transitions and minimal disruption.
Develop and implement digital transformation strategies that enhance customer experience and business value.
4. Enterprise Architecture:
Oversee the development and implementation of a robust enterprise architecture that supports digital transformation initiatives.
Ensure alignment with the business goals and technology strategy.
Evaluate and implement emerging technologies and architecture solutions to drive digital innovation and transformation.
5. Solution Management:
Oversee the design and implementation of innovative digital solutions to solve complex business challenges.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to deliver innovative solutions.
Communicate effectively with internal and external stakeholders, keeping them informed of progress and changes.
Ensure successful deployment and adoption of solutions across the organization.
6. Budget Management:
Manage financial aspects of digital transformation initiatives, ensuring projects are completed within budget and deliver maximum ROI.
Develop and oversee project budgets for efficiency.
7. Administrative and other tasks
Handle administrative tasks related to your activities (contract with vendors, making payment requests)
Key Requirements
Experience: A minimum of 5 years in a management-level role (Senior Manager/Director/ Head level) within Digital or Product Management.
Track Record: Proven expertise in successfully leading end-to-end digital transformation initiatives, from ideation to successful implementation.
Knowledge: Deep understanding of enterprise architecture, technology solutions, and customer experience strategies.
Communication: Exceptional communication skills; clear and direct communication, proactively addressing issues, and speaking up promptly when needed. A skilled listener, understands, and recreates others’ perspectives, aiming for the shared goal.
Management Skills: Strong stakeholder and project management skills, especially in Agile/Scrum methodologies. Directly engage with teams and stakeholders to drive results.
Leadership: Demonstrated high influence and leadership capability, empowering teams to excel and find fulfillment in their work.
Language: Fluent in both English and Vietnamese.
Mindset: Results-oriented with a natural curiosity.

title:
Monetization Integrity Operations - Core Ops Team Lead
- job post
description:
Responsibilities
About TikTok
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity
and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences between users, creators, and businesses to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok users and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. The team is composed of Policy, Operations, Product and Data specialists working cross-functionally with key stakeholders (Product, Engineering, PR, Legal, and Sales) to design and optimize ad policies, manage moderation processes, build scalable systems and tools driving efficiencies within our integrity mechanisms. This team is critical to working together to solve large scale issues that have significant global impact.

Responsibilities
Own Product Lines and Markets on an end-to-end basis
Responsible for owning and managing certain products / markets, including but not limited to management of work distribution, planning capacity, driving consistent improvement on quality front
Ensure team members execute tasks in line with the SOPs and keep abreast on process and policy changes
Support and drive team success by ensuring KPI targets are met. Track, monitor and report team and individual performance
Act as escalation point of contact for process questions, issues and resolution
Taking the Lead in Stakeholder Management
Support global alignment across internal and external stakeholders through proactive communication and facilitation of cross-functional projects. Expectation is for the lead to ensure effective communication with XFN partners ; build strong and trust based relationships ; should have a problem solving attitude and should work on resolving conflicts. Lead is expected to strategise to meet common business objectives.

People

Drive core recognition related activities to ensure high employee engagement levels
Qualifications

Fluent in English as a working language when working with stakeholders across regions, and proficiency in Vietnamese to communicate with stakeholders in the Vietnam market
2+ years of operational experience in a major tech or media company, ads or content review experience is a plus;
Deep understanding of operation management, specifically in the areas of performance metrics system and efficiency enhancement;
Proficient Excel skills, familiar with formulas and pivot tables;
Strong communicator with good interpersonal skills;
Excellent problem-solving, task prioritization and follow-up;
Fast learner with the ability to adapt to evolving workflows without compromising attention to detail.
TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

title:
Senior Manager / Director - Marketing & Commerce (Automotive Industry) 1
- job post
description:
Senior Manager / Director - Marketing & Commerce (Automotive Industry) 1
Date: 22 Nov 2023
Type of Employment: Permanent Full Time
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, Ho Chi Minh City, VN
Hanoi, Hanoi, VN
At Deloitte, we offer a unique and exceptional career experience to inspire and empower talents like you to make an impact that matters for our clients, people and community. Deloitte offers you a highly inclusive, collaborative workplace and unrivalled opportunities to realize your full potential. We are always looking for people with the relentless energy to push themselves further, and to find new avenues and unique ways to reach our shared goals.

Work you will do
This role sits within the Customer and Marketing (C&M) team of Deloitte Southeast Asia, which is a part of Deloitte that uses technology and creativity to better connect the customer with the business.
Better known as Deloitte Digital, we use emergent technology to imagine, deliver, and run entirely new business futures. We create innovative ventures, digital platforms, and more meaningful experiences.
As part of Marketing and Commerce (M&C), you will work with team to help our clients with their Creative Design and Innovation, Advertising and Branding, Digital Marketing, Digital Commerce and Customer Experience Platform


You will:
Responsible for developing and implementing segment marketing strategies and programs across the region, with a focus on the automotive sector.
Through tight alignment with the sales, business and product organizations, develop and lead on market expansion initiatives to unlock new revenue channels, provide valuable market and customer insights for business growth. Be a key advisor to M&C on go-to-market strategies.
With regional business and marketing directions in mind, the role will define our business plans to tap into the growth potential in the region with alignment to the go-to-market plan.
Communicate plans across cross-functional teams, execute and monitor success. Provide counsel and insight to the team and corporate campaign marketing in the design of marketing initiatives.
Understand and identify key market opportunities. Deliver coordinated marketing programs to get results with good customer experience. Work with regional heads of Digital functional team, corporate marketing, country sales to plan a wide range of programs. Successfully driving the execution of those programs in the country.
Lead marketing insights projects by analyzing client channel strategy, data and performance and effectively communicating findings
Help clients identify the right marketing key performance indicators (KPIs), highlight areas of improvement, and influence strategy
Build strong relationships with client digital and marketing leaders to provide strategic advice on channel expansion, optimization, and business growth
Lead junior team members by coaching them to both provide leverage on projects and grow their technical and communication skills
Accountable for leading a cross functional team to put in place a marketing management system to enable target setting and performance tracking.
Manage sales to fulfil vertical revenue with a focus on pipeline development, management, and closure to meet targets
Develop cross-sector go-to-market strategy in close alignment with M&C Service Offering.

Your role as a leader
Lead and act as an exemplary role model for leaders at all levels, whilst continuously promoting a sense of loyalty and energizes others to act.
Build and sustain a high performance culture by cultivating and amplifying individual and team strengths.
Develop and sustain long-term, trust-based relationships with stakeholders, clients and team.
Manage the sustainable development of a strong pipeline of talent for current and future success, by driving a talent experience that differentiates Deloitte.
Lead behavioral and cultural change through a supportive, collaborative and highly inclusive environment where team members feels supported, respected and engaged.

Enough about us, let's talk about you
If you are someone with:
Tertiary qualification in a relevant technology, business, or marketing discipline.
Strong background in selling and delivering E-commerce and/or Marketing based projects, including experience with the automotive sector
Ability to bring, build industry and partner network to build and drive business growth. Strong track record in building, managing / exceeding sales target
Experience in designing and implementing Martech or commerce technologies in an enterprise or consulting environment.
Experience designing and implementing technology-enabled business solutions in client-facing and team leadership roles (e.g. Programme lead, business transformation lead, solution architect, project manager). Experience defining, developing requirements, designing and prototyping, testing, training, defining support procedures, and implementing practical business solutions.
Experience in selling professional services
Ability to fostering strong relationships and operating rhythms with leaders inside and outside client and product team to implement effective user experiences.
Willing to push beyond the current capabilities and find the best solution for the business and our customers.
Drive, tenacity, client focused and results oriented.
Proven demonstration of sound business acumen, teamwork and leadership qualities.
An appreciation of the consulting lifestyle and ability to travel (both locally and abroad)

Next Steps
So what are you waiting for? Join the winning team now.

Due to volume of applications, we regret only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
#LI-AZ
Requisition ID: 101379
In Vietnam, the services are provided by Deloitte Vietnam Company Limited and other related entities in Vietnam ("Deloitte in Vietnam"), which are affiliates of Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd. Deloitte Southeast Asia Ltd is a member firm of Deloitte Touche Tohmatsu Limited. Deloitte in Vietnam, which is within the Deloitte Network, is the entity that is providing this Website.

title:

- job post
description:
Risk Consulting is a part of Consulting Services in EY. We are on providing services in the area of corporate governance, risks, process and controls.
As one of member of Risk Consulting, you will help leading organizations implement a sound approach to risk, internal audit, control and governance. This will allow clients to develop greater confidence that they can respond to whatever the future may face. In each project that you are in, you will work with colleagues from other parts of the business such as Information Technology Advisory, Technology Risk and Assurance professionals and from other EY Office in Asia Pacific. You will also be developed to leveraging different disruptive technology to solve the clients’ issues includes data analytic, automation, IOT, etc.

Your Key responsibilities:
Lead work streams or specific tasks of risk consulting services, formulate high-quality, insightful and sustainable solutions for clients
Ensure work efficiency during all engagements by continuously improving processes, utilizing methodologies, tools, and technologies
Be responsible for parts of the final deliverables for clients
Contribute to the preparation and facilitation of workshops, presentations and training at client premises and within the team
Work closely with the project manager, identify and escalate potential risks and issues to project manager along with suggested preventive or mitigating actions
Contribute to a strong client relationship through effective management of interactions with client personnel
Supervise and coach junior professionals, help people enhance their contribution and develop their capabilities
Conduct market research, contribute to the development of proposals, identifies and escalates potential business opportunities on existing engagements
Skills and attributes for success
Have ability to develop, present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions
Strong interpersonal and problem-solving skills
Eager to learn new knowledge and interested in learning and solving new problems
Strong written, verbal communication and presentation skills
Well discipline and work effectively as a team member, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining effective communication
Who we are looking for?
A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree
MBA and/or CIA/ ACCA/ CIMA/ CPA is encouraged
Good knowledge on Business operating model, Value chain, Business processes, Risk management, Internal Control, Internal Audit
At least 4 years of experience in consulting practice with direct project experience in one or more of the following areas: risk management, internal control, internal audit, etc., Or At least 4 years of experience in an industry of an internal audit/internal control/compliance environment with a reputable organization and a strong record of personal success
Fluency (writing and speaking) in both Vietnamese and English
Advanced user of MS PowerPoint and Excel
Problem solving, Analysis and Insight, Teamwork, Leadership, Change management, Business development, Relationship management
Knowledge and proficiency in data analytics using advance tools is preferred

title:
Product Owner (The Coach App)
- job post
description:
“Before the age of 30 is the time for you to experiment and learn. If you plan to spend your youth at a company, find a small-scale company that is always seeking to solve critical problems in a groundbreaking way.” – Quoted from Tony Fadell, the father of the iPod.
Step Up is the perfect environment if you are looking for a place to try and learn in the field of ESL education. Step Up is widely known for the No. 1 Tiki bestselling book – “Hack Não 1500” or the top 5 communication app on the App Store – “The Coach.” Regardless of the format, our aim has remained unchanged: to help Vietnamese people learn English in a smarter and more enjoyable way.
I. RECRUITMENT CONTENT
Position

Product Owner

Starting time

October 2023

Working hours

08h30 – 18h00, 1h30 lunch break
Monday to Friday
1 annual leave per month

Address

Cau Giay District, Hanoi

II. JOB DESCRIPTION
The Product Owner role will work together with the product development team to develop The Coach app – a communication learning app using the Chunking learning method and virtual role-playing.
Your mission is to maximize the value for learners and the business.
To accomplish this task, you will need to have the ability to perform the following tasks effectively:
Analyze and accurately define the context, current issues, objectives, success criteria, and constraints of the product design problem.
Identify assumptions and design experiments (A/B testing, prototypes, surveys, etc.) to evaluate assumptions in the most streamlined way.
Collaborate with relevant departments (Tech, Content, Academic, UI/UX, etc.) to design and develop solutions.
Analyze data to evaluate experiments and continuously optimize.
Examples of the problems you will solve:
How to increase user trust during the trial period, thereby increasing the purchase rate?
How to increase the NPS of paid users?
How to increase the purchase rate of the high-level customer group who want to speak more than just a few sentences, say 2 – 3

III. REQUIREMENTS
To excel in this role, you will need:
Design Thinking Skills: The ability to understand and analyze the needs of learners.
Problem Solving Skills: The ability to solve problems effectively.
Self-Learning Skills: The capability to learn, explore, and adapt independently.
Communication Skills: Strong communication skills.
Teamwork Skills: The ability to work effectively within a team.
Confident communication and reading comprehension in English (equivalent to IELTS 7.0 or higher).
Minimum 2 years of experience in the technology application development field.
Additionally, we are particularly interested if you:
Can demonstrate your capabilities through case studies and explain clearly the process of how you solved the problems.
Have a prominent strength (UI/UX Design, Gamification, Data, Instructional Design).
Enjoy tackling challenging problems and have an interest in the Edtech and B2C fields.

IV. BENEFITS
Salary and Bonuses:
Monthly salary: 20M – 35M depending on level.
Bonuses based on project OKRs, creative idea bonuses, process improvement bonuses.
Holiday bonuses for Tet (Lunar New Year) and birthdays.
Development Opportunities:
Learning and development program to enhance skills
Fast-track advancement to specialist or management positions.
A welcoming, innovative, and stimulating work environment. We foster creativity and highly appreciate the contributions of all our team members.
You’ll have the opportunity to actively participate in shaping our strategic decisions and the development of our products.
Other Benefits:
Free lunch at the company.
Full compliance with state-mandated insurance policies after the probationary period.
13th-month salary bonus.

V. APPLICATION PROCESS:
Please submit your application along with your CV to the following address:
Email: recruitment@stepup.edu.vn
Subject: Product Owner_Edtech_Your Full Name
Hotline: 0931323822 or Zalo 0397694640 (Ms. Hoàng Mơ)

Our recruitment team will contact suitable applicants to arrange an interview in 1 week.
See you at the company!

description:
Phúc Lợi
Bảo hiểm
Du Lịch
Thưởng
Chăm sóc sức khỏe
Đào tạo
Tăng lương
Mô Tả Công Việc
MỤC TIÊU VỊ TRÍ
VNDIRECT đang tìm kiếm ứng viên cho vị trí Chuyên Viên Phân Tích Đầu Tư đảm trách nhiệm vụ nghiên cứu, phân tích dữ liệu về khách hàng và thị trường, tìm kiếm, đề xuất, thẩm định cơ hội đầu tư theo định hướng của VNDIRECT.
VAI TRÒ CHỨC NĂNG & NHIỆM VỤ CHÍNH
Nhiệm vụ chính:
Thu thập dữ liệu, phân tích thông tin phục vụ quá trình tìm kiếm, đề xuất, thẩm định cơ hội đầu tư;
Báo cáo đánh giá, tài liệu thuyết trình được giao thực hiện.
1. Deal execution support:
Thu thập hồ sơ thông tin và xây dựng tài liệu nghiên cứu phù hợp với giao dịch; thực hiện các phân tích ngành, doanh nghiệp, dự án v.v... trong các giao dịch phụ trách
Lập báo cáo thẩm định, đánh giá phân tích dữ liệu
Xây dựng data model và valuation model, sử dụng nhiều phương pháp định giá khác nhau bao gồm: phương pháp chiết khấu dòng tiền, phương pháp so sánh với giá trị thị trường và so sánh với các giao dịch hoặc kỳ trước đó;
Tham gia thực hiện giao dịch theo RACI;
2. KMS Support:
Hoàn thiện hồ sơ doanh nghiệp sau khi hoàn thành dự án;
Báo cáo đánh giá và rút kinh nghiệm và các bài học từ việc thực hiện dự án.
Yêu Cầu Công Việc
1. Trình độ học vấn:
Tốt nghiệp Đại học trở lên các ngành Kinh tế, Tài chính ngân hàng hoặc các chuyên ngành có liên quan (ưu tiên ứng viên tốt nghiệp các trường Top trên thị trường hoặc có chứng chỉ CFA, ACCA).
2. Kinh nghiệm làm việc:
Tối thiểu 02 năm kinh nghiệm trong lĩnh vực tài chính, phân tích đầu tư, kế toán kiểm toán (tại Big 4).
3. Kiến thức/ Năng lực chuyên môn/ Kỹ năng:
Hiểu biết về thị trường tài chính và pháp lý liên quan đến thị trường chứng khoán, hoạt động đầu tư;
Kỹ năng phân tích và đánh giá doanh nghiệp, đề xuất cơ hội đầu tư;
Kỹ năng xây dựng và thẩm định mô hình tài chính;
Kỹ năng viết báo cáo phân tích;
Kỹ năng sử dụng công cụ hỗ trợ như MS Excel, Word, Powerpoint, Fiinpro, Bloomberg.
4. Năng lực cốt lõi:
Có tố chất và tư duy phù hợp với hệ giá trị cốt lõi của công ty (IPAM & 4C).
CHẾ ĐỘ ĐÃI NGỘ
1. Cộng đồng những người làm nghề chính trực và dấn thân phụng sự
Môi trường làm nghề tài chính chuyên nghiệp.
Làm việc với tinh thần làm chủ, sáng tạo và thách thức.
2. Thu nhập theo năng lực
Thu nhập xứng đáng theo năng lực và giá trị đóng góp.
Nhận lại phần thu nhập đã khấu trừ nếu đạt thử việc (Thời gian thử việc 2 tháng, hưởng 85% lương); xem xét thay đổi thu nhập hàng năm.
Tham gia BHXH, BHYT, BHTN theo đúng quy định luật lao động.
Các bảo hiểm sức khỏe và bảo hiểm tai nạn 24/24.
3. Tổ chức học tập và văn hóa sôi nổi
Không gian làm việc mở với trang thiết bị hiện đại.
Các hoạt động văn hóa, thiện nguyện phong phú và sôi nổi.

title:
Vietnam UFLP Customer Development 2024
- job post
description:
BREAK YOUR LIMITS – BUILD YOUR LEADERSHIP EDGE WITH UNILEVER
If you aspire to challenge yourself with real-world experiences, urge to make a positive impact on society, and build a successful career, Unilever and U are having a “match”.
Being the first company to introduce the Management Trainee program to Vietnam, Unilever continuously enhances the program to accelerate Vietnamese talents to become the future leaders. The Unilever Future Leaders Programme (UFLP) 2024 will offer you the opportunity to cultivate leadership within yourself in a dynamic working environment, supported by great senior leaders and the development ecosystem at Unilever.
With a timeline within 2 years to become a Manager, UFLP 2024 is the ideal choice for pursuing your career goals and becoming #Manager #FutureLeader is one of Vietnam's leading FMCG companies.
Established over 100 years ago, we are one of the world’s largest consumer goods companies, driven by our purpose “to make sustainability commonplace”. At Unilever, we own meaningful brands such as Omo, Lifebuoy, Dove, Sunlight, Knorr, with the belief that doing business the right way drives superior performance. In Vietnam, Unilever is at the forefront with over 26 brands embedded in the daily lives of millions of Vietnamese consumers and with a distribution system that spans the length of the country.
WHY SHOULD YOU CHOOSE UNILEVER?
As the world is becoming VUCA, one needs to develop their career in a progressive and equity environment that breaks the limits and achieves success. Are you currently seeking the following points below?
A dynamic, open-minded, and agile working environment that respects diversity,
A career development program with a personalized training ecosystem,
Leadership trust and empowerment for you to engage and tackle real challenges from the marketplace,
Or accelerate your career with a competitive remuneration package?
If your answer is yes, then Unilever is the best workplace for you! We are confident in providing the best development environment, backed by:
12 consecutive years as the Top 1 global sustainable development company (GlobeScan SustainAbility Leaders),
BEST COMPANY in Vietnam (Vietnam HR Awards 2022),
3 consecutive years winning the WEPs Awards for Gender Equality in the Community and Partnership (UN Women),
Over 90% of employees satisfied with Management and Career Development opportunities at Unilever Vietnam.
All of this is to accompany you on the path to success!
WHY SHOULD YOU CHOOSE UFLP?
A credible program, specially designed for your career ambitions to become a future leader at Unilever within 2 years.
Being Empowered to tackle the most challenging experiences from Vietnam's leading FMCG company, increasing both professional expertise and leadership skills.
Specialized training programs with an international knowledge system and internal courses.
Participating and leading the team to solve the challenges such as Marketing & Growth, dCommerce, automation, or Data & Analytics in the context of digital transformation.
Being Mentored/Coached by Unilever leaders in Vietnam, Regionally, and Globally, with an open culture that respects opinions.
An equal, diverse, agile and hybrid working environment.
Competitive and attractive compensation and benefits


FRESH OPPORTUNITIES FOR YOU IN 6 DEPARTMENTS
Customer Development
Marketing
Supply Chain Non-Manufacturing
Supply Chain Manufacturing
Finance
Unilever Food Solutions
Consumer Market Insights (CMI)
APPLICATION PROCESS
Round 1: Online Application & Aptitude Test - Online
31/10/2023 – 5/12/2023
Round 2: Digital Interview - Online
8/1/2024 – 26/1/2024
Round 3: Discovery Center - Homebase (HCM)
26/2/2024 – 8/3/2024
Final Offer Result : Before 15/3/2024 at Homebase (HCM)
On-Boarding: 1/4/2024 at Homebase (HCM)
WHO IS UFLP 2024 LOOKING FOR?
Vietnamese nationals who have completed their Bachelor's/Master's degree in 2023, or Bachelor's/Master's graduates with less than 2 years of experience,
Cumulative GPA of 7.0/10.0 or equivalent,
Clear career goals and aspirations,
Independent and collaborative working skills; Leadership experiences in clubs, teams, groups, or social organizations is an advantage,
Enthusiastic and quick learners with a positive work attitude.
START YOUR JOURNEY WITH UFLP 2024 NOW:
Apply at: bit.ly/UnileverVNCareers
Please carefully read the registration instructions here and complete the application form with as much detail as possible.
Please submit your application before December 5, 2023. Moreover, to avoid technical issues, please ensure to complete the form well in advance of the deadline).
Note: Candidates who have reached the Discovery Center stage in previous UFLP years are not eligible to apply for UFLP 2024.
For further details please:
Ask your questions at our fanpage: facebook.com/UnileverCareersVietnam
Or contact to the hotline of UFLP: 0914 779 018 (Business Hours Only)
Unilever is an organisation committed to equity, inclusion and diversity to drive our business results and create a better future, every day, for our diverse employees, global consumers, partners, and communities. title:
Senior Associate - Economics and infrastructure advisory - Business Consulting - Hanoi Office
- job post
description:
We’re looking for Senior Associate with bold ambition and potential to grow with us, who learn from the best, surround themselves with the curious, ask better questions to seek better answers, so that we will together build a better working world.

As a member of the Business Consulting – Economics & Infrastructure advisory, you will be heavily engaged in providing consultancy services to government and public sector organizations at all levels, including national, local government agencies and state-owned enterprises, to support them overcome challenges and work towards country’s sustainable development goals and create better outcomes for the Vietnamese citizens. We also work with Multilateral and Bilateral Development Partners (ADB, WB, JICA, UK FCDO, DFAT, etc.) to support them deliver country development agendas.

Our focused working areas in Vietnam include Infrastructure development (for various sectors: transport, energy, telecommunication and digitalization, agriculture, healthcare and education etc.), Trade, Green/ Sustainable and ESG, Digitalization, Private Public Partnerships (PPPs), Public Investment Management, Public Finance Management, etc.

Your key responsibilities
Working together with EY local/international teams in government and public sector engagements.
Perform research and data analytic relating to government & public policy and issues.
Work effectively as part of GPS team, sharing responsibility, providing support, maintaining effective communication, and coordinate subordinate while provide updates to Manager or above as appropriate.
Coach and supervise junior associates to complete tasks and deliver qualified output, helping enhance their contribution and develop their capabilities.
Contribute to developing impactful reports and delivery presentations.
Assist in proposal development and market pursue.
Assist in project management and client engagement tasks, including billing, WIP and other administration.

You could find more about us as below link: EY US GPS Purpose - YouTube
Skills and attributes for success
Being pro- active, accountable, and mission and results- driven
Ability to deal with competing priorities, understanding how to manage resources, and communicating effectively
Ability to think laterally and adapt previous experience and solutions to new projects and be able to work in a fast-paced, dynamic team and environment
Excellent interpersonal relations and demonstrated ability to work with others effectively in teams
Superior verbal and written communication skills.
To qualify for the role, you must have:
A bachelor’s degree in Economics, Finance, Business, Engineering or relevant fields, preferably relating to public policy, green energy and/or sustainability (decarbonization and climate resilience), with minimum 3.0 GPA (out of 4.0); an advanced degree will be a plus
Minimum of 3 years of relevant working experience and passionate in delivering consulting services for government and/or SoEs and/or international development institutions
Solid research and strong analytical, problem-solving skills
Ability to develop, present new ideas and conceptualize new approaches and solutions
Excellent presentation skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Vietnamese
Strong leadership, teamwork and across countries collaboration
Execution focused and proven ability to work under tight deadlines
Willingness to learn, ability to work across different disciplines, move into new challenges and develop a robust understanding of different industries
Ideally, you’ll also have:
Knowledge or experience in infrastructure project preparation or transaction (greenfield or brownfield).
Knowledge or experience in Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) engagements.
Interest to one or more of the following sectors: Power & Utilities, Renewable Energy, Transportation, Social Infrastructure, Green Infrastructure.
Any relevant professional qualifications would be highly regarded.
If you can demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible.

Make your mark. Apply now.

Recruitment process
Submit an online application at http://www.ey.com/gl/en/careers with your CV, cover letter (statement of purpose), copy of your latest transcripts.
Shortlisted applicants will be invited to attend an offline test. Please check your email regularly for updates.

Want to get to know us better?
Visit: http://www.ey.com/gl/en/careers
Become a fan on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/EYCareersVietnam
Watch us on YouTube: http://www.youtube.com/ernstandyoungglobal

title:
Department Assistant – Corporate Affairs – HN
- job post
description:
Department Assistant – Corporate Affairs – HN
About AstraZeneca and AstraZeneca Vietnam
AstraZeneca
AstraZeneca (LSE/STO/Nasdaq: AZN) is a global, science-led biopharmaceutical company that focuses on the discovery, development, and commercialization of prescription medicines in Oncology, Rare Diseases and BioPharmaceuticals, including Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism, and Respiratory & Immunology. Based in Cambridge, UK, AstraZeneca operates in over 100 countries and its innovative medicines are used by millions of patients worldwide. Please visit astrazeneca.com and follow the Company on Twitter @AstraZeneca.
AstraZeneca Vietnam
As a Foreign Invested Enterprise with over 550 members, AstraZeneca is investing into Vietnam 310 million USD from 2020 to 2030 with a focus on reducing the burdens of non-communicable diseases, developing local talent, and uplifting the domestic biopharmaceutical R&D and manufacturing capabilities.
Over the last three decades accompanying Vietnam’s sustainable development, AstraZeneca has run several impactful programmes in collaboration with the Government, Ministry of Health and healthcare partners to promote disease awareness, prevention and early detection. In recent years, AstraZeneca Vietnam has received several certificates of merit from the Prime Minister and Minister of Health, for excellent contributions to Vietnam’s vaccine diplomacy, fight against COVID-19 and advancement of cancer treatment and disease awareness. The company has also been recognized among Vietnam’s Top 100 Best Places to Work (2018 – 2022) with various other industry awards from BritCham, EuroCham, and government agencies.
What you’ll do
Job Description / Capsule
The AstraZeneca Vietnam Corporate Affairs (CA) team oversees a variety of areas such as public affairs, government relations, and internal-external communications with a shared vision to protect and advance AstraZeneca’s interests and reputation in Vietnam through building healthcare and sustainability partnerships, policy-shaping and compelling communications.
The CA team is looking for an experienced Department Assistant to support our day-to-day operations and longer-term projects. Qualified candidates must demonstrate strong spirit of dedication, administrative, and finance skills, including taking initiative to address issues and anticipate needs. Candidates must be flexible and adaptable while maintaining excellent organizational and administrative skills in a high-energy, dynamic work environment.
The CA Department Assistant will report directly to the Associate Director of Corporate Affairs (ADCA) and support CA team’s operations and priorities.
Typical Accountabilities
(bullet point list)
The position will include various administrative and clerical tasks, communications, planning, and execution. Responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, the following:
Administrative/ Clerical tasks
Performing administrative support tasks for the Corporate Affairs team
Support the preparation of papers and dossiers for CA activity management through company system and process under the lead of activity owners.
Follow up and track official letters, contracts, dossiers of CA Team both in digital versions and hard copies. Ensure that all relevant documentation is properly stored and accessible when needed.
Financial/ Procurement
Managing day-to-day activities of budget areas and executing payments through company systems
Collaborate closely with the Procurement team on bidding procedures and vendor selection. Prepare and process PR/PO in a timely manner. Provide regular feedback to support agency management and identify areas for improvement.
Assist in the administration of the Third-Party Risk Management (3PRM) procedure, including vendor evaluation, and re-assessment of existing vendors. Monitor vendor performance and compliance with established agreements.
Plan and make regular payments for CA’s expenses such as courier fees, association membership fees, document translation fees, digital library subscriptions, etc.
Supporting ADCA travel and expenses and scheduling.
Closely follow up with ADCA and CA Managers on budget controlling. Analysing budget data and providing recommendations for final decision making
Logistics
Planning and execution of team meetings and events
Participate in company/ CA events as a project team member, overseeing event logistics, preparations from start to finish, and managing event budgets.
Collaborate closely with IT to ensure IT support for the site, including network connectivity, telecommunications, copiers, printers, AV-equipment, password and phone system resets, etc.
Compliance & SOP
Ensure diligent follow-up and tracking of adherence to the Code of Ethics, Compliance, and Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), while also ensuring timely and thorough completion of quarterly 1st line monitoring for Corporate Affairs activities.
Keep records of GA Interactions and Community Investment in accordance with AZ’s Global standards
Developing, reviewing, and improving administrative systems, policies, and procedures
Others
Executing other admin tasks and special projects as assigned by Line Manager
Support CA Team in management of company’s digital communication platforms under the lead by CA Manager
Education, Qualifications, Skills and Experience
Essential
Bachelor's degree preferred.
Proven experience in high-level administrative support.
Strong organizational and communication skills.
Good English for dossiers preparation and communications.
Ability to manage confidential information with discretion and professionalism.
Ability to work effectively in a high pressure and multitasking environment.
Proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Word and demonstratable excellence in Excel and Power Point
Willingness to take responsibility for assigned work, take initiative, seeing it through to completion.
Ability to manage time effectively, juggling multiple tasks, under time pressure.
Experience working in a professional office setting like an MNC is strongly preferred.
Why AstraZeneca?
At AstraZeneca, we’re dedicated to being a Great Place to Work. Where you are empowered to push the boundaries of science and fuel your entrepreneurial spirit. There’s no better place to make a difference to medicine, patients, and society. An inclusive culture that champions diversity and collaboration, and is always committed to lifelong learning, growth, and development. We’re on an exciting journey to pioneer the future of healthcare.
What will you get?
We provide driven packages and benefits for proficient and qualified candidates; a winning dream team and colleagues who share ONE values, ideas, and goals.
So, what’s next?
If you are already inspiring yourself to join our dream team, we can’t wait to hear from you.
If you are ready to bring new insights and fresh thinking to the table, Brilliant! We have one seat available, and we hope it’s yours.
If you’re curious to know more then please take initiative to recruitment.Vietnam@astrazeneca.com. We encourage your application.
Where can I find out more?
Visit our website www.astrazeneca.vn
Follow us on LinkedIn www.linkedin.com/company/astrazeneca/
Contact us via recruitment.Vietnam@astrazeneca.com

title:
Digital Media Manager
- job post
description:
Seniority Level
Mid Senior
Employment Type
Permanent
Scope
Mediatropy - Digital Media Manager
Mediatropy is an independent award-winning Digital Agency with over 75
people across offices in Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, Thailand, Philippines,
Hong Kong and Shanghai. We provide full service (strategy, creative content, web development, paid media, data & analytics, SEO/SEM and social) to a diversified clientele, specialising in anything from hospitality to luxury to financial services. We are passionate about cultures and travel, and most of our work is done in-house as we’re all hands-on. We have a great team environment to settle in, a place to learn and feel valued as we appreciate that everyone’seffort makes Mediatropy successful! Learn more about Mediatropy: www.mediatropy.com
We are passionate about new media and technologies and strive to achieve outstanding quality work that makes a difference. We are looking for a Digital Media Manager to join our dynamic team.
Key Responsibilities
Plan and execute paid media campaigns with objectives that will range from branding to driving user acquisition, retention and conversion across regional markets
Build media proposals and plans across media channels and campaign types to achieve various objectives
Manage client communication on media related activities
Identify and optimise campaigns through various testing and ad formats (AB Testing)
Report media performance to client and ensure KPIs are delivered and managed accordingly
Keep up-to-date on best practises, media consumption behaviours and competitive landscape to understand where and how to best reach consumers
Work cross-functionally across creative and content teams to maximise user experience for conversion and engagement
Requirements
Preferred Skills & Experience
Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Communications, Advertising or a
related field
Minimum 3-4 years of hands on experience planning and executing digital campaigns in an agency
Experience in activating paid media and optimising conversion rate
Channel exposure includes Google Ads, DV360, Facebook Ads, Programmatic and other media platforms
Proven record of optimising digital media campaigns with analytics and data-driven insights
Strong proficiency in Excel and excellent presentation skills to build actionable insights
Great communication and client management skills to understand client’s requests and briefs
Project management skills inclusive of the ability to prioritise tasks and push back if necessary for the overall good of the project delivery
A team player who will work with all our departments to deliver quality projects in a timely manner
Fun to work with and a positive/can-do attitude!

title:
Kỹ sư dữ liệu (Data Engineer)
- job post
description:
Mô tả công việc:
Xây dựng và phát triển hạ tầng dữ liệu tập trung. Data Warehouse, Data Lake
Xây dựng các pipeline dữ liệu để tự động hóa quy trình thu thập, xử lý và lưu trữ dự liệu.
Giám sát và tối ưu hóa các thành phần hệ thống dữ liệu để đáp ứng về dung lượng và tốc độ.
Thiết kế, đề xuất mô hình kiến trúc dữ liệu tại doanh nghiệp.
Hỗ trợ nhóm phân tích dữ liệu trong việc truy xuất dữ liệu và hiểu rõ cấu trúc dữ liệu.
Áp dụng các biện pháp bảo mật để đảm bảo an toàn dữ liệu.
Yêu cầu chung:
Trình độ học vấn chuyên ngành liên quan đến CNTT, khoa học máy tính hoặc lĩnh vực tương đương
Có kinh nghiệm về công nghệ lưu trữ và xử lý dữ liệu lớn.
Có khả năng thiết kế và triển khai các mô hình dữ liệu đa chiều, thiết kế pipeline và triển khai các công cụ ETL.
Hiểu biết sâu rộng về ngôn ngữ lập trình Python/Java
Tư duy tổng thể tốt và có khả năng triển khai chi tiết.
Tiếng Anh: Đọc hiểu
Ưu tiên:
Ứng viên có kinh nghiệm trong mảng tài chính, chứng khoán.
Ứng viên có kinh nghiệm làm việc với Azure hoặc AWS.
Có kinh nghiệm xử lý ETL dữ liệu với SSIS và SSAS là một lợi thế.
Có kinh nghiệm triển khai Hadoop, Airflow, Spark, Atlas.
Tiếng Anh: Đọc hiểu và trình bày báo cáo tốt.
Quyền lợi:
Thời gian làm việc 5 ngày/tuần (từ thứ Hai đến thứ Sáu).
Cơ hội thăng tiến, phát triển nghề nghiệp công bằng.
Thu nhập hấp dẫn, cạnh tranh.
Được hưởng chế độ BHXH, BHYT, BHTN, Bảo hiểm sức khỏe theo quy định của Công ty.
Được tham gia các chương trình đào tạo, huấn luyện của Công ty.
Môi trường làm việc chuyên nghiệp, thân thiện, năng động.
Mức lương: Thỏa thuận
Hồ sơ yêu cầu:
Bản Thông tin ứng viên theo mẫu của MBS.
Các mẫu thông tin ứng viên/CV khác không theo mẫu MBS là hồ sơ không hợp lệ.
Thời hạn nhận hồ sơ:
Phỏng vấn cuốn chiếu ngay khi nhận được hồ sơ đến khi tuyển được ứng viên phù hợp
Nơi nhận hồ sơ:
Nộp Bản Thông tin ứng viên theo mẫu của MBS theo hình thức sau:
Nộp hồ sơ Online trên website tuyển dụng/Gửi qua email: nhansu@mbs.com.vn
Nộp hồ sơ trực tiếp tại Công ty theo địa chỉ :
Phòng Nhân sự - Bộ phận Tuyển dụng
Công Ty Cổ Phần Chứng Khoán MB
Địa chỉ: Tầng 8, số 21 Cát Linh, Hà Nội
Điện thoại: 024 73045688 - 6691

title:
Manager - Business Process, Supply Chain Operations
- job post
description:
We are a leading chemical company, with the best teams developing intelligent solutions for our customers, and for a sustainable future.

We connect and develop people with diverse talents all over the world. For you, this means a variety of ways to progress.

Not only your performance but also your personality matter to us, regardless of gender, age, ethnicity, orientation, and background. At BASF, careers develop from opportunities.

OBJECTIVES OF THE POSITION

Support the implementation of Senior Project NGBA in Vietnam
To provide expertise on supply chain operations, i.e., order management, transport management, etc.
To support interfaces for cross-process functions (O2C-F, P2P, B2R)

MAIN AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACTIVITIES

Evaluate and prioritize activities and ensure the harmonization of global, regional and local projects with sites and regions (SCO Shared Service Platforms).
Identify strategic process requirements of all relevant stakeholders in BASF and structuredly hand over to the responsible Process Owner.
Assure integrated planning and constant alignment with respective Operating and Central Divisions, Competence Centers, Service Centers (Hub) and local Master Data Teams.
Focus on content - Responsible for change management and consult on master data structures of the impacted legal entity.
Coordinate for data validation activities, including cross functional data which impact SC scope.
Lead the discussion to drive closures on the SC related activities prior to go-live.
Prepare and conduct project status updates to relevant stakeholders and project steering committee.
Coordinate for country-specific training materials (called Handbooks) as aids training and communication.
Be accountable for completeness of User Acceptance Test by SC Key users in the country.
Participate, support and drive country SC data migration/ cut over activities planning and execution.
Work closely with other in the local country platform to ensure smooth project delivery.

JOB REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business, Supply Chain, Information Systems
Min 10 years in supply chain roles, e.g. transportation, planning, customer service
Project management
Experiences in Chemical Industry is advantage
Supply Chain certifications e.g. APICS, Lean Six Sigma are preferred
High proficiency in SAP (SD, TM, MM)
Expert knowledge of master data concepts, enterprise structure
Applications/ systems interfaces
“Track and trace” application

title:
[Chubb Life] Assistant Manager, Financial Planning & Analysis
- job post
description:
Reporting
Lead and coordinate with related departments to prepare and submit monthly/quarterly/annually/ad-hoc Group Report and other reporting requirements to Regional Office/Global Office.
Prepare Fund Splitting Report, operational status of Universal Life Fund in accordance with VAS and regulations applicable to life insurance companies in Vietnam.
Prepare compensation report of all distribution channels: agency and all partnership distribution channel. Tracking and control to ensuring compensation expense align with approval budget and actuarial pricing.
Support month-end closing process and co-operate with accounting team to ensure all expense booking in accordance with nature of chart of accounts and in-line with Budgeting/Forecasting.
Lead and coordinate with related departments to develop and timely submit various types of professional and effective management reports. Proactively, provide meaningful analysis and comments to support for decision making of BOD.
Optimize and enhance Sun System (accounting system) for integration to TM1 system (Planning & Forecasting system) to adapt automation where possible to improve productivity.
Planning & Budgeting and Forecasting
Lead and coordinate with related departments to prepare and submit Annual Budget Package, Company Strategic Plan Package as agreed deliverables set by Regional Office/Global Office.
Regularly forecast of general operating expenses (GOE) by nature of expense line as timeline and required process. Consolidate financial data to finalized forecasting Monthly Operating Statement (MOS) report by monthly/quarterly/annually.
Be one of the contact points of TM1 system (Planning & Forecasting system) and implement upload financial data to TM1 system.
Prepare monthly key performance indicators (sales, premium collected, agency metrics, partnership distribution metrics, profit, financial ratio…) with detailed analysis and comments.
Market intelligent reports and market share analysis.
Ensure sufficient monthly expense tracking and monitoring spending activities via accurate actual expense & timely accrued expense booked on Sun System vs. approved budget/forecast. Do variance analysis vs budget/forecast and differences will have to be justified.
Prepare presentation package and add valued comments to all required slide decks for Senior Management Team meeting.
Support line manager for ad-hoc analysis to facilitate various review/study on efficiency and effectiveness of spending activities with recommendations.

Bachelor’s degree in finance/Accounting. Certificate in ACCA/CMA/CPA is a plus.
At least 5 years of working experiences in FP&A/Management accounting in insurance companies.
Have a good financial analysis knowledge.
Good in spoken and written English.
Good understanding of VAS, IFRS/US-GAAP reporting.
Good communication, time management, team working and proactivity.
Willing to new-learning and improving, automation process.

title:
Business Analytics Manager
- job post
description:
The private capital market hosts 14 trillion dollars of investment that fund massive innovation around the world; yet much of it still operates on manual processes and fragmented legacy systems. Think of the New York City subway system running on analog machines!
Anduin's mission is to be the driving transformation engine for workflow automation, data processing, and systems integrations in this industry. Our products have powered over $68 billion in investments for 31,000+ investors across hundreds of funds.
Anduin’s founding team was composed of leading technologists from Palantir, Addepar, and IBM. We have brought together world-class talent in engineering, product, and business development to actualize the next generation of transactions and analytics in the private markets.
As a Business Analytics Manager, you will play a crucial role to facilitate data-informed decision-making at Anduin. You will liaise between business owners and data specialists to develop and execute a plan to answer the most important business questions with data. This role requires a strong understanding of data analytics, a sharp business mindset, and the ability to coordinate with different stakeholders.
Job Responsibilities:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and data requirements.
Prioritize, translate, and coordinate various data questions from different business teams.
Design and implement data collection systems, data analytics processes, and BI dashboards.
Extract, clean, and transform data from various sources to ensure data accuracy and consistency.
Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights that support business decision-making.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis to address specific business questions and provide actionable recommendations.
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess business performance and identify areas for improvement.
Assist in identifying opportunities for process optimization and operational efficiencies based on data analysis.
Stay updated with industry trends and advancements in data analytics and BI tools to drive innovation within the organization.
Create and maintain automated reports, data visualizations, and dashboards using BI tools.
Job Qualifications:

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

title:

description:

Medical Content Specialist will beresponsible for copy approval of LOC generated materials. This Medical Content Specialist role will provide the opportunity to lead key activities to progress career. These responsibilities include some of the following:

Why you?

Sound medical knowledge of basic sciences, but also disease areas such as infectious disease, respiratory, vaccine preventable illness
At least one -two years of experience in similar role.

Strong collaboration and communication skills.
