Why GSK?
LI-GSK
Why Us?
GSK is a global biopharma company with a special purpose – to unite science, technology and talent to get ahead of disease together – so we can positively impact the health of billions of people and deliver stronger, more sustainable shareholder returns – as an organization where people can thrive. Getting ahead means preventing disease as well as treating it, and we aim to positively impact the health of 2.5 billion people by the end of 2030.

Our success absolutely depends on our people. While getting ahead of disease together is about our ambition for patients and shareholders, it’s also about making GSK a place where people can thrive. We want GSK to be a place where people feel inspired, encouraged and challenged to be the best they can be. A place where they can be themselves – feeling welcome, valued and included. Where they can keep growing and look after their wellbeing. So, if you share our ambition, join us at this exciting moment in our journey to get Ahead Together.

title:
Demand & Supply Planner
- job post
description:
Demand & Supply Planner - VN

The Demand & Supply Chain Planner is responsible for ensuring optimal stock availability across distribution channels to provide a positive customer experience and maximize sales opportunities. He/she will lead the planning process from end-to-end including Demand Forecasting, Inventory Planning, and Sourcing. To succeed in this role, he/she must be able to analyze data and processes, find creative solutions, and effectively communicate with both internal and external stakeholders.

Responsibilities:
Develops demand plans for multiple time horizons and distribution channels.
Reviews historical sales trends, research demand drivers, prepare forecast data, develop statistical forecast models, and evaluate forecast results based on sales, inventory, and other data.
Maintains forecast accuracy by collaborating with the cross-functional team to gather updated sales and marketing information, especially for events that significantly affect demand such as promotions and supplier stock issues.
Plans, manages, and coordinates all activities related to the sourcing and procurement of necessary inventory needed to meet the changing levels of product demand.
Monitors and corrects inventory levels across warehouses to maintain the optimum quantity and mix of inventory and maximize working capital.
Leads replenishment planning ensure that inventory is in the right quantities and assortment across various locations to meet the demand.
Collaborates with the supply chain teams of brand partners to ensure timely replenishment, taking into account the different ordering processes for each brand.
Conducts monthly reviews with management to communicate forecast and inventory estimations, report on forecast and inventory accuracy, and propose improvement solutions.
Supports management with risk assessments and mitigation activities.
Ability to quickly ramp up and grasp detailed functional content when engaged with other cross-functional team members.
Positively drive changes and ensure goals and processes are moving forward towards excellence.
Pro-actively participate in ad-hoc projects & streamline processes as identified during course of work.
Requirements:
At least 3 years of professional experience in Supply Chain or a related field
Bachelor’s degree
Strong mathematical and statistical knowledge
Solid understanding of inventory management practices and procedures
Capability to multitask and problem-solve in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to conduct detailed procedures with a high level of execution.
Strong sense of time organization and urgency
Detail and process oriented
Able to work independently and within a team.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Strategic and critical thinker
Send your cv: talent@airrlabs.com

title:
Director Government Affairs: Vietnam
- job post
description:
Job Description

Join Intel and build a better tomorrow. Intel is in the midst of an exciting transformation, with a vision to create and extend computing technology to connect and enrich the lives of every person on Earth. So, join us and help us create the next generation of technologies that will shape the future for decades to come.
Intel's International Government Affairs team is seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join our Vietnam team as the Director of Government Affairs.
In the role, you will be responsible for working closely with Intel Vietnam( Hanoi ), the Director of Southeast Asia Government Affairs, and the Vice President of International Government Affairs to develop a comprehensive government relations strategy for ensuring a supportive semiconductor policy and regulatory environment for Intel's growth and operations.
The position will also be responsible for maintaining excellent relationships and networks with key Government stakeholders at the federal, provincial, and local level to positively position Intel and build a sound reputation and position of influence for the company.
Finally, given Intel's footprint in Vietnam the position will work closely with MSO and Senior Intel Vietnam site leadership to ensure continuity of operations and to position Intel as a partner of choice for the local and central Vietnam government.
The Director of Vietnam Government Affairs will:
Represent the organization in legislative matters with governmental bodies and for the implementation of all phases of regulatory strategy to ensure necessary approvals for company products/services.
Provide policy direction and coordinate Intel's efforts to engage with government directly or through the utilization of key opinion leaders, industry associations, foreign diplomatic missions, business chambers, media, and public-private partnerships.
Develop and implement programs to ensure awareness and appreciation of Intel's value proposition and enhance Intel's reputation and position Intel as a partner of choice.
Oversees Intel's lobbying activities in Vietnam and provide oversight and direction to any lobbyists, consultants, and associations engaged by the organization.
Establish and maintain relationships with external partners, industry, chambers, regulators, and opinion formers.
Monitor the industry/govt for intelligence sensing anticompetitive behavior and related risks and advise on necessary action.
Work closely with Intel Vietnam site management and internal stakeholders, such as Sales and Marketing, in identifying engagements points and developing an engagement strategy with government to support Intel's success.
Participate as an active member of the business community in activities and initiatives, including participation and leadership of business chambers, industry associations, etc.

Qualifications

Must have detailed knowledge of how the Government of Vietnam functions and understand its structure and legislative processes at the federal, provincial, and local levels.
Understanding of issues affecting multinational businesses in Vietnam and policies in the semiconductor technology domain.
Person in this role should possess exceptional diplomatic and negotiating skills, strong presentation, writing and communication skills and demonstrated experience in strategy development, implementation, and evaluation.
Ability to demonstrate business savvy to link government functions to overall company objectives and to generate significant accomplishments with minimal supervision.
Must have native Vietnamese language skills and be proficient in English business language.
Should have a working understanding of computing technologies.
Positive outgoing attitude and should be able to represent the company at external platforms and at senior ministerial levels.
Should be a team player, comfortable working in a multi-cultural environment and have a strong ability to partner and develop professional working relationships internally and externally.

Minimum Requirements:
Bachelor's degree in international relations, public policy, government relations, political science, law, or related field
10+ years related experience in government relations, regulatory affairs, and/or public affairs for a multinational company, NGO, or government.

Preferred Qualifications:
Master's degree with 10+ years related experience in government relations, regulatory affairs, and/or public affairs for a multination company, NGO, or government.

Inside this Business Group

Intel makes possible the most amazing experiences of the future. You may know us for our processors. But we do so much more. Intel invents at the boundaries of technology to make amazing experiences possible for business and society, and for every person on Earth. Harnessing the capability of the cloud, the ubiquity of the Internet of Things, the latest advances in memory and programmable solutions, and the promise of always-on 5G connectivity, Intel is disrupting industries and solving global challenges. Leading on policy, diversity, inclusion, education and sustainability, we create value for our stockholders, customers, and society.
Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.

Your privacy matters to Intel and we comply with applicable data protection laws. We collect and maintain personal information for recruitment related activities and your data will not be used for any other purpose. We retain personal information for the periods and purposes set forth in Intel Privacy Notice. Retention periods can vary significantly based on the type of information and how it is used. We do not share your personal information with third parties. In order for Intel to communicate with you on your application results, by submitting your information and proceeding with this application, you agree and consent that we can collect your personal information. You will have the ability to opt-out by informing vietnamjobs@intel.com or at any time selecting unsubscribe found at the bottom of our future marketing communications. You have rights to correct, update, request access to or deletion of your personal information as described in Intel Privacy Notice. In addition, if you wish to update or otherwise make changes to your resume, use Intel online application tool to resubmit a new resume.
Working Model

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.

Position of Trust
This role is a Position of Trust. Should you accept this position, you must consent to and pass an extended Background Investigation, which includes (subject to country law), extended education, SEC sanctions, and additional criminal and civil checks. For internals, this investigation may or may not be completed prior to starting the position. For additional questions, please contact your Recruiter.
JobType
Fully Remote

title:
Senior Medical Science Liaison (Hanoi - Vaccines)
- job post
description:
Job Description
Join a Global Innovative Pharmaceutical Company
Supportive and flexible team culture
Great opportunity for Personal and Professional development
Our Medical Affairs team advances patient care by engaging in scientific exchange with external medical experts and industry leaders ensuring the scientific value of our products is understood. We connect, communicate and train internal employees to ensure a thorough understanding of the science behind the medicine and review further unmet medical needs to support collaboration to further differentiate our portfolio.
THE OPPORTUNITY:
A Medical Science Liaison/Senior Medical Scientific Liaison is a field-based disease state expert responsible for supporting company’s strategic and scientific objectives, by exchanging scientific information with rostered scientific leaders about an assigned product and therapeutic area (TA) through balanced discussion. Providing accurate, fair and balanced scientific exchange is a core function. The MSL’s interactions with scientific leaders are organic, comprehensive peer-to-peer discussions enabling their assessment of evolving standards of care for patients and research opportunities. Scientific exchange allows the
MSL to collect insights regarding gaps in understanding and data needed by the healthcare community that can be shared with the wider organization.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Primary Activities – Accountabilities, Supervision
Being product and disease state experts who engage in non-promotional scientific exchange with SLs or KDMs (Scientific Leaders or Key Decision Makers).
Execute Field Medical Engagement Plans within the scope of local and global policies, local rules and regulations and aligned with the Field Medical SOP.
The MSL is responsible for ensuring that they are fully versed in the therapeutic area and up-to-date on: all major studies, both ongoing and completed; product information on company and other companies’ relevant therapies; clinical data and relevant pipeline data to provide the most accurate data to SLs, KDMS and the healthcare community, in a balanced way, to improve patient care.
The MSL’s primary responsibility is to engage in non-promotional peer-to-peer communication with medical/scientific information to SLs and KDMs on their roster, based on scientific exchange and services oriented towards the stakeholder’s professional interests & needs.
May have chance to cover multiple countries based on company franchise strategies.
They do this by:
Defining and maintaining a roster of Scientific Leaders and Key Decision Makers in their therapeutic area.
Interacting with identified Scientific Leaders and healthcare administrators (KDMs) by exchanging balanced medical / scientific information and by appropriately communicating these exchanges with internal colleagues.
Utilizing scientific and medical expertise to communicate scientific information in individual and group presentations.
Respond to unsolicited requests for medical, scientific, pipeline, organization product information from SLs or KDMs utilizing appropriate approved scientific materials and appropriately documenting the use of these resources.
Providing insights internally on scientific gaps, ideas and other topics gathered from Scientific exchange to inform areas of interest, clinical trial programs, development programs and company TA strategy.
Alert investigators to our program for Investigator Initiated Study Proposals (MISP) and to the process for submitting investigator designed proposals for review and approval; encourage and facilitate research publication of MISP studies supported by the company, in strict compliance with global/local guidance regarding MISP's.
Work with Global Medical Affairs/Global Clinical Trials to identify potential investigators for Phase 1, 2 and 3 clinical trials
Ensuring various engagement metrics (both quantitative and qualitative) are achieved.
Providing on-label medical insights and training to internal colleagues including the organization and competitor products and disease state with their therapeutic knowledge.
Attending / participating in scientific congresses/meetings in Singapore and internationally to understand the role of emerging data on patient treatment within the TA covered, when requested, allowing for more balanced Scientific exchange.
Support the preparation of non-promotional Medical Education Programs
Performing all company business in accordance with company policies and procedures and country regulations
Cost Centre Management
Obtain manager approval for all travel and extraneous expenditure
Manage cost of local/international travel within the company travel policy
ABOUT YOU:
Skills, Knowledge, Experience & Qualifications required:
Tertiary qualifications in a Medical degree; PhD in health or life sciences; PharmD or a pharmacy degree.
If pharmacy degree a minimum of:
2 years of pharmaceutical industry experience or
2 years in an in-field customer facing role in the pharmaceutical industry (preferred).
Clear and concise communication skills (viz. verbal, written, presentations) and interpersonal skills with the ability to work in cross-functional teams.
Demonstrated analytical skills and a solid understanding of research methodology.
Ability to learn and convey medical/scientific information to healthcare professionals and decision-makers.
Knowledge of local pharmaceutical industry guidelines/code, regulatory/reimbursement framework and clinical research guidelines (ICH-GCP, Declaration of Helsinki).
Ability to travel extensively (up to 70% of the working week).

title:
Employer Branding & Sourcing Senior Executive
- job post
description:
Job Purpose:
The job holder will be responsible of promoting Guardian employer brand to attract candidates and support recruitment needs aligned with the company's strategy, and also ensure the availability of workforce in assigned departments and areas.
Responsibility:
Employer branding:
Drive and enhance the employer brand identity across multiple channels and digital platforms by developing engaging communication materials such as images, videos, taglines, etc... via the Career page, Facebook, LinkedIn, YouTube, TikTok, or other potential channels.
Be a content creator on various channels by staying updated on market trends and practices in employer branding.
Establish and maintain positive relationships with universities/ colleges to communicate, organize activities, or join recruitment events: job fairs, company/store visits, workshops, internships, and management trainee programs.
Together with the Talent Acquisition team maintain Guardian's image at every candidate touchpoint: attraction, interview, onboard, etc.
Support the Talent Acquisition team by collaborating with Leadership Teams and the regional Sourcing team to fine-tune the Employee Value Proposition (EVP) to ensure its relevance and effectiveness.
Assist the Talent Acquisition team in inspiring employees as primary ambassadors who showcase their employee experience to help attract candidates/ followers.
Continuously review past projects for improvement, provide feedback on these results to stakeholders, and make data-driven decisions about future Employer Branding activities.
Sourcing:
Set up and manage talent pools for recruiting demand, especially for mass hiring.
Together with the Talent Acquisition team to create, propose, and deliver plans for special recruitment campaigns in order to support business growth and transformation.
Screen resumes and applications for suitability; conduct initial screening interviews, both telephone and personal; make hiring recommendations based upon the eligibility criteria provided for assigned areas.
Ensure accurate and timely delivery of recruitment reports.
Ensure that the recruitment database is maintained effectively and the recruitment process.
Maintain the recruitment database and follow company policies.
Analyze sourcing approaches and tools to increase efficiency.
Perform other duties as assigned by the line manager or Head of People & Culture.

Requirement:
Minimum 3 years of branding/marketing experience, with employer branding and communication preferred.
Bachelor’s degree in Business, HR, Marketing or related field preferred
Have experience in event organizing, creating and managing materials on social platforms (Facebook, LinkedIn, Tik Tok and other platforms).
Proficiency in design tools: Canva, video making tools…
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (both English and Vietnamese); must be able to write and tell compelling story
Ability to identify market trends in employer branding.
Strong attention to detail, prioritization, and time management skills.
Preferred experience in Retail/F&B/Hospitality industries.
Ability to work under pressure with a positive attitude.
APPLICATION:
Interested candidates please send your application package to email tuyendung@guardian.com.vn

title:
Corporate Banking Relationship Manager
- job post
description:
Job Advert Details
Some careers open more doors than others.
If you’re looking for a career that will unlock new opportunities, join HSBC and experience the possibilities. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

HSBC Wholesales Banking (WSB) serves millions of businesses ranging from small to large corporates, providing commercial customers with a full range of banking services including: Global Trade and Receivables Finance, RMB solutions, multi-currency business accounts, payments and cash management, and wealth management and insurance, as well as a comprehensive range of financing solutions. With dedicated Relationship Managers and Product Specialists providing local support and advice in over 64 countries and territories, HSBC helps connect customers to opportunities.

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as an Corporate Banking Relationship Manager.

Role Responsibilities:
Increase HSBC’s market presence and profile for Large corporate banking business by implementing an active calling, eco system mapping program for the incumbent’s and managing the sales activities in order to develop new Wholesale Banking business.
Manages his/her assigned portfolio of existing clients with a strong emphasis on proactively providing client driven value add solutions, Client-oriented professional to pro-actively manage a complex portfolio of clients, becoming a trusted advisor to lead strategic dialogues with clients at a portfolio level through the understanding of specific business requirements and delivering creative and flexible customer solutions.
Contribute to the GTRF, GPS, GMs and Capital financing business by formulating and implementing an aggressive sales plan with strong focus on increasing profitability and wallet share, effectively managing of top WSB relationships from within the designated portfolio, actively engage with relevant stakeholders - Product Partners, CMBO, Sectors, Local RMs etc. - to explore all potential business opportunities both onshore and offshore.
Maximize customer satisfaction through exceptional customer service, providing information about products and services that suit and fulfill customers' needs, closely work the RM Support and support functions to ensure customer’s smooth transactions/ requests.
Deepen existing relationships and monitoring the credit risk associated with the portfolio, within the operating and strategic plans and in accordance with credit guidelines. Safeguard the Bank from potential loss by ensuring that credit reviews are kept up to date and that problem accounts are identified and dealt with at an early stage and operational controls are in place.
Be the First Line of Defend to protect the bank from any Financial Crime Risk, escalate all potential risks / unusual activities to the management, adhere to the consistent application of Group policy and adherence to regulatory, financial, and legal standards to minimise business and reputational risks.
Ensure losses through operational failings are minimized.
Drive and strengthen the culture of openness and teamwork, dependable and responsible and fairness within the team.
Work and deliver satisfactory results in project(s) assigned by Wholesale Banking from time to time.
Qualifications

Certifications, Qualifications & Experience:
Five years experience in Corporate Banking
Motivated, positive and eager to learn
Excellent verbal and written communication skills (English and Vietnamese)
Knowledge of the Bank’s operational procedures and systems
Proven track record in a client focused environment
Experience of working in a teamwork environment
Proven experience in identifying and managing the risks, issues and dependencies related to the business and in decision making
Customer service and team skills promoting an environment of co-operation and trust, overcoming resistance where encountered
An ability to get things done
Possess drive and resilience
Possess developed interpersonal skills
Possess planning, organization and time management abilities
Ability to communicate, identify and analyze customer requirements, provide and sell need-based solutions to customers effectively

You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.

http://www.hsbc.com/careers

HSBC is committed to building a culture where all employees are valued, respected and opinions count. We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. Personal data held by the Bank relating to employment applications will be used in accordance with our Privacy Statement, which is available on our website.

Issued by The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited

PHÚC LỢI

MÔ TẢ CÔNG VIỆC
Khảo sát hiện trạng và đánh giá các nhu cầu của các đơn vị/ bộ phận nghiệp vụ về việc khai thác dữ liệu, xây dựng báo cáo; thực hiện tư vấn và phân tích nhu cầu khai thác dữ liệu từ các đơn vị/ bộ phận nghiệp vụ trong ngân hàng; chuyển hóa các yêu cầu nghiệp vụ thành các yêu cầu về dữ liệu, hệ thống và công cụ hỗ trợ khai thác dữ liệu; phối hợp với các đơn vị phát triển, đưa ra kiến trúc khai thác dữ liệu để cung cấp sản phẩm phù hợp cho đơn vị/ bộ phận nghiệp vụ
Tìm hiểu, đề xuất các cải tiến nâng cao hiệu quả, rút ngắn thời gian tạo lập báo cáo và truy xuất dữ liệu tại các đơn vị nghiệp vụ trên toàn hàng mà trọng tâm là phát triển kỹ năng tự khai thác dữ liệu (data self-service) tại khối nghiệp vụ cụ thể.
Quản lý danh mục dịch vụ báo cáo, trong đó xác định chủ sở hữu của các báo cáo, đơn vị/ bộ phận nghiệp vụ hiện đang sử dụng các báo cáo, cũng như tần suất, mục đích sử dụng dịch vụ dữ liệu.
Phối hợp với các bộ phận phát triển báo cáo quản trị từ đó thu thập thông tin nguồn dữ liệu cho các báo cáo thuộc danh mục quản lý
Tìm hiểu và đánh giá, đề xuất giải pháp quản lý tập trung danh mục báo cáo, logic mapping báo cáo.
Thu thập nhu cầu về dữ liệu để xây dựng dashboard; thiết kế và phối hợp cùng các đơn vị phát triển để hiện thực hóa các dashboard trên nền tảng dữ liệu tập trung; hỗ trợ các đơn vị sử dụng công cụ BI khai thác dữ liệu từ kho dữ liệu
YÊU CẦU CÔNG VIỆC
Kinh nghiệm tối thiểu 01 năm làm việc trong các tổ chức tín dụng, tài chính hoặc Ngân hàng là một lợi thế;
Có kiến thức nền tảng tốt về hệ quản trị cơ sở dữ liệu và mô hình hóa dữ liệu;
Sử dụng thành thạo ít nhất một công cụ BI (Power BI, Tableau) để trực quan hóa dữ liệu;
Cẩn thận, tỉ mỉ, làm việc tốt dưới áp lực;
Ưu tiên các ứng viên có kinh nghiệm tham gia triển khai các dự án về báo cáo, dữ liệu tại các công ty tài chính/ngân hàng thương mại;
Ưu tiên các ứng viên có hiểu biết về phương pháp Agile, đã tham gia trong hoạt động thực tế hoạt động theo mô hình Scrum Team
Ưu tiên các ứng viên đã có kinh nghiệm làm BA, phân tích kinh doanh, MIS cho phát triển báo cáo tại các ngân hàng/tổ chức tài chính;
Có kỹ năng, tư duy lập trình và sử dụng tốt ít nhất một ngôn ngữ lập trình ứng dụng là một lợi thế;

title:

description:
Job title: Medical Representative, Vaccines - Nghe An, Thanh Hoa, Ha Tinh
Hiring Manager: Area Manager, Vaccines Vietnam
Location: based in Nghe An/ Thanh Hoa/ Hanoi
Job type: Permanent, Full-time
About the job
We are a worldwide leader in human Vaccines for 100 years. We develop and produce a broad range of high-quality vaccines to protect people around the world from severe diseases at each and every stage of life. We have continued strong growth and best in class products to protect against many diseases such as flu, meningitis, polio, pertussis, bronchiolitis and much more. We improve people’s lives by developing innovative vaccination solutions against many diseases. We innovate in vaccines manufacturing through digitalization and we engage in partnerships for disease prevention, to sustainably maximize vaccination impact. We give employees the opportunity to grow and encourage them to build diversified career paths within the Sanofi organization.
Main responsibilities:
Raise Healthcare Professionals' satisfaction about Sanofi's service and ensure sales performance of a determined set of products in an assigned geography (3 provinces in North-Central: Thanh Hoa, Nghe An, Ha Tinh) by:
Provide Product information of Sanofi Vaccines & establish relationship with target HCPs
Implement promotional activities (sales activities) and marketing plan in territory to raise Sanofi's share of voive
Focus and update Data of customers
Ensure the coverage and right frequency of call visits
Collect market insight, competitors’ intelligence as well as other needed information
Leverage Digital transformation when approaching Customers aligned with BU's strategy
Analyze sales figures of territory, define gaps/ SWOT and build actionable TAP
Report pharmacovigilance
About you
Experience: at least 1 year of experience in same position in Multinational Company, Vaccines experience is a plus
Soft skills: good at communication & presentation skills, teamwork, territory management, agile & proactive
Technical skills: MS Office
Education: Medicine or Pharmacy degree
Languages: be able to communicate in English
Sanofi Behaviors and Skills
This position is required to demonstrate behaviors such as Stretch, Put the interest of the organization, Act in the interest of our patients and customers and Take Action. During the interview we will also be asking for examples of skills such as Strategic Thinking, Result Orientation, People Leadership (if applicable), Relationship and Influence.
Pursue progress, discover extraordinary
Better is out there. Better medications, better outcomes, better science. But progress doesn’t happen without people – people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. So, let’s be those people.
At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!
#LI-SEA
At Sanofi diversity and inclusion is foundational to how we operate and embedded in our Core Values. We recognize to truly tap into the richness diversity brings we must lead with inclusion and have a workplace where those differences can thrive and be leveraged to empower the lives of our colleagues, patients and customers. We respect and celebrate the diversity of our people, their backgrounds and experiences and provide equal opportunity for all.

title:
Facilities Assistant (Vietnam)
- job post
description:
Facilities Assistant (Vietnam)

Date: 3 Nov 2023
Location: Ho Chi Minh City, East Asia, VN
Company: British Council
We support peace and prosperity by building connections, understanding and trust between people in the UK and countries worldwide.

We work directly with individuals to help them gain the skills, confidence and connections to transform their lives and shape a better world in partnership with the UK. We support them to build networks and explore creative ideas, to learn English, to get a high-quality education and to gain internationally recognised qualifications.

Working with people in over 200 countries and territories, we are on the ground in more than 100 countries. In 2021–22 we reached 650 million people.

Job Title: Facilities Assistant (Vietnam)

Pay band: 3 / J

Location this role could be based: HCMC, Vietnam

Department: Country IT Delivery

Contract type: Fixed term, 2 years with the possibility of an extension

Role Purpose

To provide effective, efficient premises and facilities support services to ensure business continuity and minimize interruption to operations of the British Council’s main office and teaching centres in Ho Chi Minh City.

Main accountabilities but not limited to the following:

Premises and facilities management
Assists to ensure the premises and facilities are fully operational and fit for purposes at main office and teaching centres.
Checks classrooms and test-rooms’ set-up to ensure British Council standards are met. Any problems with furniture and equipment occurring should be immediately reported to line manager for prompt actions as required.
Assists in facilities and premises management for main office and teaching centres such as monitor and keeps track on facilities and premises regular maintenance for air-conditioning system, fire alarm system, electric systems, water supply system, paper shredders, drinking water dispensers, etc. to ensure all maintenance works carried out properly and within lead-time.
Regularly inspects premises and facilities conditions on a weekly basis, reports to line manager immediately on problems and takes appropriate actions in response to the issues as assigned by the line manager.
In cooperation with Administration team, manages outsourced office services in the areas of security service, cleaning service, carpet, chairs wash, pest control, etc. to ensure the services provided in line with expected/ agreed level of quality and standards.

Asset management
Works closely with Administration team and IT team to ensure inventory system’s data input and labelling for new assets to be proper carried out on monthly basis.
Assist line manager in asset management including organising new assets (if required), monitoring assets’ status and disposal (if any) following corporate and financial policies, guidelines.
Assists line manager in inventory checks carried out twice per year and ensures the correctness of outcomes.
Assist line manager and Premises & Facilities Manager in resolving issues relating to security, health and safety if needed.
Supports line manage and Administration Executive on organizing Fire Safety training sessions delivered to all staff members on annual basis and First aid training for nominated first aiders upon teams’ demand.
Assist line manager in providing support on a range of activities and/ or events delivered relating to Green/ Environmental Framework (EF), Equality-Diversity-Inclusion activities (EDI), Enterprise Risk Management Framework (ERMF).

Security, fire safety, health safety and environment related tasks
Oversees the security service and reports to line manager immediately if there is any incident occurring for actions required to ensure premises security standard.
Regularly carries out checks of premises check regarding fire safety requirements on a weekly basis following the provided checklists and report to line manager on any issues occurring to ensure fire safety standards are met at the main office and teaching centres.
Backup role and other tasks
Backs up line manager as and when required and/ or expected to ensure all premises and facilities are fully operational and fit for purpose in HCMC main office and branch teaching centres.
Assists line manager in new premises projects in areas of technical and health safety supports, etc.
Handles other tasks as assigned by line manager.
Other important features or requirements of the role
Works effectively with diversity as an essential and integral part of daily work and consistently meet the British Council’s Equality-Diversity-Inclusion policy and Safeguarding policy and standards in carrying out all internal and external duties.
Manages information created and received in compliance with the British Council’s information management standards, policies, the UK Data Protection Principles and local legislation.
Demonstrates a commitment to reflective practice, professional and organisational development objectives, taking advantage of opportunities to enhance qualifications and or gain/ share knowledge for the team as well as for self. Make a positive contribution to team meetings and give suggestions to management for improving business support practices and procedures based on customer feedback.
Assures other business support services related tasks or duties as and when required by the management team.
Understands that this role profile may be amended to meet operational demand and any changes will be discussed with affected staff member(s) with a minimum of one month’s notice.

Role specific knowledge and experience

Minimum
One year experience in field of premises and facilities management
and level 1 computer skills (can effectively use Windows platform applications: Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Desirable
Technical background (civil engineering, electrical, refrigeration and air-conditioning engineering)
previous experience of a minimum of 2 years in similar role
and/or experience in health and safety.

Requirements

Undergraduate degree or equivalent experience.
The British Council Teaching Centre operates from 8.00am to 10.00pm from Monday to Friday and from 7.30am to 8.30pm on Saturday and Sunday. This post may be required to follow working patterns that include unsocial hours with priority to support main office and teaching centres’ daily operation. (This requirement will be managed within HR guidelines, including work-life balance policies.)
The British Council systems and global processes operate in English. Written and verbal proficiency in English is required.

Additional Information

Conditions of Employment: Local Direct Hire
Applications are welcomed from candidates currently in this location with a natural right to work.
Applications are also welcomed from candidates currently based in other British Council country offices. However, please note candidates must have a natural right to work in the country, on a permanent basis, as immigration clearance and/or on-going visa support is NOT provided by the British Council for this role. Relocation support is also NOT provided.

Closing Date: Tuesday, 05 December 2023 at 23:59 Philippines Time (GMT+8)

A connected and trusted UK in a more connected and trusted world.

Equality , Diversity, and Inclusion (EDI) Statement

The British Council is committed to policies and practices of equality, diversity and inclusion across everything we do. We support all staff to make sure their behaviour is consistent with this commitment. We want to address under representation and encourage applicants from under-represented groups, in particular, but not exclusively, on grounds of ethnicity and disability. All disabled applicants who meet the essential criteria are guaranteed an interview and we have Disability Confident Employer Status. We welcome discussions about specific requirements or adjustments to enable participation and engagement in our work and activities.

The British Council is committed to safeguarding children, young people and adults who we work with.

We believe that all children and adults everywhere in the world deserve to live in safe environments and have the right to be protected from all forms of abuse, maltreatment and exploitation as set out in article 19, UNCRC (United Nations Convention on the Rights of the Child) 1989.

Appointment to positions where there is direct involvement with vulnerable groups will be dependent on thorough checks being completed; these will include qualification checks, reference checks, identity & criminal record checks in line with legal requirements and with the British Council’s Safeguarding policies for Adults and Children.

If you have any problems with your application please email askhr@britishcouncil.org

Please note: Applications to this role can only be considered when made through the Apply section of our careers website. Our ‘ASK HR’ email is only to be used in case of a technical issue encountered when applying through the careers website. Emails with supporting statements and CV/Resumes sent to this email address will not be reviewed and will be deleted.

title:

description:
JOB SUMMARY
Title: Copywriter Trainee
Department: Creative Production
Year of Experience: 6 months – 1 year

Subordinate: None

This position is always open all year round and is not a part of our Annual Trainee Program. Only candidates with successful test results will be proceeded to the next round.
OBJECTIVES
We are looking for a Copywriter Trainee with a solid background in content creation, passion for developing content solutions to deeply impact Client’s Brand-Campaign Performance in general. You will be an important part of our Creative team to drive the outstanding business results for PMAX.

JOB DESCRIPTION

Content Production (70%)

Others (20%)

Undertake the internal projects assigned by the line manager.

JOB REQUIREMENTS
Third/Final year or recently graduated students major in Communications, PR or Marketing
Experienced in copywriting and/or creative/branding content creation
Understanding different language styles that appeal to various target markets
Clear, concise, and grammatically correct writing style
Good sense of social listening to catch the latest trends
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Independent, passionate, self-motivated and quick learner
Able to create content script for Tik tok video or be a tiktoker (edit and being talent) is a plus
Good in English is a must
Can commit at least 3-months internship program and can work full-time is a plus

BENEFITS
Personal benefit
Be able to become a Digital Copywriter Executive after apprenticeship.
Be able to experience and grow yourself rapidly, especially in the field of digital marketing.
Be able to work and build-up relationships with plenty of well-known brands such as Amazon, Uniqlo, FE CREDIT, ect.
Be able to work with a team of talented people, always ready to take on new challenges for new learning.
Be able to achieve outstanding materials in forming a personal portfolio for future career opportunities.
Company benefit
Transparent career path and 13th-month salary
Flexible working time with 4 days working from home per month and 15 paid leaves per year
Insurance as full salary (SHUI) for all official employees
Annual health check-up and Healthcare Insurance PTI for all official employees
Laptop supply/allowance or support for laptop purchase costs on an individual basis for all official employees
Internal training & career development opportunities, and external L&D budget sponsorship
Team bonding budget quarterly, snack time to engage team members
Quarterly, Yearly Recognition Gifts & Awards and gifts on special occasions (birthday, New year…)
Holiday activities; Company trip; Year End Party; Company Birthday; Culture Day; Quarterly Town Hall.
Other staff welfare allowances.

ABOUT PMAX
PMAX is a Total Performance Marketing pioneer in Vietnam with in-depth digital marketing expertise and total marketing solutions to deeply impact brand performance and drive businesses growth effectively. Founded in 2016 by prominent strategists and continuously led by over 20 professionals specialized in the Total Performance Marketing field, PMAX empowers businesses to maximize their business results by optimizing their marketing performance. With over 9 services (research, strategy, platform, media, creative, campaign management, merchandising, commercial, tech & data, etc.), 4 primary solution packages (Branding, E-commerce, App, Lead Generation) and established track records, PMAX has successfully worked with over 400 clients on over 600 successful projects.
PMAX has earned 5 MMA SMARTIES awards and 4 Agency of the Year honors during the business growth. PMAX has also become a Premium partner of Facebook, Google, TikTok, Shopee, Zalo, and others.
For you – talents with strong brain power who are seeking “the bigger shirt” for your effective growth, we are confident to offer a young, dynamic and aggressive environment with unlimited opportunities to maximize your potential and optimize your capacity in order to make a leap to marketing experts & business leaders.
Why PMAX?
1. We provide opportunity of fast-track career path and driving to create impact
Clear competency framework to optimize and improve your potentials with multiple approaches
Be empowered to create the best practices and shape the way forwards
2. We offer non-stop learning & growth with in-depth expertise knowledge
Trusted total performance marketing agency, top-of-mind performance marketing agency in Vietnam
Mentoring & coaching with high-qualified professionals and gain comprehensive functional expertise
Always-on self-learning spirit mode
3. We surround you with top talents sharing the same set of vision and value
Step out of comfort zone with highly motivating team and aggressive growth mindset
Uphold to high-quality standards as our working ways
4. We keep ourselves supportive, transparent, data-driven, and caring environment with a constantly upgrading benefits package
Collaborate effectively with other by incentivizing motivation
Enhance productivity by keep updated and utilize technology & smart system at work
Proud to be minded of every concerns related to employee’s well-being to bring the better benefits package and uplift happiness at work

title:
WVV Strategy Realization Lead
- job post
description:
With over 70 years of experience, our focus is on helping the most vulnerable children overcome poverty and experience fullness of life. We help children of all backgrounds, even in the most dangerous places, inspired by our Christian faith.

Come join our 33,000+ staff working in nearly 100 countries and share the joy of transforming vulnerable children’s life stories!
Employee Contract Type:
Local - Fixed Term Employee (Fixed Term)
Job Description:
Background
World Vision is a Christian relief and development organization working to create lasting change in the lives of children, families and communities living in poverty. World Vision serves all people regardless of religion, race, ethnicity or gender. As a child-focused organization, WV’s work focuses on children, ensuring they are protected and their basic needs are met. World Vision Vietnam (WVV) has been funded from 13 support countries in Europe, Asia, the Americas and Australia. Funding of WVV consists of sponsorship program funding (70%) and PNS/grants (30%). WVV employs about 430 staff, of which 93% are Vietnamese nationals.
WVV is operating in 14 provinces including: Ha Noi, Hung Yen, Dien Bien, Hai Phong, Thanh Hoa, Ha Tinh, Quang Binh, Quang Tri, Da Nang, Quang Nam, Quang Ngai, Binh Thuan, Ho Chi Minh, Dak Nong. WVV’s Area Program (AP) usually focuses within one administrative district of a province which populated by ethnic minority people with high rates of poverty. A uniqueness of WVV’s Development Program Approach (DPA) is that AP team members are based at district level where the AP is located, which enables them to work closely with government partners and communities on a daily basis. Beside the APs, WVV is also implementing different Special and Grant Projects to meet the specific needs of vulnerable children in both AP and non-AP areas.
WVV’s strategic goal for 2023 to 2027 is to achieve the sustained well-being of three million children, especially the most vulnerable. Every year, we aim to directly benefit 244,470 children and indirectly benefit three million children, including more than 159,220 MVC. The Strategy is developed in alignment with World Vision’s Strategy “Our Promise 2030” - Phase 2.
Purpose of Position
Facilitate the process of formulation, execution, monitoring and evaluation of National Strategy in alignment with Partnership and Regional Strategies. This would include facilitating the design/ progress tracking/ evaluation of strategic initiatives, systems, processes and guidelines to implement the National Strategy across the organization and enhance organizational effectiveness and accountability.
Coordinate Strategy Realization Committee to ensure that key members are effectively engaged in strategy formulation and management.
Key Responsibilities
1. Strategic Intent (20%)
Strengthen strategic awareness and thinking among leaders at all levels by enriching and enhancing understanding on strategy development and implementation
Provide strategic advice to the National Director and Senior Leadership Team by giving briefings, developing materials and recommendations and serving as a sounding board on key decisions.
Be part of all core decision-making processes and give strategic guidance/advise on how to proceed with difficult decisions
Review and adjust the national strategy in a timely manner as appropriate to changes in internal and external landscape
2. Planning, Monitoring and Reporting (50%)
Facilitate the development of Annual Business Plans including the Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) and Strategic Initiatives in alignment with National Strategy.
Coordinate the annual planning at department level to ensure that department’s objectives, KPIs and Initiatives are aligned with Business Plans.
Support the development of technical programs’ design to ensure their strategic alignment
Coordinate with departments to implement strategic initiatives in alignment with National Strategy
Consolidate the quarterly annual business plan reports in working with Program Effectiveness Unit
Conduct initial analysis on key achievement and gaps against targets of the Annual Business Plan
Organize quarterly reflection with SRSC Meeting to have in-depth analysis on achievements and gaps against the strategy and Annual Business Plan as well as discuss and agree on follow-up actions.
Facilitate the development, implementation, monitoring and reporting Organizational Capacity Plans in alignment with National Strategy
Coordinate with different departments to strengthen Organizational Capabilities to be ready for and adapt to strategic changes
3. Strategic Resource Allocation (10%)
Develop or adapt the tools and mechanisms for strategic resource allocation to ensure that resources from different funding streams are allocated for strategic priorities toward CWB impact, in close collaboration with Finance Function
Analyse financial report/data to identify implications on WVV’s strategic directions and advise the SLTs accordingly.
4. Strategy Communication (10%)
Disseminate the National Strategy and Business Plan to all internal and external stakeholders to foster strategic alignment, synergy and partnering.
Work with Communications Department to develop materials to communicate the Strategy to different stakeholders.
5. Others (10%)
In close cooperation with Security and Enterprise Risk Management focal point, assess and mitigate all the critical risks which prevent from achieving Strategic Objectives.
Regularly the related risks to Software Riskonnect.
Be part of all Pre-Assessments for possible new Aps/Projects.
Perform other duties as assigned by the manager to contribute to the team performance.
Knowledge & Skill
1. Required Education, training, license, registration, and certification
Bachelor degree in Business Administration, Organizational Development Studies, Leadership Studies or any related university degree
Master degree in related fields is preferred
2. Preferred Knowledge and Qualifications
Proven strategic thinking and organizational development skill.
Proven effective networking & collaborative skills.
Proven thorough partnership analysis, building and updating
Excellent data analysis and communication skills.
Ability to work well with cross-functional teams for joint initiatives
Ability to understand and anticipate complex political issues and sensitive government protocols that may affect strategies of WV.
Proficient use of Microsoft Office computer programs including Word, Excel and PowerPoint
In-depth understandings of WVV’s development approaches, policies, procedures, systems
Demonstrated commitment to World Vision Christian and philosophy, and capacity to engage with the broader community in living these values.
Experience
At least 5 years of experience in strategic formulation and management
Experience in non-profit organization is preferred
Applicant Types Accepted:
Local Applicants Only

title:

- job post
description:
Crystal International is a global leader in apparel manufacturing with rapid growth. We offer outstanding career opportunities and are now seeking energetic talents who are excited to join us on this journey.

Responsibilities
Conduct audit assignments and support related projects at local and oversea sites.
Examine control environment and business processes. Identify irregularities and internal control weaknesses.
Discuss with process owners and consult manager’s opinions to draft practical recommendations for process enhancement.
Assist the supervisor in preparing the draft reports for management discussion.
Perform data analysis / analytical review on different platforms/systems to identify risk areas and unusual or exceptional transactions.
Quantify impact of the identified issues. Estimate/calculate potential benefits or savings after the implementation of remedial actions.
Perform data consolidation for presentation.
Maintain close working relationships with key contacts in various departments and operations.

Requirements
Degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline.
At least 5 years auditing experience, preferably with 1-2 years of experience in manufacturing group.
Member of recognized professional accounting/auditing body.
Resourceful, disciplined, committed.
Strong report writing skills
Good command in both spoken and written Vietnamese and English
Travel to overseas (e.g. Cambodia or Bangladesh) is required
Office location: Hanoi, Vitenam

We look forward to receiving your applications.

All information provided will be treated as strictly confidential and used solely for recruitment purpose.

title:
Junior Human Resources General Specialist (Hanoi Office)
- job post
description:
Job Description
DEK Technologies Vietnam is growing fast, and we are looking for a Junior Human Resources Generalist to join our Human Resources sub-team taking care of Hanoi Office.
You will be responsible for performing assigned human resources related duties by collaborating with Human Resources Team in Ho Chi Minh City to ensure smooth Hanoi Office daily operations. You will gain excellent interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to multitasks and adapt in a fast-paced environment.

Your responsibilities include but not limited to the following:
Recruitment: collaborating with Talent Acquisition Team in Ho Chi Minh City Office to meet recruitment demands for the company by:
Sourcing, filtering, interview arranging and offering for qualified candidates.
Building up and developing pool of resources to meet hiring demands.
Involving in all regular internal & external activities: technical workshops/seminars, Job Fairs, etc.
Maintaining different relationships with business partners (e.g., Universities, communities, etc.) for recruiting purposes.
Administration: collaborating with Administration Team in Ho Chi Minh City Office to provide professional and caring support to Hanoi Office members by:
Taking care of staff’s benefits: healthcare insurance, health check, annual trip, family day, birthday parties, etc.
Preparing, following up employee on-boarding and off-boarding.
Determining administration issues and resolving to make sure smooth operations.
Learning and Development: collaborating with Learning and Development Team in Ho Chi Minh City Office to maintain and develop continuous learning culture for the company by:
Arranging, following up, and reporting learning activities (Technical Skill, Soft Skill, English Program, Employee Well-being program, etc.).
Conducting professional onboarding and orientation process for new hires (Corporate Policy, Code of Conduct, Compensation & Benefits Overview).
Compensation and Benefits: collaborating with Compensation and Benefits Team in Ho Chi Minh City Office to provide professional and fast support to Hanoi Office members by:
Following up timesheets for intime payroll processes.
Preparing contracts for new hires and staff members
Other tasks will be assigned when required.
At DEK Technologies Vietnam, you will live with Agile & Lean principles where employees are empowered at all levels to collaborate cross-functionally, to take pride in collective ownership, to improve yourself by continuously learning, practicing & sharing with others.

Requirements
Bachelor’s Degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related Degree.
At least 1 year of experience in Human Resources General positions.
High Integrity: Open and Honest.
Energetic and Can-do attitude.
Mature, Careful and Attention to Details.
Good at Labour Code, PIT Law, Social Insurance Law, and other related Regulations.
Good at human interaction as well as English communication.
Highly proficient with office software and data management.

Benefits
At DEK Technologies you will find yourself in an exciting career with:

Compensation & benefits:
Attractive compensation and benefits you will love.
Annual health check-up and Extra 24/7 Health and Accident Insurance applied from the 1st day of joining.
Loyalty bonus for long-term employees such as Cash bonus, Gifts, Extra insurance, and Extra leave.
Career advancement
Onsite Program, Exchange Program and Office Transfer Program.
Diverse offline and online technical workshop, soft skills training sessions and health talks.
English courses taught by DEK’s English teacher.
At DEK, there are many different possible career paths. You can also tailor one for yourself.
Work environment
40 flexible working hours per week from Monday to Friday.
Annual Trip, Family Day, Year End party, BBQs party, Team Building, Release Celebration, Mid-Autumn party, Christmas party, Thank You party, etc.
Football Club, Badminton Club, Running Club, Music band, etc.

About Us

DEK Technologies is a professional organization that places high value on people and the individual competence that they contribute. People enjoy working at DEK. They enjoy the team camaraderie, flexibility, opportunities for travel, and feeling part of the company’s success. Come and be a proud, integral part of helping our international customers develop the latest products that are sold globally and used by millions of people around the world. With offices situated in Melbourne Australia, Stockholm Sweden, Rome Italy, and Ho Chi Minh City Vietnam, you too can be a key part of our success.

title:
HCM – Ecommerce Growth Manager
- job post
description:
Full time
HCM
30/11/2023
Job description detail
I. JOB BRIEF:
The Ecommerce Growth Manager will be responsible for developing and executing strategies to drive growth and revenue for our ecommerce business. The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of ecommerce marketing, customer acquisition, retention, and conversion optimization
II. JOB RELATION:
1. Direct superior: Ecommerce Director
2. Direct reports: design & content staff, marketplace staff.
3. Major internal communication: Marketing, IT, Brand management
4. Major external communications: Brand principal, Marketplace Account & Partner.
III. DETAILED JOB DESCRIPTION:
1. Results measurement
Results for this position are measured in
– Revenue in absolute value by channel
– Year on year growth by channel
– Gross profits growth and ability to drive sales with few promotion incentives
– Churn rate
– Site traffic by channel
– New visitor & returning visitor
– Customer acquisition
– Conversion rate on Maison Online
2. Responsibilities
– Develop and execute ecommerce growth strategies across all channels, including email marketing, social media, paid advertising, SEO, affiliate marketing, marketplace
– Monitor and analyze ecommerce metrics to identify areas for improvement and optimize performance
– Identify and execute onsite optimization initiatives together with analyze and optimize the customer journey to improve user experience and drive conversions.
– Develop and implement user management strategies to increase customer retention and loyalty.
– Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Marketing, CRM, Brand, and IT, to execute ecommerce initiatives
– Conduct market research and stay up-to-date on ecommerce industry trends and best practices
– Manage relationships with third-party vendors and service providers to ensure high-quality, cost-effective ecommerce solutions
– Develop and manage budgets for ecommerce initiatives and optimize spending to drive maximum ROI
– Monitor and report on ecommerce KPIs to executive team and provide insights for strategic decision-making
– Training and mentor other team members to improve their skill, optimize daily operation process, coaching leadership mindset.
– Participate in new projects to fuel Ecommerce revenue growth
– Support other team members if needed to ensure achievement of KPIs under Ecommerce department
Required experience/ Skill detail
– 3-5 years of relevant professional experience with proven working experience in similar role
– Experience in Campaign Marketing/ Promotion/ Online Marketing for e-commerce
– Excellent ability to analyze data and propose commercial objectives
– Knowledgeable of analytical tools for funnel and search measurement (Google Analytics, MixPanel, HotJar, ContentSquare, etc.)
– An understanding of e-Commerce UX, content and development projects, and intuitive knowledge of how users interact and shop in a digital environment
– Able to lead a team and drive new processes for efficiency
– Proven (content) team management experience. Able to build a team, help it perform and foster a positive team culture
– Ability to manage multiple projects and changing priorities effectively
– Fluent in Vietnamese, proficient in English
– Flexible & collaborative attitude, excited about a fast-paced start-up environment
– Ability to conceptualize ideas and create processes, tools & templates independently
– Ideally Ecommerce experience or at least strong knowledge & understanding
– Strive for impact and high performance. Hunger for success with a commitment to getting things done.

title:
Commercial Account Manager
- job post
description:
If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us
In a world of cloud complexity, NetApp simplifies. Our customers are looking for a more unified and secure multicloud experience, and we provide the services, infrastructure and expertise they need to achieve it.
If you want to have a real impact, NetApp is the place for you. You’ll make a difference—while still maintaining a healthy work-life balance. Who are we? Forward-thinking technology people with a heart. Join us.
Commercial Account Manager
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
Job category: Sales
Job ID: 124386-en_US
About NetApp
We’re forward-thinking technology people with heart. We make our own rules, drive our own opportunities, and try to approach every challenge with fresh eyes. Of course, we can’t do it alone. We know when to ask for help, collaborate with others, and partner with smart people. We embrace diversity and openness because it’s in our DNA. We push limits and reward great ideas. What is your great idea?
"At NetApp, we fully embrace and advance a diverse, inclusive global workforce with a culture of belonging that leverages the backgrounds and perspectives of all employees, customers, partners, and communities to foster a higher performing organization." -George Kurian, CEO
Job summary
The primary responsibility of the Commercial Account Manager is to achieve the assigned territory revenue goals by developing and managing a pipeline of sales opportunities through the sales process in a specific territory from prospect to close. As a customer facing seller, you will have ownership of all elements of revenue growth within your Named Commercial territory. This includes discovering and developing new opportunities, managing pipeline, executing strategies, and managing customer growth. You should be quota-driven, and will represent NetApp in the top Named Commercial accounts within the territory while working with System Engineers/Specialists, Sales Development, Channel Development and NetApp partners to exceed overall sales objectives.
Job responsibilities
Customer facing, hunter mentality passionate about prospecting, building pipeline and closing net new business to achieving territory specific revenue goals
Develop, manage, and grow a pipeline of sales opportunities in collaboration with key Channel Partners within an assigned territory
Provide Sales leadership within the partner community to improve communication, collaboration, and accountability specific to pipeline generation and closing opportunities within assigned territory
Lead the development of the strategic Go-to-Market plan for assigned territories ensuring that both internal and external resources are actively engaged & contributing
Acts as a liaison between Partner and NetApp customers to maximize NetApp technology adoption and overall customer satisfaction
Co-sell and strategize with partners, distributors, and VARs to enable new customers acquisition & customer growth
Delivers NetApp strategy, vision, and messaging to Customers, Prospects and Partner sales teams
Job requirements
at least 8 Years experience of field technology sales with a focus on new logo acquisition and business development, experienced in South of Vietnam business.
Consistent track record of exceeding quota and driving net new business.
Self starter who is comfortable working independently and in a team environment
Strong understanding of channel sales landscape in a specific territory
Broad exposure to a variety of storage and cloud technologies/concepts
Highly organized and disciplined with the ability to work collaboratively with colleagues within departments across functions
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, presentation skills, customer service and negotiation skills
Located within assigned territory and able to travel regularly to visit local customers and partners
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience
Did you know…
Statistics show women apply to jobs only when they’re 100% qualified. But no one is 100% qualified. We encourage you to shift the trend and apply anyway! We look forward to hearing from you.
Why NetApp?
In a world full of generalists, NetApp is a specialist. No one knows how to elevate the world’s biggest clouds like NetApp. We are data-driven and empowered to innovate. Trust, integrity, and teamwork all combine to make a difference for our customers, partners, and communities.

We expect a healthy work-life balance. Our volunteer time off program is best in class, offering employees 40 hours of paid time off per year to volunteer with their favorite organizations. We provide comprehensive medical, dental, wellness, and vision plans for you and your family. We offer educational assistance, legal services, and access to discounts. We also offer financial savings programs to help you plan for your future.

If you run toward knowledge and problem-solving, join us.

Contexte et environnement
Appuyez sur les touches espace ou entrée pour alterner la visibilité de la section.
Vietnam’s lubricant market in is highly competitive with a participation of both international as well as local players with more than 20 brands.
Lubricants products are mostly managed through designated distribution network.
~100% Route to Market of TEMV is via Distributors before reaching to end Customers. There might be PSD in the layer between distributors and end Customers.
TEMV strategy is SELL-OUT FOCUS, VALUE OVER VOLUME, GROW PREMIUM and DEVELOP NEW BUSINEESS FROM NON-LUBRICANTS PRODUCTS AND SERVICE.
TotalEnergies, a multi-energy company

TotalEnergies is a multi-energy company that produces and markets fuels, natural gas, and electricity. Our 100,000 employees are committed to better energy that is more affordable, more reliable, cleaner, and accessible to as many people as possible. Active in more than 130 countries, our ambition is to become the responsible energy major.

Created in 1924 to enable France to play a key role in the great oil and gas adventure, TotalEnergies has always been driven by an authentic pioneering spirit. It has discovered some of the most productive fields in the world. Its refineries have created increasingly sophisticated products and its extensive distribution network has rolled out an ever-expanding range of services.

Energy is life. We all need it for cooking, traveling, and heating. It is also a source of progress. Today, climate change means a revolution. We need to reinvent energy, its consumption, and the way we use it. To become the responsible energy company means providing better energy that is more affordable, cleaner, more reliable, and accessible to as many people as possible. Our ambition: to be a world-class player in the energy transition.

For more information, visit us at www.totalenergies.com and www.totalenergies.vn.

title:
Digital Planning and Development Manager
- job post
description:
We’re JTI, Japan Tobacco International and we believe in freedom. We think that the possibilities are limitless when you’re free to choose. In fact, we’ve spent the last 20 years innovating, creating new and better products for our consumers to choose from. It’s how we’ve grown to be present in 130 countries.
But our business isn’t just business. Our business is our people. Their talent. Their potential. We believe when they’re free to be themselves, grow, travel and develop, amazing things can happen for our business.
That’s why our employees, from around the world, choose to be a part of JTI. It is why 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI. And why we’ve been awarded Global Top Employer status, nine years running.
So when you’re ready to choose a career you’ll love, in a company you’ll love, feel free to #JoinTheIdea.
Learn more: jti.com

This position will remain open until filled.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

Digital Strategy:
Demonstrate a strategic mindset in aligning the role of the Digital platforms that he/she will manage (which include but are not limited to: web-based, QR code system, mobile apps, data management platforms) to achieve long-term business objectives.
Must be able to make critical decisions and recommendations based on digital experience and expertise as well as an understanding of trade and customer behavior and our brands to ensure a frictionless customer journey combining offline engagement and digital ecosystem. Must display an innovative mindset to keep update of the latest trends and technologies to ensure best-in-class digital executions.

Digital Survey Ecosystem Management:
Help develop JTI Brand's Digital Survey Ecosystem - including but not limit to QR code system (on packaging and in-store POSM), database management & SMS system in coordination with internal IT teams (region and local) as well as external suppliers.
Liaise with brand team to launch and maintain digital survey, and ensuring all systems are integrated - data collection, online engagement, survey communication (SMS, push notifications, etc.).
Must be able to set and enforce crucial milestones and pay attention to detail to ensure quality and timely output.
Ensure maintenance of all platform by continuous optimization for maximum engagement, enhanced user experience, and brand conversion.

Trade Digital Ecosystem Management:
In collaboration with Sales and Field Marketing (as business users) and other supporting functions, lead development and roll out of Trade App (Connexus global platform), Online Ordering System and Digitalized Offtake Program from concept, assessment to development process, testing, problem/bug fixing, training to field team and gathering feedback.
Develop working process for day-to-day system operation and manage all platform as general admin (after deployment): update product & brand content (in collaboration with Brand), set up communication, push notification, data gathering for retargeting, adding other functions as needed (special reward, geo-targeting, etc.) to maximize platform usage as an engagement channel.

Stakeholder & Agency Management:
Experience in sourcing and managing technical vendors or agencies, as well as internal IT teams in ensuring timeliness in meeting milestones and deliverables. Be able to quality check team's output and continuously optimize for end-user experience and performance.

Field visit and Review of Competitor's Digital Initiatives:
Conduct bi-weekly field visits, audit & training sessions, to ensure (1) deep understanding of customer and trade behavior and effectiveness of digital platforms, (2) full implementation and speedy adaptation of digital platforms on-field and (3) competitor's digital initiatives.

Budget management & Ad-hoc projects:
Responsible for budget planning and consolidate spending plan which is given for Digital initiatives and continuously update YTD Actual records versus spending plan to ensure the best possible use of given budget.
Ad hoc projects: research, analysis or training/ workshop

WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?

Minimum Bachelor Degree
4-5 year experience of working in fast moving customer goods within E-Commerce role or Digital function; or in account/project management in digital agency for major FMCG clients
Experience in tobacco industry or dark market is an advantage
Has demonstrated strategic understanding, planning, and decision-making skills to maximize the digital platform to deliver business objectives
Versed in how data and digital platforms drive the customer journey and experience across channels
Have proven ability to manage complex projects and market requirements, meet and enforce deadlines, and pay attention to detail in planning and execution
Proven track record in IT project management with knowledge of data management platforms setup
Performance and analytical mindset (metrics, KPIs and measurement frameworks)
Have proven ability to work within a technical environment (translating and aligning business objectives, to strategic digital marketing plans, and to technical requirements)
Experienced in managing external vendors, local and international cross-functional teams, and own reports to meet business goals
Have excellent communications skills: written and verbal
Ability to communicate in a clear, concise manner that enable effective discussion and decision-making by stakeholders.
High proficiency of Microsoft Office, especially Excel, PowerPoint and Power BI (nice to have).

WHAT ARE THE NEXT STEPS?

Thank you very much for applying! We will make sure every candidate will receive a reply within 2 weeks after the application deadline.

title:
Outperformer - Global Management Development Program - Business Track
- job post
description:
What's the role?
We’re looking for the next generation of high-performing, multi-lingual, post-graduate talent to take our company forward. Hilti Outperformer is a global management development program like no other, with real responsibility from day one.
Who is Hilti?
Hilti is where innovation is improving productivity, safety and sustainability in the global construction industry, and beyond. Where strong customer relationships are creating solutions that build a better future. Where there is pride and a sense of belonging across our 120 locations, carrying right into our lives and homes. Where people are exploring possibilities, leveraging their potential, owning their personal development and growing lasting careers..
What does the role involve?
Hilti Outperformer is a two-year program, where you’ll quickly be involved in a range of international projects, with lots of exposure to senior management. It’s fast paced and challenging, but we’ll closely coach and mentor you. The program is split into four main stages of work:

12 months as an account manager or field engineer in the country where you apply.
3 months on an operational project in national headquarters. It could be logistics, HR, finance, marketing or engineering.
6 months on a strategic project in the regional headquarters (Singapore)
3 months on a strategic project outside the region. If you’ve come from a mature market, you’ll work in an emerging market, and vice versa.
80% of our management positions are filled with internal candidates. It’s testament to how much we value, develop and look after our people.
What do we offer?
Show us what you can do and, in return, we promise you the experience of a lifetime, the opportunity to work internationally, and a fast-track career in global senior management. You’ll also take part in some fascinating courses and events:

Leadership development program – a comprehensive learning journey with IMD business school in Lausanne, Switzerland, with a qualification from IMD.
Business management training – individual training at Hilti. A focus on behavioral profiles, personal strengths, leadership styles and communication skills.
Global summit – 4-5 days at our global headquarters in Liechtenstein. A look at the way global business units function, plus soft skills like situational leadership and international teamwork.
Social project – 7-8 days ‘building a better future’. A hands-on and hugely impactful community project, like our recent house building for displaced refugees in Bosnia.
What you need is:
You’re currently studying a master’s degree or PhD or you've recently graduated. Your Masters degree is likely to be in business management or engineering, but we’ll consider subjects like economics, politics or international studies if you can demonstrate you have a mind for our business.
You’ve spent at least three months, and up to two years, in a professional environment, like an internship, apprenticeship or work experience, or have just started your career and want an opportunity where you can perform well and progress.
You’re multilingual – fluent in English plus another language or two – and you’ve gained international experience during your work or studies.
You’re mature and assertive, curious and committed.
You’re a flexible team player with good communication and social skills.
You’re a global thinker, keen for intercultural experiences and opportunities working abroad.
Vietnamese Citizenship / Permanent Residence
Why should you apply?
We have an excellent mix of people, which we believe makes for a more vibrant, more innovative, more productive team. So, if you’ve never worked in construction, that’s fine with us. Success at Hilti is down to teamwork and ability, no matter what your background.
By submitting your resume, you confirm and agree that Hilti Far East Pte Ltd and its related companies worldwide (collectively, “Hilti Group”) may collect, use and disclose your data for their recruitment purposes. This may include selecting, evaluating and recruiting candidates for roles or positions that differ from the above job description, but for which we believe that you may be interested in or appropriate for.
We look forward to receiving your application and regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified.
