title:
Shopify Plus Technical Lead
- job post
description:
Department
Technology
Role type
Fulltime
Work location
Vietnam
Key responsibilities:
SAI Digital is looking for a Shopify Plus Technical Lead to join our team. The Technical Lead will work with our project and support teams to provide our clients with high quality development services. They will work with the team on new ecommerce projects, from initial business development and discovery phases through implementation and deployment of the projects. In addition, they will maintain and enhance existing Shopify Plus ecommerce websites while adhering to best practices. Preferably an experienced ecommerce professional, the Technical Lead will have a passion for researching and learning the latest digital technologies.
Your Responsibilities:
– Work with the SAI Digital team on new ecommerce projects, from initial business development and discovery phases through implementation and deployment of the completed project
– Maintain and enhance existing Shopify Plus ecommerce websites while adhering to best practices.
– Play a significant role in the requirements gathering and provide technical suggestions.
– Partake in Scrum and Sprint planning calls and provide technical input (approach, estimate)
– Create high level technical design documentation
– Perform code review before deployment and provide technical review/ feedback to engineers
– Have a detailed technical understanding on work happening in assigned projects
– Have technical ownership of groups of projects
Job requirements:
– 5 years of ecommerce web development experience.
– 3 or more Shopify Plus project implementation
– Experience/Knowledge of steps involved in migration of an existing commerce site running on a different platform to Shopify Platform (eg: Magento to Shopify)
– Expert in Shopify Liquid template language.
– Expert in Shopify APIs and its usage.
– REST API working knowledge.
– GraphQL expertise/Shopify GraphQL API.
– Working knowledge in Custom Shopify APP development/Checkout Extensibility.
– Experience in Shopify Theme development
– Proven knowledge with Admin API and Storefront API
– Background in Product modeling and configuration via Shopify Admin
– Good command of English communications skills (speaking, reading and writing)
– Understanding of Product, Discount, Inventory, Fulfillment, Order APIs and customizations using the APIs
– Awareness of the Marketing Events, Discounts, Gift Cards and their configurations in Shopify
– Experience with Shopify instance management and configuration
– Knowledge in data migration and synchronization between Shopify instances
– Experience with code version/ branching tools like Git/SVN
– Experience with Shopify theme source code management/deployment through GitHub.
– Good knowledge in Javascript/ JQuery/Typescript/React
– Prior experience with product/Customer/Order import Export management
– Experience integrating with backend systems such as ERPs, WMS, OMS, etc.
– Solid knowledge of performance Improvement best practices.
Love Working With Us?

title:
Strategic Partnerships Manager
- job post
description:
Description
About the job
Cosmose is a fast-growing software company on a path to revolutionise the $23 Trillion retail industry. Cosmose AI understands, predicts and influences how billions of people shop offline by seamlessly adding data-driven actionable insights back to their online and digital assets. Cosmose delivers results for the world’s biggest brands, including L'Oreal, Estee Lauder, LVMH, Cartier and Walmart. Cosmose is seamless (no hardware), accurate (1.6 meters positioning accuracy) and everywhere (+1 billion smartphones and +500,000 offline stores).

Cosmose is now valued at over $500 million and raised the latest round of funding in April 2023. We are backed by the most efficient blockchain network, NEAR Protocol, following a Series A investment from Tiga Investments, OTB Ventures and TDJ Pitango. With numerous successful business projects and collaborations in China, Hong Kong and Japan in the last 3 years, we are now embarking on an exciting and ambitious market expansion plan across APAC. Through these expansion strategies, Cosmose will not only expand our footprint to new destinations, but our technology and expertise will aid retailers to recover from the pandemic and transition their businesses into the post-pandemic world via a data-driven approach.
Cosmose AI was recently awarded “Most Innovative Use of Mobile Technology,” by Mob-Ex Awards 2021, Asia’s biggest mobile marketing awards. It also was recognized for Best Use of Digital Solution, the Best Use of O2O Strategy & the Best Use of Technology category.
We are looking for an enthusiastic Strategic Partnerships Manager to join our team and help us maintain and expand our impressive growth rate with our new lock-screen solution product, KaikaiNow. KaikaiNow is designed to make Android phone screens more enjoyable by featuring reliable and trustworthy media content from around the world. Reporting to the Partnerships Director, you will be responsible for building and strengthening our partnership base in emerging markets. This is an exciting opportunity to make an impact and help us continue to achieve success.
We’re looking for someone who:
Dreams Big: ambitious, passionate and out to achieve massive goals
Customer-centric: We care about our customers and strive to provide them with the best solutions
Celebrates both Success & Failure: Rejoicing the wins but also reflecting, learning & improving proactively when there are defeats
Honesty and Integrity: We appreciate respectful feedback
Problem Solver: You’re a fixer and not a complainer
Actionable: Work fast, make smart decisions fast, move fast with conviction
What you’ll do:
Expand partnerships with publications in emerging markets, such as Southeast Asia, South Asia, and Africa
Research markets, identify potential partners, and establish mutually beneficial partnerships to extend their reach
Follow an outreach strategy, prospecting process, and tracking system to monitor and track leads
Deliver sales pitches to local stakeholders to cultivate relationships and promote the content syndication program
Collaborate with internal teams, such as content and product managers, to ensure a seamless onboarding process
Monitor content usage to ensure that it is properly tracked and follows syndication standards
Prepare sales pitch materials, website and blog content to raise awareness about the lockscreen solution
What you’ll need:
Minimum 3 years of experience in business development, partnerships or a related field, preferably in the advertising and marketing industry
Strong communication and presentation skills, both oral and written, in Vietnamese and English
Thorough understanding of the digital media landscape in the APAC region, with knowledge of the Vietnamese market being an advantage
Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with partners and internal stakeholders
Familiarity with content distribution and syndication, as well as media industry trends and best practices
What you’ll enjoy:
Cosmose provide employees with a great platform where one could immerse and learn about the most exciting, innovative and disrupting technologies on offline behaviour solutions; unveiling untapped opportunities and profits in the industry. The company constantly innovates to invent and apply world-class technologies with a rockstar engineering team including four world championship programming medalists. You’ll be working with a strong leadership team backed by experience from various key strategic areas and many other driven & intelligent people across the company. Cosmose is a place where great culture and goals unite departments and individuals to achieve big milestones together.
Are you ready for new exciting challenges and put your name on the history books? Apply now and join a revolutionary company.

Read more on:
TechCrunch, Business Insider, Forbes and CNBC.

title:
Senior Compliance Associate - Sanctions (Vietnam)
- job post
description:
Location
Vietnam - Remote
Type
Full time
Department
Compliance
Compliance

Building the Future of Crypto
Our Krakenites are a world-class team with crypto conviction, united by our desire to discover and unlock the potential of crypto and blockchain technology.
What makes us different?
Kraken is a mission-focused company rooted in crypto values. As a Krakenite, you’ll join us on our mission to accelerate the global adoption of crypto, so that everyone can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. For over a decade, Kraken’s focus on our mission and crypto ethos has attracted many of the most talented crypto experts in the world.
Before you apply, please read the Kraken Culture page to learn more about our internal culture, values, and mission.
As a fully remote company, we have Krakenites in 60+ countries who speak over 50 languages. Krakenites are industry pioneers who develop premium crypto products for experienced traders, institutions, and newcomers to the space. Kraken is committed to industry-leading security, crypto education, and world-class client support through our products like Kraken Pro, Kraken NFT, and Kraken Futures.
Become a Krakenite and build the future of crypto!
Proof of Work
The Team
Kraken Global Sanctions Compliance team supports the Sanctions needs of Kraken and its global subsidiaries. The team is responsible for all things sanctions related, such as investigations, escalations, regulatory reporting, internal controls testing, issue management and resolution, remediations, program enhancements, audit deliverables, governance, presentations and responses to banking partners, responding to questionnaires, regulatory responses, new product reviews, risk analysis, review and maintenance of policies and procedures, as well as providing sanctions advisory and guidance to Kraken’s leadership and regional compliance officers. This role is focused on gathering and analyzing large data sets, data validation of sanctions records, reporting, dashboard creation / management, and all things that require technical competence. This role was created to allow investigators and managers to spend more time on their reviews and less time working to gather, prepare, analyze, and validate metrics or perform tasks requiring technical competence. The person selected for this role will need to have the ability to learn things quickly and find short-term solutions and propose long-term recommendations.

Successful candidates in this team will receive cross-functional exposure as well as exposure to highly respected and globally recognised sanctions professionals and emerge as well-rounded compliance professionals, adept at tackling new remediations as necessary.

The Opportunity
Support sanctions strategy for addressing program enhancements, regulatory remediation, and/or issue management.
Support sanctions optimizations efforts where applicable, increasing effectiveness and efficiency while meeting global regulatory rigor.
Support efforts to generate competitive advantages by optimizing screening processes and/or protocols.
Support sanctions management in performing deep rooted sanctions research in preparation for licensing applications, new products, regulatory updates, regulatory inquiry responses, launch readiness, and consultation opportunities.
Support sanctions management in creation and validation of deliverables as needed for audit, exams, and testing. Support, carry out, and coordinate internal sanctions testing of products, services, and protocols to identify and execute program enhancements. Participate in creating polished deliverables for external regulatory audiences.
Support key sanctions projects from beginning to end.
Coordinate and support the creation of business requirements documentation to support Sanctions program enhancement roadmap and/or issue management resolution
Skills you should HODL
Minimum bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
Compliance experience, with technical competence, detail oriented, curious, and keen to validate. Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in finance, statistics, data sciences or similar field preferred.
Exposure to sanctions compliance.
Prior sanctions compliance experience in: TradFi or Crypto financial industry, FinTech, or RegTech; experience preparing regulatory materials is a plus. EU Regulatory experience preferred.
Resourceful and inquisitive mindset with an ability to analyze structured and unstructured data from disparate sources to develop conclusions.
Trustworthiness and ability to maintain confidential information.
Ability to take ownership of your work product and consistently deliver results in a face-paced work environment.
Strong organizational proficiency; ability to communicate horizontally and vertically.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Eye for presentation design and attention to detail. Comfort with a high level of context switching.
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (Google Sheets) and PowerPoint (Google Slides).
Proficiency in data analysis and SQL querying skills required.
Ability to work in a rapidly changing regulatory environment; fast paced; multi tasking.
Team Player who appreciates feedback, solving problems, finding solutions, and learning.
This is a fully remote role requiring English fluency, based in Vietnam. You must be willing to work evenings or early mornings.
Kraken is powered by people from around the world and we celebrate all Krakenites for their diverse talents, backgrounds, contributions and unique perspectives. We hire strictly based on merit, meaning we seek out the candidates with the right abilities, knowledge, and skills considered the most suitable for the job. We encourage you to apply for roles where you don't fully meet the listed requirements, especially if you're passionate or knowledgable about crypto!
As an equal opportunity employer, we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

title:
Sr. Factory Material Quality Manager, Global Operations & Manufacturing
- job post
company: Amazon Corporate Services Vietnam Company Limited
description:
Bachelor’s Degree or above in electrical engineering, material engineering, mechanical engineering or related fields.
8 year’s minimum experience in material quality management, reliability or hardware test for electronic products.
Experience on ISO9000/MSA, MIL1916/105E, ANSI, etc sampling plan and AQL implementation.
Able to use Minitab or any SPC tools to perform data analysis and interpret the result.
Hands on Experience of using quality and statistical tools: NUDD, Failure Mode & Effects Analysis (FMEA), Design of Experiment (DOE), Gage Repeatability & Reproducibility (GRR), Process Capability Index (CPK), Correlation, Analysis of Variance, Hypothesis Testing etc.
Good understanding of the principles and basic structures of measuring instruments such as HALT, chambers, oscilloscopes, and multi-meters etc and experience with failure analysis techniques.
Demonstrated ability to work directly with suppliers to solve product problems.
Good communication skills in English and Vietnamese, Mandarin is a plus.
50% travel is required.
This position covers both material quality and ongoing reliability test. As a Senior Factory Materials Quality Manager, you will be responsible for working with our CM(Contract Manufacturer) to install incoming material inspection mechanism and monitor the incoming material quality, driving the material quality issues. Also, you will be also act as on-going reliability test role to define the on-going reliability test plan for final finished products, monitor the on-going reliability test activities and fix the issue discovered by the on-going reliability test.

1. Management of our factory managed part supplier quality:
o Provide coaching and training to facilitate CM, developing quality programs to ensure highest level of quality and reliability is consistently delivered on time at the optimum cost.
o Interface with CM in resolving complex manufacturing process, quality and reliability issues, utilizing DOE and statistical approach. Provide technical and systems support related to both quality systems and technical product related issues.
o Conduct potential supplier qualification audits with CM in both system and process levels.

2. Management of Materials In Line DPPM performance (LVRR):
o Close monitor In Line DPPM performance of all of our key material parts.
o Trigger quality alerts to SQMs/CM when any key parts fall out rate exceed target. Work with the SQM/CM to drive improvement in these material parts.
o Manage CM IQC readiness to fit with program schedule. Analyze the IQC data to provide the program update to the team timely and precisely.
o Follow up the SCAR/8D procedure with SQM/CM and drive for material quality issue closure.

3. Develop and deploy relevant material quality management tools and activities across the organization as needed:
o Initiate regular assessments and reviews of our IQC inspection specifications taking into account recent performance of the material part.
o Key decision maker on disposition of incoming materials that do not meet our incoming criteria. Work with the appropriate Supplier Quality Manager (SQM)/CM to drive improvement of incoming material quality.
o Champion regular improvement activities surrounding material quality related where necessary.

4. Manage the on-going reliability testing of our final finished products,
o Create on-going reliability test plans including resource allocations, validation schedule assumptions, and validation items scope.
o Implement specific validation items in on-going reliability test plans with schedule. Flexible adjustment should be made based on issue occurring and debugging.
o Create reliability test plan to qualify factory process change, line move, line resume and copy lines.
o Report on-going reliability execution progress, and drive for issues closure.
o Evaluate and develop reliability test methodologies/plan to reduce the cost (test time, sample size etc) and increase the coverage.
o Evaluate on-going reliability risks and do escalations to relative teams.
o Managing CM (contract manufacturer) ORT resources.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Hanoi, HN, VNM

Direct working experience in inspection, assembly, testing development and validation.
Experience in Design For Manufacturability (DFM) and engineering development for products.
Have reliability knowledge, statistical knowledge and be able to use reliability and statistical method to do data analysis/modeling/simulation, provide product risk assessment and life forecast.

Technical Solutions Analyst - Fraud, Shopee
- job post
description:
Apply Now

Excellent attention to details
Good written and verbal communication skills in English
Ability to learn quickly with can do attitude
Experience in MySQL and programming experience preferred

title:
Learning and Teaching Support Officer (7 months & contracted by 3rd party)
- job post
description:
Overview:
About RMIT VIETNAM
RMIT Vietnam
, an entity of RMIT University, has campuses in Ho Chi Minh City and Hanoi since 2001. We provide internationally recognised, high-quality, education and professional training for students, clients and the community, and assist in the development of human resources capability in Vietnam and the region by hosting students from Australia and many other countries.
YOUR ROLE
The Learning and Teaching (L&T) Support Officer provides administrative support to the Head of Department, Program Managers, Course Coordinators and academic staff within the School.
The responsibilities for this role include, but are not limited to: provide professional learning and teaching services support for the undergraduate and post graduate programs within the School; administrative and secretarial support for meetings, (including meeting scheduling, taking minutes and circulation of meeting documents); Head of Department calendar management; student engagement activities and departmental events; staff travel support; recruitment; and staff induction. The position provides report data and other reports as required by senior management staff member.
KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES
Provide high quality learning and teaching professional support services to staff and students of the relevant department and program including, but not limited to: process applications and forms, management of file systems, student advisement, management of administrative resources and teaching materials, meetings arrangement and minute taking, translation services, research support, leave calendar and travel arrangements.
Contribute to the development and management of school committees through attending meetings, preparing agendas and minutes, providing advice and recommendations related to administrative processes and procedures and support committee recruitment processes.
Provide support and guidance to relevant stakeholders on the management of program assessment board and at-risk students, organising and supporting the Student-Staff Consultative Committee, teaching and timetabling allocations, textbook inventories, course assessment processes, marks amendments processes, student feedback and complaints.
Provide in depth and detailed advice to students on program plans, program completion, course selections, career pathways and other development related issues.
Assist in coordinating, organising and running internal and external events through arrangement of logistics, catering, marketing and invitations for department and centre wide events including, but not limited to: guest lectures, intensive study courses, student company visits, corporate trainings, international visitors, academic staff visits to schools, and industry engagement events.
Regularly manage departmental projects including coordinating and planning a project, recruiting staff and student volunteers, managing budgetary related requirements, reporting the project status to management and documenting project activities.
Monitor School’s Key Performance Indicators Dashboard to evaluate and provide a "snapshot" of academic staff performance within the School via generating report of key performance indicators for School personnel and programs, collecting and inputting specific data points for each assessment criteria and continually maintaining and improving the dashboards.
Participate in school-wide marketing related activities support including: monitoring and updating intranet (and other marketing and social media channels) content related to courses, programs, department information and providing bilingual coordination with Communications and Marketing Department to deliver program information on RMIT website.
Prepare necessary documents for staff recruitment including, but not limited to: job description, CVs for Heads of Department to review and interview. Prepare and process HR related documents for hiring new staff, reappointment, reclassification, workload variation, etc.
Assist staff in Hanoi Campus regarding documentation approval from Heads of Department to ensure a smooth operation between RMIT Hanoi and Saigon South campuses.
Carry out or support other duties as directed by the Learning & Teaching Support Senior Officer and Learning & Teaching Support Manager.
KEY SELECTION CRITERIA
A relevant Bachelor’s degree.
Demonstrated at least 1-year experience in administration role. Experience in the higher education sector is preferable.
Experience in using a range of Microsoft Office Suite programs and multimedia applications is preferred.
Strong customer service approach with ability to work effectively with a range of stakeholders across different locations.
Demonstrated ability to analyse, interpret and evaluate and present information to a wide range of audiences.
Ability to produce and present data via reports.
Team player with the ability to work independently as and when required.
Demonstrated organisational and time management skills with the ability to prioritise effectively and co-manage a wide range of tasks in a proactive manner.
Demonstrated skills in database management and record keeping.
BENEFITS
Highly competitive gross salary depending on proven track record in meeting all the key selection criteria.
Annual leave 01 day per month
Accident Insurance 24/7
Free use of onsite gym
Library on campus and online - access to RMIT Australia online library
ENGLISH PROFICIENCY
English is the language of teaching and communication at RMIT Vietnam. For this role, the minimum requirement is IELTS General 5.5 (or equivalent Linguaskill 150).
To be eligible for this position you must be a Vietnamese citizen . Applications received from non-Vietnamese candidates will not be considered.
TO APPLY
Please submit your CV and cover letter addressing your suitability for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply’ link below
Applications Close:
26 thg 11 2023 11.59 pm
RMIT University Vietnam (RMIT Vietnam) is a campus of RMIT University. RMIT Vietnam is creating an innovative research, teaching and learning culture. We are committed to providing internationally recognised high-quality education and professional training for our students, clients and members of the community. As an internationally recognised Australian university based in Asia, RMIT Vietnam is assisting in the development of human resources capability in Vietnam and the region.
https://www.rmit.edu.vn/about-us

Shopify Plus Technical Lead

Key responsibilities:
SAI Digital is looking for a Shopify Plus Technical Lead to join our team. The Technical Lead will work with our project and support teams to provide our clients with high quality development services. They will work with the team on new ecommerce projects, from initial business development and discovery phases through implementation and deployment of the projects. In addition, they will maintain and enhance existing Shopify Plus ecommerce websites while adhering to best practices. Preferably an experienced ecommerce professional, the Technical Lead will have a passion for researching and learning the latest digital technologies.
Your Responsibilities:
– Work with the SAI Digital team on new ecommerce projects, from initial business development and discovery phases through implementation and deployment of the completed project
– Maintain and enhance existing Shopify Plus ecommerce websites while adhering to best practices.
– Play a significant role in the requirements gathering and provide technical suggestions.
– Partake in Scrum and Sprint planning calls and provide technical input (approach, estimate)
– Create high level technical design documentation
– Perform code review before deployment and provide technical review/ feedback to engineers
– Have a detailed technical understanding on work happening in assigned projects
– Have technical ownership of groups of projects
Job requirements:
– 5 years of ecommerce web development experience.
– 3 or more Shopify Plus project implementation
– Experience/Knowledge of steps involved in migration of an existing commerce site running on a different platform to Shopify Platform (eg: Magento to Shopify)
– Expert in Shopify Liquid template language.
– Expert in Shopify APIs and its usage.

title:
Senior Compliance Associate - Sanctions (Vietnam)
- job post
description:
Location
Vietnam - Remote
Type
Full time
Department
Compliance
Compliance

Building the Future of Crypto
Our Krakenites are a world-class team with crypto conviction, united by our desire to discover and unlock the potential of crypto and blockchain technology.
What makes us different?
Kraken is a mission-focused company rooted in crypto values. As a Krakenite, you’ll join us on our mission to accelerate the global adoption of crypto, so that everyone can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. For over a decade, Kraken’s focus on our mission and crypto ethos has attracted many of the most talented crypto experts in the world.
Before you apply, please read the Kraken Culture page to learn more about our internal culture, values, and mission.
As a fully remote company, we have Krakenites in 60+ countries who speak over 50 languages. Krakenites are industry pioneers who develop premium crypto products for experienced traders, institutions, and newcomers to the space. Kraken is committed to industry-leading security, crypto education, and world-class client support through our products like Kraken Pro, Kraken NFT, and Kraken Futures.
Become a Krakenite and build the future of crypto!
Proof of Work
The Team
Kraken Global Sanctions Compliance team supports the Sanctions needs of Kraken and its global subsidiaries. The team is responsible for all things sanctions related, such as investigations, escalations, regulatory reporting, internal controls testing, issue management and resolution, remediations, program enhancements, audit deliverables, governance, presentations and responses to banking partners, responding to questionnaires, regulatory responses, new product reviews, risk analysis, review and maintenance of policies and procedures, as well as providing sanctions advisory and guidance to Kraken’s leadership and regional compliance officers. This role is focused on gathering and analyzing large data sets, data validation of sanctions records, reporting, dashboard creation / management, and all things that require technical competence. This role was created to allow investigators and managers to spend more time on their reviews and less time working to gather, prepare, analyze, and validate metrics or perform tasks requiring technical competence. The person selected for this role will need to have the ability to learn things quickly and find short-term solutions and propose long-term recommendations.

Successful candidates in this team will receive cross-functional exposure as well as exposure to highly respected and globally recognised sanctions professionals and emerge as well-rounded compliance professionals, adept at tackling new remediations as necessary.

The Opportunity
Support sanctions strategy for addressing program enhancements, regulatory remediation, and/or issue management.
Support sanctions optimizations efforts where applicable, increasing effectiveness and efficiency while meeting global regulatory rigor.
Support efforts to generate competitive advantages by optimizing screening processes and/or protocols.
Support sanctions management in performing deep rooted sanctions research in preparation for licensing applications, new products, regulatory updates, regulatory inquiry responses, launch readiness, and consultation opportunities.
Support sanctions management in creation and validation of deliverables as needed for audit, exams, and testing. Support, carry out, and coordinate internal sanctions testing of products, services, and protocols to identify and execute program enhancements. Participate in creating polished deliverables for external regulatory audiences.
Support key sanctions projects from beginning to end.
Coordinate and support the creation of business requirements documentation to support Sanctions program enhancement roadmap and/or issue management resolution
Skills you should HODL
Minimum bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
Compliance experience, with technical competence, detail oriented, curious, and keen to validate. Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent experience) in finance, statistics, data sciences or similar field preferred.
Exposure to sanctions compliance.
Prior sanctions compliance experience in: TradFi or Crypto financial industry, FinTech, or RegTech; experience preparing regulatory materials is a plus. EU Regulatory experience preferred.
Resourceful and inquisitive mindset with an ability to analyze structured and unstructured data from disparate sources to develop conclusions.
Trustworthiness and ability to maintain confidential information.
Ability to take ownership of your work product and consistently deliver results in a face-paced work environment.
Strong organizational proficiency; ability to communicate horizontally and vertically.
Strong communication skills, both verbal and written.
Eye for presentation design and attention to detail. Comfort with a high level of context switching.
Advanced proficiency with Microsoft Excel (Google Sheets) and PowerPoint (Google Slides).
Proficiency in data analysis and SQL querying skills required.
Ability to work in a rapidly changing regulatory environment; fast paced; multi tasking.
Team Player who appreciates feedback, solving problems, finding solutions, and learning.
This is a fully remote role requiring English fluency, based in Vietnam. You must be willing to work evenings or early mornings.
Kraken is powered by people from around the world and we celebrate all Krakenites for their diverse talents, backgrounds, contributions and unique perspectives. We hire strictly based on merit, meaning we seek out the candidates with the right abilities, knowledge, and skills considered the most suitable for the job. We encourage you to apply for roles where you don't fully meet the listed requirements, especially if you're passionate or knowledgable about crypto!
As an equal opportunity employer, we don’t tolerate discrimination or harassment of any kind. Whether that’s based on race, ethnicity, age, gender identity, citizenship, religion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, veteran status or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state or local laws.

title:
Specialist, IMS Growth
- job post
description:
Job Description:
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.
Get to Know the Team
VN Insights & Marketplace Strategy team is a think tank of Grab that functions on both Strategy and Operations to deliver Marketplace’s growth and optimize Marketplace’s economics. We focus on delivering affordable and timely services for our passengers or eaters, enhancing income for our Drivers and Merchants Partners, and at the same time stimulating demand to drive marketplace growth sustainably.

Our team consists of young but experienced individuals who are tenacious and energized with intellectual challenges. We demonstrate a combination of analytical and strategic thinking, that delivers comprehensive outputs of data analysis, business insight, and financial planning.
Get to Know the Role
We are looking for an IMS Growth Specialist to take charge of demand planning, as well as monitor and enhance campaign performance and growth metrics for GrabMart & GrabFood. We believe a successful candidate possesses strong data analysis and problem-solving skills, and has familiarity with economics. However, if you believe you have what it takes then we’d love to hear from you either way.
This role is required because of our continuous efforts to optimize the growth and efficiency of our GrabMart & GrabFood, with the ultimate goal of leading the whole food mart delivery market in Vietnam forwards. In return, you will get an opportunity to work in a dynamic environment, contribute to a thriving business, and further cultivate your professional skills.
The Day-to-Day Activities:
Set up campaigns on the system. Monitor and adjust campaign performance daily.
Monitor & manage day-to-day marketplace growth metrics, investigate short-term anomalies, and troubleshoot with the relevant team as needed.
Developing day-to-day tactical initiatives to improve marketplace dynamics, using marketplace tools efficiently
Perform demand planning, such as forecasting demand and coming up with growth initiatives for weekly and monthly cycles.
Coordinate cross-teams to execute campaigns from end-to-end to update system knowledge and troubleshoot system issues.
Conduct preliminary analysis to gain insight on the effectiveness and impact of the campaign on revenue and demand growth
Proposing new experiments and owning the end-to-end experimentation process, including experiment design, rollout, and analysis of results.
Build presentations to influence senior stakeholders and enable data-driven decision-making.
The Must-Haves:
A minimum 2-3 years of relevant work experience in Management Consulting, Business Intelligence, Market Research, Investment Banking, E-commerce, Technology firms.
Familiarity with economics - fundamentally, this role is about matching supply and demand efficiently.
Familiar with large datasets and a knack for piecing together data to form insights.
Strong attention to detail and meticulousness.
Ability to balance detail with quick execution
Good logical and analytical thinking.
Demonstrated ability to work under tight deadlines, and in a fast-paced environment.
Strong communication skills and an excellent team player with strong work ethics.
Strong sense of curiosity in seeking impactful opportunities and learning about our economics.
Fluent in English and Vietnamese
The Nice-to-Haves:
Working understanding of SQL and experience with a mobile CLM platform
Confident in processing and analyzing complex data sets using SQL, PowerBI, Advanced Excel.
Our Commitment
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

title:
Strategic Partnerships Manager
- job post
description:
Description
About the job
Cosmose is a fast-growing software company on a path to revolutionise the $23 Trillion retail industry. Cosmose AI understands, predicts and influences how billions of people shop offline by seamlessly adding data-driven actionable insights back to their online and digital assets. Cosmose delivers results for the world’s biggest brands, including L'Oreal, Estee Lauder, LVMH, Cartier and Walmart. Cosmose is seamless (no hardware), accurate (1.6 meters positioning accuracy) and everywhere (+1 billion smartphones and +500,000 offline stores).

Cosmose is now valued at over $500 million and raised the latest round of funding in April 2023. We are backed by the most efficient blockchain network, NEAR Protocol, following a Series A investment from Tiga Investments, OTB Ventures and TDJ Pitango. With numerous successful business projects and collaborations in China, Hong Kong and Japan in the last 3 years, we are now embarking on an exciting and ambitious market expansion plan across APAC. Through these expansion strategies, Cosmose will not only expand our footprint to new destinations, but our technology and expertise will aid retailers to recover from the pandemic and transition their businesses into the post-pandemic world via a data-driven approach.
Cosmose AI was recently awarded “Most Innovative Use of Mobile Technology,” by Mob-Ex Awards 2021, Asia’s biggest mobile marketing awards. It also was recognized for Best Use of Digital Solution, the Best Use of O2O Strategy & the Best Use of Technology category.
We are looking for an enthusiastic Strategic Partnerships Manager to join our team and help us maintain and expand our impressive growth rate with our new lock-screen solution product, KaikaiNow. KaikaiNow is designed to make Android phone screens more enjoyable by featuring reliable and trustworthy media content from around the world. Reporting to the Partnerships Director, you will be responsible for building and strengthening our partnership base in emerging markets. This is an exciting opportunity to make an impact and help us continue to achieve success.
We’re looking for someone who:
Dreams Big: ambitious, passionate and out to achieve massive goals
Customer-centric: We care about our customers and strive to provide them with the best solutions
Celebrates both Success & Failure: Rejoicing the wins but also reflecting, learning & improving proactively when there are defeats
Honesty and Integrity: We appreciate respectful feedback
Problem Solver: You’re a fixer and not a complainer
Actionable: Work fast, make smart decisions fast, move fast with conviction
What you’ll do:
Expand partnerships with publications in emerging markets, such as Southeast Asia, South Asia, and Africa
Research markets, identify potential partners, and establish mutually beneficial partnerships to extend their reach
Follow an outreach strategy, prospecting process, and tracking system to monitor and track leads
Deliver sales pitches to local stakeholders to cultivate relationships and promote the content syndication program
Collaborate with internal teams, such as content and product managers, to ensure a seamless onboarding process
Monitor content usage to ensure that it is properly tracked and follows syndication standards
Prepare sales pitch materials, website and blog content to raise awareness about the lockscreen solution
What you’ll need:
Minimum 3 years of experience in business development, partnerships or a related field, preferably in the advertising and marketing industry
Strong communication and presentation skills, both oral and written, in Vietnamese and English
Thorough understanding of the digital media landscape in the APAC region, with knowledge of the Vietnamese market being an advantage
Strong communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with partners and internal stakeholders
Familiarity with content distribution and syndication, as well as media industry trends and best practices
What you’ll enjoy:
Cosmose provide employees with a great platform where one could immerse and learn about the most exciting, innovative and disrupting technologies on offline behaviour solutions; unveiling untapped opportunities and profits in the industry. The company constantly innovates to invent and apply world-class technologies with a rockstar engineering team including four world championship programming medalists. You’ll be working with a strong leadership team backed by experience from various key strategic areas and many other driven & intelligent people across the company. Cosmose is a place where great culture and goals unite departments and individuals to achieve big milestones together.
Are you ready for new exciting challenges and put your name on the history books? Apply now and join a revolutionary company.

Read more on:
TechCrunch, Business Insider, Forbes and CNBC.

title:
Finance and Operations Director, USAID/Vietnam Innovative Workforce Activity
- job post
description:
Description
About IREX:
IREX is an independent nonprofit organization dedicated to building a more just, prosperous, and inclusive world by empowering youth, cultivating leaders, strengthening institutions, and extending access to quality education and information. Founded in 1968, IREX has an annual portfolio of over $100 million, work in more than 100 countries worldwide with offices in 20 countries, and a global staff of 600.

Position Summary:
IREX seeks qualified Finance and Operations Director candidates to lead the operational and financial aspects of an anticipated five-year USAID-funded Innovative Workforce Activity in Vietnam. This Activity will aim to enhance the capacity of Vietnam’s digital workforce and local innovation to meet the demands of a growing digital economy. Based in Hanoi, the Finance and Operations Director will ensure efficient and effective program operations and compliant financial protocols to ensure deliverables are met on time and on budget.

Summary of Responsibilities:
Support the COP in day-to-day program management and ensure that the program meets all IREX, USAID and host country regulations and requirements related to USAID funds usage, accountability, and operations within the country.
Track and analyze all costs incurred under the award; oversee all payments.
Monitor program budget and advise senior management on burn rates and other programmatic considerations; provide complete and compliant required reporting; and maintain financial records for all program activities;
Overseeing subgrantee budgets and expenditures; provide relevant capacity building on financial and operational requirements for local partners as needed.
Supervise Finance and Operations team.
Ensure that appropriate financial record-keeping policies and practices are established and maintained throughout the life of the program;
Oversee all office expenditures and staff transportation/vehicles; lead human resource management;
Establish financial and operational systems during start-up.
Liaise with IREX home office financial, compliance and field operations teams; and
Other duties, as assigned.

Required Skills and Qualifications:
A graduate degree in accounting or a relevant social or administrative science, with at least eight (8) years of experience in Vietnam in the administration of international donor-funded programs; or an undergraduate degree in a relevant social or administrative science with at least 10 years of experience in the administration of donor-funded programs.
Demonstrated knowledge of management processes and systems from start-up to close out, such as human resources management and development (including performance evaluation), financial management, fraud prevention measures, and management of employee compensation systems.
Ability to compile and prepare financial and budget data in-line with USG rules and regulations.
Experience analyzing budget trends and monitoring funding levels.
Expertise with procedures required for adequate planning, monitoring, and realigning of complex budgets.
Demonstrated ability to work with host government and cooperating partners in implementing a complex program in the field under challenging circumstances.
Skilled in managing and compiling financial data for reporting and ensuring compliance with all donor requirements.
Ability to successfully manage and develop staff in a multi-cultural setting as demonstrated by past experience.
Excellent computer skills as they relate to financial management.
Excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills.
Fluency in written and spoken English and Vietnamese.
To Apply
Click on https://irex.applytojob.com/apply/g61sraiy6F/Finance-And-Operations-Director-USAIDVietnam-Innovative-Workforce-Activity to submit your CV in English along with a cover letter summarizing your qualifications and stating your salary expectations for consideration.

Amazon is looking for a talented team leader for the Amazon Global Selling business in Vietnam capable of ramping up and leading a team focused on Seller education and general account management related to selling on Amazon global marketplaces.

The team leader will, in a partnership with program/product teams, design effective approaches to support Vietnamese sellers' business growth on Amazon worldwide including identifying opportunities to maximize selection, driving feature adoption, monitoring account health, performance, product quality, as well as working with sellers to achieve our standard and deliver the best e-commerce experience for customer on Amazon.
The team leader will also assist in developing onboarding training content, developing scalable mechanism to support Vietnamese sellers with understanding their onboarding process, generate regular data/report criteria to review and improve the quality of support provided to Vietnamese sellers and assist with initiatives/projects which provide support to Amazon Global Selling activities.

The successful candidate will be self-directed, have a strong people leadership and a relentless focus on the customer, and a big vision. A strong interpersonal skills, time management, and deliver projects under tight timeline with high accuracy are also required.

About Amazon Global Selling: Amazon’s mission is to be Earth’s most customer-centric company. Among the customers we’re focused on are small businesses and entrepreneurs. With Amazon Global Selling, Amazon helps businesses and entrepreneurs reach hundreds of millions of customers around the world, giving the smallest of businesses the opportunity to compete next to the biggest household brands in our store. Amazon has websites in 22 countries and supports 27 languages. More than half of all items sold on Amazon come from the millions of small and medium-sized businesses that have chosen to grow their business on Amazon.

Partner with Product, Legal, Tax, Seller Performance, and Seller Support on gating, product quality, reporting, and compliance
Build a strong team by hiring, developing, and retaining top talent
Participate in business reviews with Amazon Executive Leadership and make recommendations to assist in developing the business’s mid/long term plans for Vietnam

Ho Chi Minh City, VNM

title:

- job post
description:
Job Advert Details
Some careers grow faster than others.

If you’re looking for a career that will give you plenty of opportunities to develop, join HSBC and your future will be rich with potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

COMPLIANCE

The Compliance function is a Second line of defence (LOD) function, responsible for reviewing and challenging the activities of the Group’s businesses (also referred to as “the First LOD”) to ensure that they effectively manage as “Risk Owners” the Regulatory and Financial Crime Compliance risks[1] inherent in or arising from the conduct of their activities and for which they are responsible. The Second LOD consists of 'Risk Stewards' who are independent of the commercial risk-taking activities undertaken by the First LOD. The Compliance function is a Risk Steward for a number of non-financial risks in accordance with HSBC Group’s risk framework.

The Assistant Manager, Advisory, Compliance for HSBC Vietnam (HBVN) is the accountable executive responsible for ensuring that HSBC’s operations in HBVN are effective in identifying, managing and mitigating Regulatory Compliance and Financial Crime risks and ensure timely advice is provided to the business.
The responsibilities of the Assistant Manager, Advisory, Compliance are to:

Support the Head of Advisory for HBVN in relation to Regulatory Compliance and Financial Crime risks.
Articulate Regulatory Compliance and Financial Crime risks faced by the business / product units assigned responsible for. Discharge responsibilities in line with the expectations of the NFRO program.
Providing compliance support, advice and guidance to CMB and GBM business / product units assigned responsible for while maintaining an effective control framework and to ensure compliance with all relevant external laws & regulations, internal codes and policies and good market practices.
Manage the relationship with relevant regulators on behalf of HBVN. Where required, interact with the regulators and industry bodies in HBVN, on regulatory matters relating to the business.
To exercise risk steward challenge and fostering a positive culture of compliance by working proactively with the business line/global function/DBS, Chief Control Office, and other compliance professionals to ensure that best practices are followed in accordance with the applicable laws, rules, regulations, and internal policy.
Serving as the regulatory coordinator for specific regulations and/or as instructed by Head of WSB and GBM advisory and provide timely and competent advisory to relevant business / product units and functions to ensure demonstrable compliance.
Assist the leadership of the Compliance function, and other colleagues on all material compliance related matters.
Follow prescribed issue escalation protocols, monitoring and surveillance of business activities and revising procedures
Qualifications
Certifications, Qualifications and Experience

Seasoned professional in managing Compliance risk within a global firm, in the financial services industry.
Extensive knowledge of the HSBC Group structure, its business and personnel, and HSBC’s corporate culture.
Lateral thinker with an ability to interpret and solve complex issues.
Excellent communication and inter-personal skills, with experience of dealing with executives at all levels.
Well-developed leadership skills.
Experience of dealing with regulatory matters and confident interaction with Regulators.

You’ll achieve more when you join HSBC.

We take pride in providing a workplace that fosters continuous professional development, flexible working and opportunities to grow within an inclusive and diverse environment. title:
Device Quality Manager, Device Quality Manager, Lab126
- job post
company: Amazon Corporate Services Vietnam Company Limited - K62
description:
Minimum of a BSME/BSIE/BSEE or related Engineering degree
Preferred 7+ years of working experience in engineering and/or quality role with 5+ years in a manufacturing quality environment.
Good understanding of electronic assembly processes mostly on consumer electronics.
Problem Solver - Deliver solutions to complex problems through in-depth data analysis and forensics, using methodical approach such as DMAIC along with experience, innovation and judgment to make decisions that may be based on partial information
Solid understanding and demonstrated success with practical applications of Lean / Six Sigma tools such as Failure Mode & Effects Analysis, Design of Experiments, Measurement System Analysis, Analysis of Variance, Hypothesis Testing, Value Stream Mapping, Pareto Charts, Gage Repeatability & Reproducibility, Cpk.
Technical knowledge of conducting process audits and formulating plans to drive continual quality improvements within the factory operations
Must be self-motivated/self-directed, is able to manage multiple work streams simultaneously and flawlessly.
Excellent oral and written communication skills in English.
Amazon Lab126 is an inventive research and development company that designs and engineers high-profile consumer electronics. Lab126 began in 2004 as a subsidiary of Amazon.com, Inc., originally creating the best-selling Kindle family of products. Since then, we have produced groundbreaking devices like Fire tablets, Fire TV, and Amazon Echo. What will you help us create?

The Role:
The Device Quality Manager (DQM) is responsible for ensuring that our products are manufactured for quality. During the new product development (NPI), the DQM will develop an out of box audit (OBA) process for factory production based on critical to customer use cases of the product. With guidance from Quality Engineering Manager (QEM) and product SW QA team, DQM will work with the contract manufacturer in delivering a robust OBA process that validates product HW/SW functionality and product cosmetics characteristics to ensure that Lab126 delivers high quality products to customers.

The DQM will also own factory quality in the sustaining phase of the product. The successful candidate will monitor production performance against established quality goals by conducting regular factory audits, partnering with Site Technical Manager (STM) to lead full investigation and failure analysis leading to root cause determination and subsequent closed loop corrective action. DQM must possess a high sense of urgency when managing critical issues. DQM will lead factory quality lessons learned and institutes remedies to prevent reoccurrence of such issues.

In addition, the DQM will provide production quality health report to management in sustaining phase and drive continuous improvement in all aspects of the job. DQM will also initiate quality pre-alert for any quality escapes from the factory impacting customers and lead cross-functional teams in problem solving activities to provide effective issue resolution.

We are open to hiring candidates to work out of one of the following locations:

Hanoi, HN, VNM

MSME/MSIE/MSEE
Six Sigma Green/Black belt, ASQ CQE/M/A certifications are highly desired.
Ability to create and innovate quality deliverables/processes during new product development and sustaining program management
Advanced understanding and deployment of quality tools
Ability to influence others and interact at all levels within the organization
Ability to deal with ambiguity

title:
Principal Product Manager, Consumer Experience - User Generated Content
- job post
description:
Job Description:
Life at Grab
At Grab, every Grabber is guided by The Grab Way, which spells out our mission, how we believe we can achieve it, and our operating principles - the 4Hs: Heart, Hunger, Honour and Humility. These principles guide and help us make decisions as we work to create economic empowerment for the people of Southeast Asia.
Get to know the Team
The Consumer Experience product team is an established team responsible for the core experience of the Grab app. Our focus spans consumer growth, engagement and loyalty. We strive to continuously engage and retain consumers on our platform, making a meaningful impact on the lives of our consumers.
The team comprises a diverse group of individuals who share a common passion for enhancing the consumer experience on Grab. If you're seeking a challenging opportunity to contribute to one of the leading Super App in Southeast Asia, we invite you to become a part of our dynamic team!
Get to know the Role
We are seeking a dynamic and highly skilled Principal Product Manager to lead and innovate in the realm of user-generated content for the consumer Grab app. As the lead for this crucial aspect of our platform, you will play an individual contributor role and shape the vision, strategy, and execution of features related to user-generated content, enabling an engaging and interactive experience for our consumers.
The Day-to-Day Activities
Product Vision and Strategy:
Develop and drive the product vision and strategy for user-generated content, aligning it with overall product vision and business objectives.
Create a roadmap that prioritizes and optimally sequences product features to enhance the user experience and increase user engagement with user-generated content.
Propose and explore new features and technologies to maintain a competitive edge and continually improve the value proposition of our platform.
Data-Driven Decisions:
Leverage data analytics and insights to understand user behavior, trends in content consumption, and areas for improvement in user-generated content features.
Use data to make informed decisions, optimize existing features, and guide the development of new features to enhance engagement and relevance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Be the leader of cross-functional teams, comprising senior engineers, designer, analysts, and country operations, to grow User Generated Content on the platform.
Foster a culture of collaboration and knowledge sharing within the team and across the organization.
Effectively communicate product updates, roadmap, and performance to stakeholders and leadership, addressing their concerns and incorporating feedback into product iterations.
Establish strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders, representing the voice of the product and fostering collaboration for mutual success.
The Must-Haves
Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or related field.
At least 8 years experience in Product Management, ideally in lead roles with a focus on user-generated content and community engagement in the tech industry.
Exceptional communication skills in English.
Proven success in defining and implementing successful product strategies and roadmaps.
Demonstrated success in creating and managing products through:
employment of design thinking in synthesizing requirements,
inclusion of customer centricity into every stage of product life cycle,
leading by influence of a large, culturally diverse and distributed team,
making data driven decisions across the product lifecycle and
demonstrated success in managing products from concept to retirement.
Exceptional analytical and strategic thinking abilities, complemented by strong project management skills.
Excellent leadership, communication, and stakeholder management skills, with a proactive and collaborative approach.
Passion for creating outstanding user experiences and a deep understanding of the food user generated content dynamics
Our Commitment
We are committed to building diverse teams and creating an inclusive workplace that enables all Grabbers to perform at their best, regardless of nationality, ethnicity, religion, age, gender identity or sexual orientation and other attributes that make each Grabber unique.

title:

description:
Ninja Van is a tech-enabled logistics company on a mission to provide hassle-free delivery services for businesses of all sizes across Southeast Asia. Launched in 2014, we started operations in Singapore and have become the region's largest and fastest growing last-mile logistics company, partnering with over 35,000 merchants and delivering more than 1,000 parcels every minute across six countries.

At our core, we are a technology company that is disrupting a massive industry with cutting-edge software and operational concepts. Powered by algorithm-based optimisation, dynamic routing, end-to-end tracking and a data-driven approach, we provide best-of-class delivery services that delight both the shippers and end customers. But we are just getting started! We have much room for improvement and many ideas that will further shape the industry.

title:
DCAI and NEX Marketing Manager - SEA & ANZ
- job post
description:
Job Description

The Datacenter and AI Group (DCAI) and the Network and Edge Group (NEX) are responsible for delivering cutting-edge solutions to our customers and partners. This role entails driving BU strategy, trends, and opportunities that align with local markets in Australia and Southeast Asia. The individual in this role is tasked with fostering alignment between Business Unit Sales and Country/Territory Marketing/Sales teams to enable the execution of product strategies, roadmaps, plans, and programs that cater to local customer needs. Responsibilities for this role encompass field and customer-related activities, including pre-launch preparation, launch and ramp readiness, partner enablement, oversight of marketing material development and production, as well as coordination of issue/opportunity management between the field and Business Unit Sales. This person will serve as a central point of expertise for Business Unit Sales in the country/territory: � Provide Cloud, AI, Network, and Edge marketing leadership for Australia and Southeast Asia, executing with and through the marketing leads in the respective countries. � Utilise advanced knowledge of the industry/technology practices and sales cycle unique to each country to acquire new customers, nurture leads, drive adoption, and accelerate growth. � Work in lockstep with sales and the regional Centre of Excellence (CoE) to develop collaborative, data-driven, insights-led marketing strategies and plans tied to the business. � Demonstrable understanding and experience of strategies, channels, and tactics used in the enterprise and mid-market customer and partner segments. � Adept at assessing market opportunity to make appropriate long-term strategic recommendations and investments whilst delivering on short-term goals. � Lead a high impact integrated marcom approach with an eye on innovation in collaboration with stakeholders across the business. Ensure the approach is mapped to a connected customer journey across the full marketing funnel with an integrated in-account content strategy targeted to customers and to, with, and thru partners. � Conduct strategic integrated planning partnering with sales on bottom's up plans with ROI focus. Ensure all activities are aligned to business and marketing strategic priorities. � Own budget management and ensure predictability. � Provide counsel, insight, and support for global, regional, and local led initiatives in the Territory. � Leverage regional and local marketing agency support as execution arm, ensuring deliverables are on track. � Ability to set targets, track, and report performance of direct and co-marketing campaign activities for quarterly business reviews and best practices sharing.
Qualifications

� Business / Marketing related University degree, Master's degree preferred � 8+ years of relevant experience in Sales and Marketing, IT industry experience desirable � Strong team player with the ability to influence, collaborate, and build relationships cross-functionally � Experience in Cloud, IOT, and AI is an advantage � Demonstrable experience in working with partners � Proven success in crafting and launching marketing strategies and plans with tangible outcomes aligned to the business strategy � Solid understanding of the full-funnel marketing approach and lead operations � Experience working across Marketing disciplines such as lead generation, account-based marketing, digital, customer journey, and product launch � Leads with integrity and professionalism � Entrepreneurial spirit � Strong attention to detail, accountability, and follow-through � Exceptional end-to-end project management skills � Solid understanding of sales motions, priorities, and interlock � Exceedingly strong communication skills across all organisational levels and diverse cultures � Ability to navigate a complex matrix organisation � Proven success in delivering exceptional white glove customer experiences
Inside this Business Group

Intel's Sales and Marketing (SMG) organization works with global customers and partners to solve critical business problems with Intel based technology solutions. SMG works across business units to amplify the customer voice and deliver solutions that accelerate their business. We work across numerous industries, including retail, enterprise and government, cloud services and healthcare as examples. The operations team focuses on forecasting, driving alignment with factory production and delivering efficiency tools and our marketing capability drives demand and localized marketing in locations around the globe. Our sales force navigates a complex partner and customer ecosystem while shaping product roadmaps, driving value for our customers, and collaborating to harness emerging technology trends to deliver comprehensive solutions.
Other Locations

MY, 07, Penang; VN, HN, Ho Chi Minh
Posting Statement

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, religious creed, sex, national origin, ancestry, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, military and veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, gender, gender expression, gender identity, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by local law, regulation, or ordinance.
Benefits

We offer a total compensation package that ranks among the best in the industry. It consists of competitive pay, stock, bonuses, as well as, benefit programs which include health, retirement, and vacation. Find more information about all of our Amazing Benefits here.
Working Model

This role is available as a fully home-based and generally would require you to attend Intel sites only occasionally based on business need. This role may also be available as our hybrid work model which allows employees to split their time between working on-site at their assigned Intel site and off-site. In certain circumstances the work model may change to accommodate business needs.

We work closely with other business teams to achieve business goals through innovative brand actions and communication campaigns. When you will be a part of the MKT team, you will have a chance to:
+ Work with our experienced marketers who have a background in top agencies in Vietnam and across functions of MarCom and MarTech as branding, digital, growth, creative, design, …
+ Join all steps of an MKT campaign and work in a full-stack agency, including finding the strategic communications, building a big idea, developing the media strategy, and optimizing & monitoring the effectiveness of each media channel.
+ Our team is supportive of each other and to help and assist when needed. We’re here to help with a tricky task, but also to crack a joke once in a while. This makes working here more pleasant and inviting.
+ Even more, we are together to create creative works & deliver modern marketing strategies to be recognized at reputable awards such as MMA Smarties, BSI Awards, …
Help you acquire marketing skills and provide you with knowledge of various marketing strategies, especially in branding & social media fields.
You will get to work with our experienced staff and practice what you learn. With engaging and challenging work, you will be able to master your skills quickly.
You will grow with the FRUIT values that are Fast Growth, Responsibility, User-first, Integrity, and Team.
Our modern offices serve perfectly for a relaxed, yet productive work environment.
You can join plenty of Sharing and Learning activities, regular team-building, and company parties.
Thank you for taking the time to read our job description and thank you in advance if you decide to apply for this position. Shortlisted candidates will be contacted within 2 weeks of application, otherwise, we might meet when another chance arises.

title:
Senior Team Leader of QA & Training
- job post
description:
Job Description:
Our Customer Service Department is looking for a Quality Assurance & Training Lead, who is able to maintain a high and consistent level of support quality across the team. The responsibility of this role is to ensure Tiki’s customers (including sellers and buyers) always receive similarly excellent experience, regardless of the agent approached or the support channel used.
The Quality Assurance & Training Lead plays an integral role within the Customer Service department and reports to the Customer Service Director.

Key Responsibilities:
Foster an environment of delivering a premium customer experience through the Customer Service Representatives (CSRs) who interact with our customers daily via phone, email, live, chat, and social media channels.
Develop and manage a robust and comprehensive Quality Assurance program that can be scaled as the team grows. This program includes the process of audits for quality, accuracy, and adherence to outlined standards. This program must measure and maintain quality standards through identified KPIs, which are tracked weekly at a team and individual level.
Identify and implement QA best practices to drive improvements to customer service quality and experiences.
Lead day-to-day quality activities to support the development and growth of the CSRs, including the delivery of clear and actionable feedback and individual coaching.
Collaborate with CS Management Team to develop action plans to improve KPIs, support implementation of process changes, track and evaluate success of process changes, and communicate results of changes to key stakeholders.
Manage internal documentation of processes and policies to ensure CSRs have access to updated information on workflows and best practices.
Assess training needs based on QA findings and develop recommendations on how best to address identified gaps, design and provide appropriate onboarding/training programs.
Ensure the completion of daily, weekly, and monthly quality assurance tasks, monitors project results to determine compliance with quality standards, and ensure delivery of project results and services.
Provide weekly/monthly reports of the CS team’s performance quality to the CS Management team.
Organize calibration sessions to maintain consistency in internal evaluations.
Evaluate and expand QA team based on implemented processes, systems, and team growth.
Participate as an active member of the CS Management Team and as the subject matter expert and thought leader in quality management and improvement.
Continuously explore emerging trends in quality and customer experience to make recommendations to our business.
Job Requirements:
College degree or above
3+ years (including managerial experience) in a Quality Assurance role within a customer service department and/or sales environment. Working in a call-center environment is a
plus.
Outstanding customer service and problem-solving skills, dedication to providing exceptional customer care. Hands-on experience in quality assurance and training/coaching.
Impeccable attention to detail, strong analytical skills as well as presentation capabilities.
Superior written & verbal communication and comprehension skills. Must be able to effectively communicate with people at all levels. Great people skills and ability to communicate (negative) feedback.
Proficient in office Microsoft Office Tools
High level of professionalism and work ethic. Maintains an optimistic and enthusiastic attitude, even under pressure.
Knowledge of Quality Assurance methods and practices (e.g. 8D, 5D, Ishikawa,...).
Benefits:
Open and transparent communication with passionate and experienced team members
A modern work environment with exposure to end-to-end business operations
Opportunities to master advanced data analytics skills
Competitive salary with an attractive performance-based bonus of up to 6 months
Private healthcare insurance and social insurance based on full salary
Annual health check-ups
Internal events to foster mutual understanding and team spirit
Working location and working time:
Location: Tiki Topia 52 Út Tịch Street, Ward 4, Tân Bình District, HCMC
Working hour: 8:00 – 18:00 from Monday to Friday

Salary: Negotiable
Location: Hồ Chí Minh
Team: Customer Services
Application deadline: 08/11 — 08/12/2023

title:
Customer Service Engineer
- job post
description:
Do you want to join us in helping to fight the world's most threatening diseases and enabling access to care for more people around the world? At Siemens Healthineers, we pioneer breakthroughs in healthcare. For everyone. Everywhere.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone to grow personally and professionally. Sound interesting?

Then come and join our Vietnam team as a Customer Service Engineer (CSE) to achieve and maintain customer satisfaction thereby ensuring the continuing profitable growth of our business and complete technical-oriented service tasks of various scopes, support in planning and managing in troubleshoot, installation, maintain the instruments and address customer support issues promptly and professionally.

Your tasks and responsibilities:

You are responsible for maintaining and installation of CT&MI Siemens machines.
You are responsible for maintaining the operating system after installation, transfer, and technical guidance at units to put the system into operation if necessary.
You are responsible for monitoring the operating status of project machines during operation, ensure work is performed according to the description table from assigned management, maintain machines according to assigned periodic schedules, and perform related work thoroughly related to repairing and resolving machine problems during the operational phase.
You should always have a progressive spirit of learning, reading, understanding, and updating new documents from the company, striving to perform well the repair, maintenance and installation of CT&MI Siemens server systems.
You should be able to work in groups, have a spirit of connection with exchanging and learning about work with group members. Record, evaluate, and promptly report factors that arise when handling incidents.
You should participate in training courses for corporations and manufacturers.
You should perform good customer service and related tasks when assigned.

To find out more about us, have a look at https://www.siemenshealthineers.com/vn/services/customerservices

Your qualifications and experience:

You are a graduate with a degree in biomedical electronics, electronics, medical equipment engineering, biomedical physics, nuclear physics, etc.
You have basic knowledge of medical equipment, specifically X-ray, CT Scanner, Ultrasound, Nuclear Medicine, etc.
You have at least 3-5 years of experience in the field of medical equipment.

Your attributes and skills:

You have good health, ability to communicate, and react quickly to all situations.
You are good at English (foreign language ability: write, read and understand technical documents well).
You are open to learn new things, enthusiastic and creative in work, have a sense of responsibility for assigned work.
You are willing to go on business trips, ensuring good technical service response timely to all assigned situations.

Our global team:

We are a team of 68,000 highly dedicated employees across more than 70 countries passionately pushing the boundaries of what’s possible in healthcare to help improve people’s lives around the world. As a leader in the industry, we aspire to create better outcomes and experiences for patients no matter where they live or what health issues they are facing. Our portfolio, spanning from in-vitro and in-vivo diagnostics to image-guided therapy and innovative cancer care, is crucial for clinical decision-making and treatment pathways.

Our culture:

We are part of an incredible community of scientists, clinicians, developers, researchers, professionals, and skilled specialists pushing the boundaries of what’s possible, to improve people’s lives around the world. We embrace a culture of inclusivity in which the power and potential of every individual can be unleashed. We spark ideas that lead to positive impact and continued success.

We care about your data privacy and take compliance with GDPR as well as other data protection legislation seriously. For this reason, we ask you not to send us your CV or resume by email. We ask instead that you create a profile in our talent community where you can upload your CV. Setting up a profile lets us know you are interested in career opportunities with us and makes it easy for us to send you an alert when relevant positions become open. Click here to get started.

To all recruitment agencies: Siemens Healthineers does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our job’s alias, employees, or any other company location. Siemens Healthineers is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

BENEFIT Competitive salary, 13th month salary, sales commission, bonus and ESOP package Premium healthcare insurance 12 days of annual leave & 5 days of sick leave Performance appraisals and promotion every year Standard health check Company trip, Year end party, Team building Occasion-based offerings: Birthday, wedding, maternity, … Parking support Equipment for work (PC / laptop) Free in-house entertainment facilities: foosball, book tree, coffee and snack. WHY YOU SHOULD APPLY TO THIS POSITION?
